description:
DevOps Engineer (m/w/d)
Standorte: Berlin, Bonn, Dresden, Jena oder Leipzig
du willst nicht nur dich, sondern auch ein bisschen die Welt verändern?
Dann tue das bei der T-Systems Multimedia Solutions GmbH.
Denn als größter Digitaldienstleister Deutschlands gestalten wir gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden in einem stetig wachsenden Markt die digitale Welt.
Developer, Automatisierung, DevOps, System Engineer, System Engineering, Systemadministrator, Softwareentwickler, Linux, Terraform, Kubernetes
deine Zukunft als DevOps Engineer

Als DevOps Engineer unterstützt du unser Operations-Team und stellen einen reibungslosen Betrieb der IT-Infrastruktur unserer Kunden sowie innerhalb der T-Systems MMS sicher. Gemeinsam mit deinem Team bedienst du die unterschiedlichsten Kundenanforderungen in Fragen Größe, Komplexität, Sicherheit oder Prozessintegration. Dein Part als DevOps Engineer in unserem Team:

Erstellung von DevOps- und Automatisierungskonzepten
(z.B. im Cloud- oder LAMP Umfeld)
Umsetzung System-Architekturen gemäß Kunden- und Sicherheitsanforderungen
Optimierung bestehender Infrastrukturen hinsichtlich DevOps Automatisierungsansätzen
Zusammenarbeit mit Systemadministratoren, Softwareentwickler und unseren Kunden

Einen Überblick, welche Leistungen wir u.a. im Bereich Web Applications und Cloud anbieten findest du hier.

dein Hintergrund Devops engineer

Deine bisherigen Erfahrungen haben dich zu der Person gemacht, die du heute bist: Ein aufgeweckter Teamplayer mit Macherqualitäten, der ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten mitbringt. Zudem hast du Freude am Kundensupport und der Optimierung bestehender Systeme und besitzt Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch. Deine Basics als System Engineer DevOps:

IT-Studium oder vergleichbare Ausbildung
Know-how im Aufbau und Betrieb (vorwiegend Linux basierender) hoch-verfügbarer Web-Applikationen (Apps) und Systemlösungen
Erste Erfahrung mit OpenSource Technologien oder DevOps Tools (z.B. Docker, Chef, Puppet, Jenkins, Ansible, Kubernetes, Terraform etc.)
Ein Plus, kein muss
Softwareentwicklungserfahrung (z.B. mit Java) oder Know-how zu Cloudtechnologien z.B. AWS (Amazon Web Services) oder Azure
Know-how in IT Sicherheit oder Datenschutz
deine Vorteile bei uns

Warum du zu T-Systems Multimedia Solutions GmbH kommen solltest?
Weil du bei uns unter besten Bedingungen die digitale Revolution mitgestalten kannst:

Flexible Vertrauensarbeitszeit
38h/ Woche

Mobiles Arbeiten möglich

Attraktive betriebliche Altersvorsorge

Vielzahl individueller Weiterbildungsangebote

Vielzahl an Mitarbeitervorteilen und -rabatten

State of the Art Equipment

Übrigens: Bei uns zählt der Mensch! Wir denken nicht in Kategorien wie Geschlecht, ethnische Herkunft, Religion, Alter, sexuelle Identität oder Behinderung. Wir leben Vielfalt und lehnen Diskriminierung entscheidend ab!

Bereit für die digitale Revolution?
Dann bewirb dich! Zeige uns, wer du heute bist, wo du hinwillst oder
wo du bereits angekommen bist.
deine Ansprechpartnerin
du hast noch Fragen oder suchst nach fachspezifischen Informationen? Zögere nicht und kontaktiere mich jederzeit. Carolina Matthies +49 351 - 2820 - 7555 | T-Systems Multimedia Solutions.com/karriere

Bei uns findest Du anspruchsvolle Aufgaben mit abwechslungsreichen Themen- und Problemstellungen, eine Gestaltungsaufgabe mit Verantwortung und ein kollegiales und motiviertes Arbeitsumfeld. Für unser Berliner Büro suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt Verstärkung für unseren Bereich Application Development.

Was dich erwartet:
Du wirst Teil unseres innovativen und agilen Scrum-Entwicklungsteams
Technologisch herausfordernde Entwicklung unterschiedlichster neuer Funktionalitäten für unsere Applications & Microservices
Mitverantwortung für die Wahl der richtigen Technologien zur Weiterentwicklung der IT-Gesamtarchitektur
Sicherstellung eines reibungslosen Betriebs bestehender Anwendungen auf verschiedenen Endgeräten
Austausch innerhalb eines teamorientierten, dynamischen und professionellen Entwicklerteams
Konzipierung und Realisierung spannender Projekte in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Produktmanagement
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Frontend und Machine Learning Research
Was du mitbringst:
Spaß an sauberem Code und Lust in einem agilen Team zu arbeiten
Gute Kenntnisse in PHP
Idealerweise Kenntnisse in Symfony, Doctrine & Elasticsearch
Neugierde oder Erfahrung im DevOps-Bereich von Vorteil
Erfahrung im Umgang mit Tests und Continuous-Integration-Systemen
Selbstständige und serviceorientierte Arbeitsweise
Zuverlässigkeit, Teamfähigkeit, Flexibilität und Qualitätsbewusstsein
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Was wir bieten:
Offene und kreative Arbeitsatmosphäre im Team mit flachen Hierarchien
Umfassendes Leistungspaket mit BVG-Ticket, betrieblicher Altersvorsorge, Zusatzgesundheitsversicherung u.v.m.
Ein Büro direkt am Fernsehturm in Berlin-Mitte
Corona-kompatible Homeoffice-Optionen
Sehr flexible, familien- und coderfreundliche Arbeitszeiten
Kostenlose Getränke und Bio-Obst sowie weitere Benefits
DEMOS erbringt Dienstleistungen im Spannungsfeld von Urbanisierung, Mobilität und Klimawandel. Mit intelligenten Prozessen und innovativer Software unterstützen wir die digitale Transformation und helfen dabei Beteiligungsprozesse transparent und digital durchzuführen, damit Planung und Genehmigung von neuen Wohngebieten oder dringend benötigten Anlagen und Trassen für die Energiewende besser und dennoch schneller erfolgen. Gemeinsam im Team arbeiten wir daher jeden Tag an neuen Lösungen, die mit Hilfe künstlicher Intelligenz die Grundlage schaffen, um wachsende Anforderungen einer modernen Gesellschaft zu meistern.

DEMOS steht für gelebte Vielfalt und schätzt daher alle Bewerbungen, unabhängig der Nationalität, der ethnischen und/oder sozialen Herkunft, des Geschlechts, der Religion oder Weltanschauung, einer Behinderung, des Alters oder der sexuellen Identität.

Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

Art der Stelle: Vollzeit, Festanstellung

Arbeitszeiten:
Keine Wochenenden
Montag bis Freitag
Leistungen:
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Betriebliche Weiterbildung
Flexible Arbeitszeiten
Homeoffice
Kostenlose Getränke
Kostenloses oder Vergünstigtes Essen
Zusätzliche Urlaubstage
Homeoffice:
Temporär, aufgrund von COVID-19

Die integrationWorks GmbH ist ein wachsendes IT-Dienstleistungsunternehmen. Wir unterstützen unsere Kunden mit maßgeschneiderten IT-Lösungen von der Beratung, Schulung und Entwicklung bis hin zum Outsourcing. Wir betreuen mit unseren Standorten in Berlin, München und Düsseldorf namhafte Kunden im Banken- und Versicherungsbereich sowie in der Automobilbranche. Im Zuge unserer stetigen Expansion erweitern wir unser SAP Core Banking Team und suchen dafür Dich (m/w/d) als erfahrenen Entwickler im SAP-Core-Banking Umfeld.

Deine Aufgaben
Mitarbeit in Projekten bei der Einführung oder Erweiterung von SAP Core-Banking-Modulen
Analyse der Development-Anforderungen und die Erstellung von individuellen Lösungskonzepten
Umsetzung der Anforderungen durch Neuentwicklung eigener und/oder Erweiterung der SAP-Module
Überprüfung der Arbeitsergebnisse durch Anwendung von Testverfahren
Dein Profil
Abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Mathematik, BWL oder im Wirtschafts-Ingenieurwesen
Fundierte Entwickler-Kenntnisse mit ABAP, ABAP-OO, UI5
Kenntnisse im SAP-Hana Umfeld sind wünschenswert
Mindestens fünf Jahre Erfahrung als Entwickler bei Projekten oder in Festanstellung im Banken und/oder Finanzdienstleisterumfeld
Erfahrungen im oder Interesse am Beratungsgeschäft mit vorhandener Reisebereitschaft
Ausgeprägte Kunden-, Dienstleistungs- und Teamorientierung
Sehr gute kommunikative und soziale Skills
Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englisch-Kenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Was wir dir bieten
Eine anspruchsvolle Tätigkeit im Umfeld von Top-Finanzdienstleistern in Deutschland
Eine leistungsgerechte Vergütung mit Bonussystem in einem unbefristeten Arbeitsverhältnis
Mitarbeit in einem jungen internationalen Team mit Aufstiegschancen
Flexible Arbeitsplatzmodelle
Regelmäßige Firmenevents
Vielfältige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Flache Hierarchien
Firmenhandy
Kostenlose Getränke, Obst und kleine Snacks
Art der Stelle: Vollzeit

Sprache:
Englisch (Bevorzugt)
Deutsch (Bevorzugt)
Homeoffice:
Ja

Sicher und innovativ – auch in Krisenzeiten*
Wir sind kontinentaleuropäischer Marktführer für sichere mobile Kommunikationslösungen und suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen DevOps Engineer (w/m/d) in Vollzeit an unserem Standort in Berlins Mitte. In dieser Position bilden Sie die Schnittstelle zwischen unserem agilen Entwicklungsteam und dem operativen Betrieb.

Bei uns haben Sie die Möglichkeit, sich von Anfang an in verschiedene Projekte einzubringen, dabei an neuen Ideen und Innovationen mitzuarbeiten und damit die Zukunft des professionellen Mobilfunks aktiv mit zu gestalten.
Wer wir sind*
Wir bieten verschiedene Dienste und Lösungen zur professionellen Alarmierung und Warnung für Industrie, Gewerbe, Logistik, Behörden, Feuerwehren, Rettungsdienste und Hilfsorganisationen.

Damit leisten wir einen entscheidenden Beitrag zur öffentlichen Sicherheit, besonders in Krisen- und Katastrophenfällen. Unsere langjährigen Kunden und Mitarbeiter schätzen unsere Zuverlässigkeit und Kontinuität in einem stabilen Marktumfeld sowie unsere innovativen Produkte und Lösungen, für die wir u. a. mit dem Innovationspreis Berlin Brandenburg ausgezeichnet wurden.
Aufgaben*
Unterstützung eines agilen Entwicklungsteams
Konzeption und Inbetriebnahme von Infrastrukturkomponenten für die "automatische Bereitstellung" (IaaS)
Auswahl, Anwendung, Erstellung und Optimierung von Werkzeugen im Bereich "Continuous Delivery"
Konzeption, Überwachung und Optimierung der im Bereich "Deployment/Continuous Delivery" verwendeten Prozesse
3rd-Level-Support für Betriebsteam
Anforderungen*
Ein abgeschlossenes Informatik-Studium, eine Ausbildung zum Fachinformatiker für Systemintegration (w/m/d) oder eine vergleichbare Berufserfahrung
Gute Linux-Kenntnisse
Grundverständnis und Interesse in den Themenbereichen Automatisierung und Continuous Deployment
Praktische Erfahrungen in der Verwendung von Versionsverwaltungen (git)
Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Gewissenhafte Arbeitsweise, kommunikativ und koordinierend
Wünschenswerte Ergänzungen zu diesem Profil sind:
Kenntnisse in einer oder mehreren Skriptsprachen
Praktische Erfahrungen in Virtualisierungstechniken (Openstack / KVM)
Erfahrungen mit Container-Umgebungen (Kubernetes / Swarm)
Wir bieten*
Einen modernen Arbeitsplatz im Herzen Berlins (nahe U-Bhf. Senefelderplatz)
Eine offene Unternehmenskultur mit kurzen Entscheidungswegen
Eine unbefristete Anstellung in Vollzeit
Eine attraktive, leistungsbasierte Vergütung
Weiterbildungs- und persönliche Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten
Ein motiviertes und kollegiales Arbeitsumfeld mit regelmäßigen Firmenevents
Flexible Arbeitszeiten
Zusätzliche Vergütungen wie Sodexo-Schecks
Eine angenehme mitarbeiterorientierte Arbeitsatmosphäre
Helle, modern ausgestattete Büroräume mit vielen Kunstwerken an den Wänden
Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt?*
Dann freuen wir uns auf die Zusendung Ihrer vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (Anschreiben, Lebenslauf, Zeugnisse / Referenzschreiben) inklusive Angaben Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellungen. Bei organisatorischen und fachlichen Fragen wenden Sie sich gerne an Frau Ulrike Kieper.

Key words: DevOps Engineer , Ingenieur , Informatik , IT , Linux , Kubernetes

Art der Stelle: Vollzeit

Arbeitszeiten:
Keine Wochenenden
Montag bis Freitag
Leistungen:
Betriebliche Weiterbildung
Flexible Arbeitszeiten
Homeoffice

Scala DEVELOPER (M/F/X)*
_Berlin, Germany_

Bei KptnCook steht der Spaß am selbstgekochten Essen im Vordergrund. Wir suchen eine\*n Scala Developer\*In für unser Berliner Büro, die uns leidenschaftlich bei der Vision unterstützt, mehr Menschen zu Hause mit leckeren Rezepten zum Kochen zu inspirieren.

Seit der Gründung des Unternehmens im Jahr 2014 hat sich KptnCook zur führenden mobilen Food- & Shopping-App in Deutschland entwickelt. Wir haben viele internationale Auszeichnungen gewonnen, darunter den German Design Award 2020. Hunderttausende Nutzer\*Innen kochen jeden Tag begeistert unsere Rezepte zu Hause nach. Die KptnCook-Crew besteht aus ca. 20 Mitarbeiter\*Innen und hat ihr Büro im schönen Berlin Neukölln.
DEINE ROLLE*
Als Teil unseres Backend-Teams betreust du unsere Server-Anwendungen und APIs.
Du arbeitest interdisziplinär mit anderen Teams zusammen, um neue Funktionen zu definieren, zu entwerfen und zu implementieren
Du erweiterst unser Datenmodell und arbeitest an regelmäßigen Updates
DEIN PROFIL*
Du hast mind. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Backend-Development mit Scala.
Du hast einen Abschluss in Informatik oder einem vergleichbaren Fach
Du bist mit dem Play2-Framework vertraut
Du kennst dich gut mit MongoDB, Postgres u.ä. aus
Du hast Erfahrung mit Heroku, Digital Ocean, Amazon AWS, Google Cloud
Du verstehst den Aufbau moderner Frameworks, MVP und object-oriented-Design
Du liebst es, mit Tools wie Git und modernen IDEs zu arbeiten
Du arbeitest gerne hands-on als Backend-Ingenieur\*In in einer agilen Umgebung
Du handelst eigenverantwortlich und hast dabei immer die beste User-Experience für unsere Nutzer im Blick
Du kannst sehr gut kommunizieren und allen Teammitgliedern, auch aus weniger tech-affinen Bereichen, komplexe technische Probleme klar und einfach erklären.
Du hast Lust, deine Skills eigenständig zu verbessern, bist offen und neugierig auf neue Ansätze und lernst gerne von den Erfahrungen anderer
Du hast sehr gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Du liebst Kochen und Essen : )
DAS BIETEN WIR DIR*
Flache Hierarchien und transparente Kommunikation in einem hochmotivierten, sympathischen Team.
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit für Home-Office (auch nach Corona)
After-Work-BBQs in unserem schönen Hinterhof, gemeinsame Koch-Sessions, Team-Events, Tischtennis-Turniere, freie Snacks und Getränke
Leckeres Essen aus unserer Test-Küche
Ein lauschiges Büro im schönen Neukölln mit Blick ins Grüne
WIE GEHTS WEITER?*
Begeistert dich die Idee, Teil unserer Crew zu werden? Dann schicke uns deine Bewerbung mit Lebenslauf, frühestem Starttermin und einem Anschreiben, das dein Interesse und deine einzigartigen Qualifikationen am besten zum Ausdruck bringt.
Wir freuen uns, von dir zu hören!*
Art der Stelle: Vollzeit, Freie Mitarbeit, Festanstellung

Berufserfahrung:
Entwicklung: 3 Jahre (Bevorzugt)
Software Development: 3 Jahre (Bevorzugt)
Homeoffice:
Temporär, aufgrund von COVID-19

Wer wir sind: *
Biting Bit ist ein sorgfältig zusammengesetztes Team aus 18 furchtlosen Technologienerds, unkomplizierten Querdenkern, humorvollen Problemlösern, zuverlässigen Architekten, pfiffigen Strategen und leidenschaftlichen Innovatoren.

Wir bieten Individualprogrammierung von Websites, bei denen sich der Code Zeile um Zeile an die Anforderungen anpasst. Wir arbeiten nicht mit Templates oder vorprogrammierten Tools, die Systeme verlangsamen oder stoppen können. Wir programmieren Apps mit herausragender User Experience in funktionalem Design für eine möglichst hohe intuitive Nutzung. Außerdem entwickeln wir Software - von der spezifischen Funktion bis zu komplexen Systemen. Neben komplexen Systemen erstellen wir Bibliotheken und Schnittstellen, ermöglichen die Integration von Drittanbietersoftware, reparieren schadhaften Code und vieles mehr!

Derzeit sind wir auf der Suche nach einem *Senior iOS Developer (m/w/d)* für unser Büro in Berlin-Mitte oder auch REMOTE aus ganz Deutschland.
Deine Aufgaben: *
Umsetzung und Mitgestaltung von innovativen iOS-Apps
Beratung von Designern in Bezug auf Benutzererlebnisse
Iterationen mit kundeninternen und externen Stakeholder
Mitarbeit in einem interdisziplinären und agilen Entwicklungsteam
Deine Skills: *
Egal welche Ausbildung oder welches Studium Du absolviert hast - für uns ist wichtig, dass Du Erfahrung und Spaß bei der Entwicklung von iOS-Anwendungen mitbringst
Hervorragende Fähigkeiten in Swift / Objective-C
Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von iOS-Anwendungen
Fähigkeit sich schnell in neue Bereiche und Technologien einzuarbeiten
Sprachen: verhandlungssicheres deutsch ist erforderlich (business fluent german is required)
Bei Biting Bit erwartet Dich: *
Arbeiten im Expertenteam (das bedeutet Weiterentwicklung für Dich und für uns)
Unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag
Duz-Kultur auf Augenhöhe
Arbeitsmittel auf dem neusten technischen Stand
Moderne Büroräumlichkeiten und freie Wohlfühl-Arbeitsplatzgestaltung
Home Office und flexible Arbeitszeiten
Faire Bezahlung je nach Erfahrungsschatz und Kompetenz
4 Sonnenterrassen mitten in Berlin
Kostenlose Getränke & Snacks
Biting Bit Poker Turniere inkl. Wanderpokal
Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

Art der Stelle: Vollzeit, Festanstellung

Gehalt: 44.000,00€ - 60.000,00€ pro Jahr

Arbeitszeiten:
Montag bis Freitag
Leistungen:
Betriebliche Weiterbildung
Flexible Arbeitszeiten
Homeoffice
Kostenlose Getränke
Mitarbeiter-Rabatt
Berufserfahrung:
Swift / Objective-C: 3 Jahre (Erforderlich)
Sprache:
Deutsch (Erforderlich)

Deine Aufgaben*
Extending existing services and APIs or setting them up from scratch
Work in an inspiring environment that continuously requires you to learn new things and push yourself
Apply cutting-edge technologies to solve new challenges every day
Cover new functionality with both unit and functional tests to make your work bullet-proof
Dein Profil*
You have experience in at least some of our used technologies: PHP7.2, Symfony3.4, MySQL, MongoDB, RabbitMQ, Elasticsearch, Redis, Docker, k8s, Go
You want to push and improve things and want to learn continuously
You are dedicated, communicative, team oriented and you have the enthusiasm to see how your code has an effect on the whole company
Was wir bieten*
Usage of state-of-the-art technologies/methologies such as PHP7.2 / go based microservices, Docker / Kubernetes, Prometheus
Established code review and CI/ CD processes to make sure we ship safe and fast
An ambitious and challenging job in a successful startup
Regular feedback as well as support and help with all questions
A steep learning curve and cross-departmental insights
Great creative leeway for your ideas
A solid and central position with a competitive salary and education budget
A modern workspace in our loft in Prenzlauer Berg, Berlin (10 minutes away from Alexanderplatz)
Spectacular team events
Bewirb dich jetzt!*
We look forward to receiving your convincing application (cover letter, resume, references) via jobs@legal.one including your availability, salary expectations, and an answer to the question: What challenges do you face in (micro-)service-oriented environments?
Über uns*
Legal One steht für Pionierarbeit und Unternehmergeist im Markt für Rechtsdienstleistungen. Wir sind davon überzeugt, dass Anwälte mit Hilfe von Legal Tech bessere Ergebnisse für ihre Mandanten erzielen können. Wir finden, dass komplexe Probleme einfache Lösungen verdienen. Uns ist wichtig, dass Rechtsdienstleistungen zeitgemäß und kostengünstig erbracht und von allen Menschen in Anspruch genommen werden können.

Unser schnell wachsendes Legal Tech Startup aus Berlin besteht aus erfahrenen Unternehmern und Experten aus den Bereichen IT, Business Intelligence, Performance Marketing, Legal und BPO. Gemeinsam arbeiten wir an den Rechtsprodukten- und Dienstleistungen der nächsten Generation.

Job Type: Full-time

After funding the company in 2014 KptnCook became the leading mobile food & shopping app in Germany. We won several international awards, such as the Google Material Design Award 2018 and help hundreds of thousands of users every day to become better cooks at home. Currently we are a team of 20 based in Berlin Neukölln.
What’s in it for you*
Flat hierarchies and transparent communication within a highly motivated, friendly team
Flexible working hours and the possibility for home office
After-Work-BBQ in our nice yard, cooking sessions, team events, table tennis, free snacks and drinks (currently limited because of corona though)
Great food from our studio test kitchen
A beautiful office in Berlin Neukölln
Your ROLE*
As part of our Android-Team, design and build an award winning, successful application
for the Android platform
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features
Maintain high level performance quality
Contribute to our growth with innovation in tech and user experience
YOUR PROFILE*
You have at least worked 3 years consistently on Android Apps
You have a a degree in Computer Science or a related technical field
You are experienced in writing readable and maintainable Kotlin code
You have great understanding of Advanced RxJava, Dependency Injection and testing of Android Apps
You enjoying working as a hands-on Software Engineer in an agile environment
You have a deep understanding of our product, care about usability and a beautiful UI
You are an excellent communicator with the ability to clearly explain complex technical issues to all team members.
You are a lifelong learner who is constantly improving skills and loves to learn from others.
You have good English skills (spoken and written)
You are passionate about food and cooking.
HOW DO YOU Become a Kptn?*
If you’re excited by the idea of joining our crew, please apply with your CV, your earliest starting date and a cover letter that best expresses your interest and unique qualifications. We are looking forward to hear from you!

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:
Flexible Schedule
Work From Home

We are TravelPerk: a fast-growing, well-funded startup that has raised nearly $134m since our creation in early 2015. Backed by world-class investors in some of tech's most disruptive companies, including Slack, Trello, Twitter, Farfetch, Deliveroo and Delivery Hero, our team is made up of A-players from the travel industry.

We've been named the fastest-growing SaaS startup in the world by the SaaS1000 and featured as one of the hottest startups to watch by both Forbes and Wired. We're revolutionizing the B2B corporate travel market, worth over $1.3 trillion, by simplifying the process for everyone involved.

Are you a Software Engineer with extensive programming experience? Is your code fast, efficient and reliable? Do you particularly enjoy working with amazing people, having fun at work and building something awesome? If so, let's talk!

We're not looking for stack experts. We're looking for smart people who can bring in the best tools and processes to get the job done. Read more about our engineering team in this blog post by our Senior Director of Engineering, Ivan Peralta.

You will work on a day-to-day basis with our product team to design, architect and implement our product. TravelPerk is a next-generation platform to take the pain out of booking and managing business travel.

As Senior Software Engineer, this position involves:
Product development in Python/Django and/or React of a travel-related web-based product.
Integrations between our product to 3rd party APIs.
System architecture design, implementation, and testing.
Work in an Agile environment with strong attention to a well-documented code, unit testing, and continuous integration.
Being able to mentor, coach, and train other colleagues as a domain expert.
Required skills and experience:
"Product Engineering" mindset.
Pragmatism and obsession for simplicity, efficiency, and performance.
Extensive experience in similar roles building technically complex products in any web programming language. Successful candidates usually have 5 years of experience or more.
An expert level at server-side, client-side or full stack development. Your final role within the team will depend on your skills and internal training will be provided.
Obsession for quality and testing.
Eager to learn new technologies and frameworks.
Strong communication skills (in English).
Bonus points for:
Experience in the travel industry.
DevOps experience with the AWS suite.
Experience working with high-performing, Agile development teams.
People who like to build stuff (we really like people who maintain/contribute to open source projects).
What do we offer?
Competitive compensation including equity in the company.
Vacation days: 25 in Germany.
Flexibility to work from home most of the time.
Health perks, these vary depending on your location (statutory in Germany).
"Flexible compensation plan" to help you diversify and increase the net salary.
Perks such as language lessons, yoga and office food have been put on hold during COVID-19 and will be reviewed.
Flexible Work Policy
Until local governments and health professionals say it is safe to work from an office, TravelPerk will offer you 100% remote working from the country you are employed in.
Once it is safe, you will need to be based in or relocate to Germany for this position.
You can be based anywhere in the country you are employed from but we will require you to travel to the office hub in your country in Berlin once per week.
In addition, every six weeks you will be required to travel to an office hub location for 3 to 5 days to meet with your whole team and sometimes the rest of the company for an event.
We have core working hours between 10:00-15:00 CET.
Team members that want to go to the office more than once per week are welcome to!
We can help with relocation from anywhere in the world. English is the official language at the office. Please submit your resume in English if you choose to apply.

TravelPerk is a global company with a diverse customer base—and we want to make sure the people behind our product reflect that. We're an equal opportunity employer, which means you're welcome at TravelPerk regardless of how you look, where you're from, or anything else that makes you, well, you.

position: Senior Software Engineer - Unreal Engine specialized in networking
description:
At Phantasma Labs we value diversity and we want to encourage everyone to apply for this position, especially individuals from underrepresented backgrounds. We strive to create a candid and inclusive work environment where the best talents can thrive to reach their full potential. We want to build software as diverse as the world.

Who we are

We are Phantasma Labs and we are building massive simulations to teach self - driving cars human behavior. 28 days of paid vacation

position: Senior Software Backend Engineer - Product Offer Platform - Scala/Java
description:
ABOUT THE TEAM

Department: Digital Experience

Reports to: Engineering Lead

As a Senior Backend Engineer in the Product Offer Platform, you will design, develop and operate business-critical applications at the heart of Zalando that process tens of thousands of events per second powering the critical customer-facing web and mobile applications such as the Product Detail Page, the Cart, the Wishlist, and the Checkout. You will work with tools and technologies such as Scala, Java, Akka, AWS, Kubernetes, Postgres, and Elasticsearch in building high-performant, low latency systems to create an impact on customers and partners.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED

Design, build and operate large-scale data streaming and processing applications serving product offer data with the latency of tens of milliseconds in magnitude to all countries Zalando operates in using technologies such as Scala, Java, Akka, Postgres, and Elasticsearch
Evaluate and implement leading-edge technologies and optimize platform performance in terms of throughput, read-latency, scalability, and reliability.
Ensure a state-of-the-art software development methodology.
Share your knowledge with your colleagues and help them grow their technical skills.

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

5+ years of professional experience as a Software Engineer.
Proficiency in designing and developing APIs and high-volume data streaming and processing systems with either Scala or Java.
Hands-on experience with SQL and NoSQL storage technologies.
Familiarity with AWS, Kubernetes, Akka toolkit, and Elasticsearch is a plus.
"You build it, you run it" approach: experience managing services end-to-end, from developing to deploying to monitoring and incident support.
Eagerness to optimize data streaming and processing systems for the best possible performance to have a positive impact on customers and partners.
Passion for working in an agile, cross-functional team, iterating quickly during the product development cycle.
Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with business stakeholders, product managers, and engineering peers.

PERKS AT WORK

Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)

We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

ABOUT ZALANDO

Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

Product Offer Platform is the central platform within Zalando that combines product data with price and stock information into product offers. We provide the sales channels across Zalando with all offers they may sell with up to 15,000 updates per second and at the same time make sure that they are of high quality to provide our customers with the best shopping experience.

Product Offer Platform consists of three agile teams and we are looking for several Senior Backend Engineers who would like to work in a very innovative environment with cutting-edge technologies, making sound technical decisions and delivering value for our customers.

Please note that all the applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

#softwareengineer #softwareengineering #backend #scala #aws #backendengineer #softwareentwickler

At Camunda, we have a simple goal: automate any processes, anywhere. All the way from Zalando’s online shop to NASA’s space missions, processes are everywhere, and at Camunda we have made it our mission to enable organizations to design, automate and improve these processes — no matter where they are and what they entail.

Camunda is an open source software company innovating process automation with a developer-friendly approach that is standards-based, highly scalable and collaborative for business and IT. A community of tens of thousands of users across companies such as Vodafone, ING, Allianz, Lufthansa and Atlassian design, automate and improve mission-critical business processes end-to-end with Camunda. Camunda has been repeatedly recognized by Deloitte as a high-growth company and has a presence in Germany, United States, UK, Singapore and Australia.

Role description:


Modeling notations need excellent tools. We are looking for software engineers who are passionate about building excellent graphical tooling- open-source, hackable and with love for the web. As a developer at Camunda you'll be empowered to make your own decisions and you can always rely on the help and input of your teammates at the same time.

Are you passionate about user experience? Do you recognize clean code? Do you value collaboration, feedback and taking on challenging tasks? Work as a bpmn.io core team member at Camunda in Berlin to build and improve our modeling tools.

What you’ll do:
Design and implement new features and maintain & improve existing features in our graphical open-source modeling tools
Further enhance our code base quality by involving yourself in reviews, architecture and clean code discussions
Bring your own ideas (e.g., by implementing prototypes) and work together with UX and product management to deliver excellent features, User Interface and API design
What you’ll bring along:

Knowledge of modern web standards (HTML5, CSS, SVG, ...) and state of the art application development
Real passion for usability and interest in user interface and API design
Experienced in Software Development practices (e.g., OOP, SOLID principles, TDD)
Pragmatism and passion to discuss, dissect and apply technology
The ability to pursue complex challenges, together with your team
Knowledge about modeling notations, experience with backend technologies and an open-source mindset is a plus
What we have to offer:

A high growth software company with 4.7 Glassdoor rating and a >90% CEO approval.
A team of wonderful and highly qualified colleagues working in a friendly and agile environment
Freedom of choice for your technical equipment, e.g. Mac or Linux or Windows
Flexible working conditions and ability to work from home
Competitive Salary & Full Benefits, including incl. 30 days of paid vacation
Free Sports Club passes
Free German and English classes
Camunda is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company.

Did we pique your interest? Apply now and learn more. For a complete list of jobs at Camunda, please check out: www.camunda.com/career/.

position: Unity 3D Senior Developer / Unity Senior Entwickler
description:
Job description*
Are you a passionate Unity developer? Unity is your playground, the code is your brush? And on top of that, are you curious about what you can get out of your favorite engine beyond the classic gameplay? Then your search ends here.
What we do*
We are Soulside: a cross-platform mobile app that focuses on three-dimensional user-generated content. Soulside users create virtual spaces and share them with others to experience. They place shapes and images on the walls and objects in space. They paint them with color, gradients, and patterns then set them in motion. Users can even generate music to fit the mood. In this way, they express their feelings, visualize thoughts and give their inner-self a concrete expression. The creative process and tools are as easy as a TikTok video or Instagram posting.
Personal requirements: *
· Ability to work in a start-up atmosphere

· Creative, holistic, and able to think outside-of-the-box

· Joy of experimentation

· Goal-oriented, independent, interdisciplinary work

· High standards of quality

· Clear and open communication skills

· Reliability and resilience
Your qualifications: *
· Completed studies in computer science, game development, or a similar field of study

· Expert knowledge in the Unity engine

· Very good knowledge of C# (experience with C++ is a plus)

· Backend programming experience is a huge plus

· Strong knowledge of technical practices. We especially value: Domain-Driven Design (DDD), SOLID, TDD, Refactoring, Clean Code, CI/CD (you don't need to be an expert in all areas, but we expect you to have the desire to grow in these areas).

· Strong theoretical background (Data Structures, Algorithms, 3D Mathematics)

· Experience with Shader Programming would be a big plus

· Knowledge of the Atlassian toolchain (Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket)
Your skills: *
· Ability to work in a team

· Broad interest in topics such as society, culture, architecture, art, design, lifestyle, and music

· Creative, holistic, and divergent thinking

· Open to experimentation

· Goal-oriented, independent, interdisciplinary work ethic

· High-quality standard

· Strong written and speaking ability

· Reliability and resilience

Type of post: Full-time
Du bist leidenschaftlicher 3D-Entwickler mit künstlerischem Selbstverständnis? Unity ist deine Leinwand, der Code dient dir als Pinsel? Und obendrein bist du neugierig, was sich abseits des klassischen Gamings aus deiner Lieblings-Engine rausholen lässt? Dann suchen wir dich.*
Was wir tun

Wir entwickeln Soulside: eine App für iOS und Android, in dessen Zentrum dreidimensionaler User-Generated-Content steht. Soulside-Nutzer gestalten virtuelle Räume, teilen sie mit anderen und machen sie dadurch erfahrbar. Sie platzieren Formen, Bilder an den Wänden und Objekte im Raum, versehen sie mit buntem Anstrich, Verläufen und Mustern, bringen sie in Bewegung und lassen das Werk sogar erklingen. So drücken sie ihre Gefühle aus, visualisieren Gedanken und verleihen ihrem inneren Selbst einen konkreten Ausdruck. Der kreative Prozess und die Anwendung der gestalterischen Werkzeuge geht so leicht von der Hand gehen, wie ein TikTok-Video oder Instagram-Posting.

Welche konkreten Qualifikationen und Kompetenzen wir für diese Aufgabe als unabdingbar erachten, wollen wir dir natürlich nicht vorenthalten:
Fachliche Qualifikationen: *
· Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich (Medien-) Informatik oder einer ähnlichen Fachrichtung

· Expertenkenntnisse der Unity-Engine

· Sehr gute Kenntnisse in C# ,C++

· Backend-Programmiererfahrung

· Ausgeprägte Kenntnisse der technischen Praktiken. Wir legen besonderen Wert auf:

Domain-Driven Design, SOLID, TDD, Refactoring, Clean Code, CI/CD (Du musst kein Experte in allen Bereichen sein, wir erwarten aber dass du den Wunsch hast sich in diesen Bereichen zu entwickeln)

· Starker theoretischer Hintergrund (Data Strukturen, Algorithmen, 3D Mathematics)

· Erfahrung mit Shader-Programmierung wäre ein großes Plus

· Kenntnisse der Toolkette von Atlassian (Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket)
Persönliche Qualifikationen: *
· Fähigkeit in einer Startup Atmosphäre zu arbeiten

· Teamfähigkeit

· Kreatives, ganzheitliches, unangepasstes Denken

· Experimentierfreude

· Zielorientiertes, eigenverantwortliches, interdisziplinäres Arbeiten

· Hoher Qualitätsanspruch

· Kommunikationsfähigkeit, Offenheit

· Verlässlichkeit und Belastbarkeit

Company Description

Mister Spex is Europe‘s largest online optician. Revolutionizing the eyewear industry, we offer the largest selection of branded eyewear available, better prices and all the service you need through our online driven multichannel approach. Our network of over 550 partner opticians, 17 local stores and online services is unique and we constantly strive for new innovations to drive our growth. We recently got an investment of 65 Mio € to boost our potential even further.

We have a passion for a customer centric, data driven and agile business building approach and are looking for people who share our vision and culture. Are you a passionate MS Dynamics NAV Developer and want to work in our growing international NAV team ? Then apply and improve your skills and develop your career with us!

Job Description

Configure, develop, and implement Microsoft Dynamics NAV/BC software and components in all functional areas (Sales, Purchase, Inventory, General Ledger and own modules)
Connecting third party APIs with NAV/BS
Creating APIs to expose NAV/BC and/or other data sources
Managing version change control
Advanced understanding of concepts governing relational database structures, the use of reporting/query tools and the construction of structured query language (SQL) statements
Suggest technical and functional improvements (third party add-on solutions and other systems)
Work with big data
Work with the Product Owners, Application Developers and QA to understand the business / application requirements of the assigned task (during planning, development and testing phases)
Writing unit and functional automation tests
Take responsibility for delivering development tasks within agreed upon time budgets and timelines

Qualifications

University degree (computer science or business administration) and/or equivalent experience
Minimum 3 or more years of experience as a software developer specifically working with the Dynamics NAV/BC
Experience with PowerShell, git, monitoring/alerting/reporting tools, performance optimization
Ability to translate customer business requirements and specifications into code solutions along with the ability to develop and manage days estimates
Ability to document code customizations in compliance with established standards and practices
Ability to debug errors efficiently and effectively
Capability of testing one’s own work and delivering working products
Proven ability to write effective system and process documentation – including business and system requirements, process diagrams, and data flow charts
Experience with Azure Cloud infrastructure and services a plus
Experience working with common third party add-on solutions and their integration with Dynamics NAV/BC/Azure Cloud services and with big data and big databases projects is a plus
You are a team player
Experience with Agile methodology is a plus

Additional Information

What we offer

A budget for courses, learning, workshops, conferences, and everything you need to create less bugs and build better solution
50 % subsidy for public transport
Corporate Benefits - Fitness, Hotels, Car Rental, etc.
Food and drinks for a healthy start to the day – and in summer time lots of BBQ’s
Employee discounts up to 40 % in your own online shop
Great people from all over the world!

Please upload your application documents, consisting of a cover letter, CV, certificates and your salary expectation, to our application tool on our website by using the “apply online” button. For any inquiries please don’t hesitate to contact us by phone under the following number: 030 - 44 31 2300 -475.

position: Senior Software Engineer - Pricing & Forecasting Engineering
description:
As a Backend Engineer in the Pricing & Forecasting team, you’ll bring the engineering perspective into our incentive team. You will build the required microservices handling all the discounts for Zalando. You will challenge our status quo, drive innovation and apply agile best practices.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED:

Design and develop backend services that implement the pricing decisions and strategy
Write code that your peers praise for its elegance, readability, and maintainability
Follow a feature through its entire lifetime from problem formulation to solution delivery
Deliver products that redefine the customer experience while making bold decisions about the means and tools of delivery and operation

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

+5 years of industry experience as a backend engineer working mainly in Java/Kotlin
Experience building and/or running large-scale applications
Experience with microservices architecture, distributed systems, and RESTful APIs, particularly using cloud infrastructure such as AWS
Proficiency with Git

PERKS AT WORK

Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings

We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

We are looking for a motivated Senior Backend Developer (Node.js) to join our multinational and multicultural IT organisation. Are you someone that loves team collaboration and architecting solutions? Then keep on reading!

What you tell your friends when they ask what you do

Our team is responsible for providing restaurants with delivery service. Areas like HR, disposition and delivery depend on us to develop and maintain their web and mobile applications. We have no dependencies, we are free to make our own technical decisions and get to work with the latest, cutting edge technologies.

The position
Collaborating with your team and stakeholders to improve our systems and their functionality (delivery, jobs scheduling, shiftplanning, etc.).
Solving complex engineering problems to enhance our service and the overall customer experience.
Refine and grow your expertise in topics such as Javascript, Event Driven Architecture, DDD and NodeJs.
Promote and contribute to good software engineering practices across the team and all of IT.
Your profile
You are a real team player who is comfortable with practices such as pair programming, code reviewing and knowledge sharing.
You have a good knowledge of the Node.js environment, especially with the Express framework
You know how to efficiently test your code, ideally you use a TDD approach
You have a good knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases
You know how to efficiently architecture an application. Any knowledge of Domain Driven Design (DDD) is highly appreciated
You understand how to effectively build and architect for the cloud (experience with AWS is very appreciated)
Ideally (not required) you already have some experience in Event Driven Architecture, including experience with Kafka or similar message brokers (RabbitMQ, AWS MQ, AWS Kinesis etc.)
You are passionate about clean code.
Fluent in English (written and spoken).
Our offer
The opportunity to work on interesting projects, applying best practices, and increasing your knowledge using different designs and architectures (e.g Event Driven Architecture, Reactive programming)
Being part of a unique, professional, and culturally diverse team who loves to learn and share knowledge
Workshops, conferences, and training seminars to support our growing team
Custom workstations/laptops (Mac/Linux/PC) so you can get the job done
Free drinks, fruit, several sports benefits, and awesome team events

Requisition ID: 248811
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Location: Berlin
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Professional
Employment Type: Regular Full Time

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

Summary & Role Information:

We strive to build an insanely great business by building an insanely great team. We’re looking for a (Senior) Developer to support us in building a product that helps our customers to improve their business. In this role, you’ll iterate quickly with a small but high energy team and help us to design and develop a scalable SaaS solution in the SAP Cloud Platform. You’ll ensure that we use the most suitable technologies and the right features to allow easy and efficient exploration and analysis of our data.

You should be hungry, ambitious and get energized connecting with new people and helping solve their problems with technology. This is your opportunity to contribute to the growth of a new start-up, in a venture capital style incubator, with the backing of one of the most impactful brands in enterprise technology.

Responsibilities include:
Develop our data-science-heavy SaaS solution
Work together with product management, designers, data scientists, and end-users to ensure product success
Role Requirements:

Required Skills:
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent subject
Excellent programming skills in Java and Python and a solid foundation in computer science with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, and databases
Track record of shipping products quickly, with good intuition for the end-users' needs
Experience with relational databases (e.g. Postgres) and cloud-based storage solutions (e.g. AWS S3) and with microservice architectures and distributed systems
Strong knowledge of cloud infrastructure technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP) and Kubernetes and in designing and implementing RESTful APIs as well as API specification tools (OpenAPI/Swagger)
Knowledge of agile software development processes and experience with development processes driven by regular code reviews
Effective communication skills, focusing on the presentation of technical information
Fluent in English and German is a must – both written and spoken
Preferred Skills:
Programming experience in Scala or Go
Hands-on experience with Data Science and Machine Learning projects
Experience with SAP HANA is a plus
Experience with CloudFoundry
Experience in early validation initiatives and/or SaaS startup experience is preferred
Work Experience:

3+ years of experience in software engineering

About Spotlight by SAP:

As Germany’s most valuable company and with more than €25 billion in annual sales, SAP manages an enormous diversity of businesses. However, moving the needle inside of SAP’s dominant enterprise business requires adding more than incremental innovation – it requires the development of massively disruptive organizations and products. The SAP.iO Venture Studio is the internal incubator charged with creating these transformative growth businesses for SAP.

Spotlight is one of SAP.iO’s latest ventures. Its focus is to help enterprises improve their business operations and processes in a data-driven way. Based on SAP’s exclusive data assets, domain knowledge and the latest technologies, we show our customers where their problems are, what to focus on and how to improve their operations and process landscape.

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.

A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Additional Locations:

position: Senior Software Engineer - Zalando Lounge Customer Facing Applications (Java)
description:
As a Senior Software Engineer, you will design and implement a high performance API that serves around five-hundred thousand concurrent users to deliver the complete shopping experience. You’ll work with Springboot, Kubernetes, Elasticsearch, Redis, Cassandra that process 10 thousands of requests and events every second.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED

Interface internal and external API and providing complete solutions specific to our business case
Be a partner with front-end developers, product managers, UI/UX designers in producing end-to-end solutions
Embrace data-driven approach to feature development (custom user experiences, personalisation, A/B testing)
Building scalable and cloud ready software solutions in our AWS and API-first tech environment.

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

Experience in integrating external and internal API services and are excited about building end-to-end solutions that serve the purpose.
Excellent skilled in Java. Experience in cloud environments such as AWS is a plus.
Business mindset and are continuously thinking about new ways on how to improve Zalando Lounge through effective and strategic development of internal systems.
Ability to exchange the knowledge and willingness to mentor team members in terms of best practices, code quality and tech frameworks.

PERKS AT WORK

Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service, and parent & child rooms* (*available only in select locations)

We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

ABOUT ZALANDO LOUNGE

Zalando Lounge is an online shopping club for fashion and lifestyle products in 13 European countries. We offer our members daily, time-limited sale campaigns with discounts of up to 75% off the recommended retail price. However, Zalando Lounge is so much more than discounts. Our strength lies in our focus on fashion: from sought-after labels to niche brands, from famous international names to trendy luxury brands, we make sure to meet the fashion taste of all our customers, who are always on the hunt for the best products at the best prices. Working with our brand partners, we're pioneering innovative supply-chain and production processes and offer them an impactful and smart solution, creating a new way to shop for fashion - and a new way to sell.

Our Tech department builds and drives our own customer facing applications and internal services on top of Zalando’s platform services. We have a strong focus on customer experience and learn and experiment how we can engage them even more. Being a member of a tech department, consisting of about 50 engineers, UX designers and product managers, this position will allow you to directly impact the business mission of Zalando Lounge. Our software engineers own their code and decide on technical frameworks being used and have the opportunity to implement best practices whilst the team is growing.

Snowflake started with a clear vision: develop a cloud data platform that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. Snowflake developed an innovative new product with a built-for-the-cloud architecture that combines the power of data warehousing, the flexibility of big data platforms, and the elasticity of the cloud at a fraction of the cost of traditional solutions. We are now a global, world-class organization with offices in more than a dozen countries and serving many more.

We're looking for dedicated students who share our passion for ground-breaking technology and want to create a lasting future for you and Snowflake.

Desired majors: Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Physics, Math, or related field

How to build enterprise grade, reliable, and trustworthy software/services

POSSIBLE TEAM / WORK FOCUS AREAS :


Service Runtime

Software-as-a-Service platform
Software frameworks for stability and performance testing
Snowflake is growing fast, and we're scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.

How do you want to make your impact?

About us

The ADEX GmbH, as part of the ProSiebenSat1 media family, is solving some of the most interesting and complex challenges in AdTech to stay ahead of the curve. Our latest endeavour is converting our core systems to deliver real-time advertising data to our clients.

Our software development team maintains and extends the core elements of our data management platform. The team is building the platform that international companies rely on for optimizing the marketing budgets. The platform is built using Java, Go, Kafka and Spark. We are also working on a stream processing architecture using using the same technologies.

What you can expect
You will actively work on solving complex problems related to our data management platform - through learning new skills, research and trial & error - and maintain full ownership of your code, from concept to deployment.
In your first month, you will get to know our team and get introduced to a variety of our projects. Youll spend the majority of your time increasing your domain knowledge and learning your environment. You are already able to deploy changes to production and feel confident reviewing major components.
In the next months, you feel comfortable with various areas of our systems and are actively helping us architect and implement our new system supporting real-time data consumption & delivery. You feel confident enough to make contributions to improve the whole team's workflow and knowledge.
At the end of your first year, your code and design contributions have been fundamental building and extending our new software architecture. You have worked with all of your teammates on projects and feel comfortable making changes to most areas of the system. You have established yourself as a self-sufficient and well spoken member of the team.
Your profile
You feel confident with the fundamentals of software development your focus lies on Java, Go or similar languages.
You are comfortable with Git and ideally deployment pipelines
You are already experienced with Kafka, Spark or similar technologies
You can design technical solutions to business problems and effectively communicate them to your colleagues
You are mindful, transparent and empathetic towards your teammates
You can express your ideas clearly in written and spoken English
What we can offer you
The chance to take an active role in the technical development of the company and to collaborate on projects that directly improve the bottom line
An international team of developers with a wide range of backgrounds enjoying having lunch together, playing board games and Klask.

A family-friendly work environment, including work-from-home opportunities
Contact

If this sounds exciting to you, please send us your application documents (including your salary expectations and earliest possible starting date). We are looking forward to hearing from you! For further information, please contact Kerstin Geise at +49 (0) 761 88 147 0.

DevOps Engineer (m/w/d)

Our team is building a revolutionary product which will affect the way millions of people study and play music every day. We are searching for an experienced and passionate DevOps engineer ready to join our effort and help us build and bring to life the foundation of our solution – a scalable backend capable of handling thousands of simultaneous users by means of latest cloud technologies. Our product will provide millions of amateurs and professionals instant access to the majority of world’ music heritage.

Please only apply if you have a valid work permit for Germany!

Job responsibilities
Create and maintain Kubernetes clusters for public and private services in the cloud
Manage and tune multiple and different database systems, key-value stores and messaging systems
Ensure that our services and infrastructure is secure, highly available and scalable
Help our development to apply best practices as early as possible in the build and delivery chain
Help us with infrastructure and service configuration for performance tuning
Automate everything that can be automated
What we expect from you
Multiple years of experience in writing Python and Shell
Multiple years of experience in automating operations in AWS
Solid production experience in automating Kubernetes deployments
Solid experience in securing internet-facing services (HTTPS-based, mainly Nginx)
Solid experience in tuning relational database systems like PostgreSQL and MariaDB
Experience with Jenkins as a CI/CD environment and Git for source code
Experience with creating secure and reliable build and delivery chains for services based on Docker images
Tendency to prefer open-source solutions
Willingness to perform under pressure

You are passionate about what you do and deliver

Experience with KOPS and/or Kubespray
Experience with Ansible, Chef and/or Puppet

Experience with Traefik v2

Actively contributing back to the open-source community and not afraid of forking if necessary

We are seeking a Technical Product Manager with a passion for developer experience and building productivity platforms to join the Platform Engineering product team. This role will focus on bringing design thinking, agile, and lean principles to solving everyday engineering problems and building tools and services that developers love.

We are building a cutting-edge cloud experience for developer productivity on top of AWS. We run multiple teams developing an integrated suite of products, the Scout24 Tech Platform, enabling a seamless, self-service experience for developing, deploying and operating software at Scout24. These products include container platforms, deployment infrastructure, CI/CD servers, tooling for feature toggles, monitoring and more.

What we need from you:

Build empathy with product development teams and collaborate with them on the design of the platform; clearly communicate product benefits to our users and internal stakeholders
Help build a shared product vision and translate that into a roadmap you and the platform team(s) can deliver on
Collaboratively research and analyze industry trends and benchmarking information for infrastructure products; adapt our platform product strategy accordingly
Measure the success of your products and continuously iterate to improve them; deliver value to our developers while minimizing the operational costs of our infrastructural services
Work closely with other product managers, elevating our team by sharing your best practices and frameworks

What you need to bring:

Experience as a product manager, you are collaborative, data driven and have a growth mindset; you’ve made a measurable impact through your successful feature or product launches and you look at your products from a holistic business perspective
Skills and tools to foster and facilitate product discovery and delivery conversations across Scout24
Prior experience working with cloud infrastructure or developer tools that influence developer processes and delivery speed; in a past life you may have been a developer
You’re an effective communicator (written, verbal, visual); you use storytelling to create a product narrative, inspiring your team and showing users you care about the problem you are solving
Ability to build relationships and collaborate effectively with diverse, talented team

We're looking for
... a Python Developer / Software Engineer (m/f/d) in Berlin who will join our international tech team as soon as possible in creating one of the fastest growing companies in the heating market.

About us
Thermondo was founded in 2012 to advance the energy revolution with innovative heating solutions. More than 16,000 heating-system transformations later, we are not only No. 1 in heating system construction, but have also made a lasting difference to the heating market. We are the pioneer and innovation leader in the digitalisation of the trade. The basis for this is the resourceful teamwork of our tech, marketing, sales, development, IT and HR experts. With passion and verve, they fulfill our vision of <2° (less than two degrees).

What we offer

Full time or part time, permanent contract.
Plenty of opportunities for new ideas and responsibilities.
Any tech equipment you need (Mac/Linux/Windows).
Flexible working hours and a professional development environment.
The possibility to work 3 days a week in your mobile office.
An international team, team-building events and 30 days of vacation.
Your work has a direct impact on the German energy market.
Regular feedback as an integral part of employee development (e. g. paid educational leave, conference budget etc.).

Our stack
We are mainly using Python along with Django or Wagtail connected to PostgreSQL. We also have some JavaScript applications written in Typescript using ReactJS. You even find some exotic things like LaTeX in our stack.
Most of our hosting is done on Heroku. We’re trying to make use of a lot of Heroku’s tools like pipelines, backups, buildpacks and some monitoring plugins. We try to keep DevOps work to a minimum since we want to focus on building and shipping functionality. We are using some AWS services like S3.

Your tasks
Our Python based backend is the backbone of our Germany wide operation and key to the digitization of the energy business. It’s an enterprise-grade application which connects our own services to third party platforms like Salesforce.

Our business is constantly growing and changing. New feature requests or requirement changes may emerge every day. As a result we build software that is highly maintainable to satisfy those needs. Your job will be to work in small teams on independent projects alongside your non technical colleagues. You will analyze our business needs and implement solutions while maintaining a high quality standard and developing at startup speed. You will have the freedom to use any tools and resources to achieve your goals. Our team of more than ten experienced engineers will support you to reach your full potential. For more information visit: https://thermondo.github.io

Your profile

University degree in a technical field, or a comparable qualification
Relevant experience in programming and web technology – Python or JavaScript
Very good understanding of back-end technologies
Familiar in working with frameworks like Django or Celery
Experience with Heroku is a plus
Knowledge of version control systems - Git or SVN
Experience with agile methodologies - Kanban, Scrum or similar
Fluency in English. German skills are a plus but not important for this position

It's on
That's exactly the challenge you're looking for? We look forward to getting to know you!

Berlin, Dortmund, Hamburg, Hannover, München, Wolfsburg

position: Backend Developer / Software Architect / Full Stack Developer in Tech Startup located in Berlin (m/f/d)
description:
Dive is an award-winning and venture-backed software startup in the field of Computer-Aided-Engineering (CAE). Our customers are manufacturing companies with complex mechanical products. Our in-house software combines high-tech simulation with high-end usability. This is what we call the Dive Experience. Tasks

Kry is a digital healthcare service enabling patients to meet and seek advice from healthcare professionals online. We’re on a mission to build better and more accessible healthcare by providing digital and seamless digi-physical services that gives patients the best possible health care experience, regardless of location.

We are now looking for a backend-focused full-stack engineer to join our Berlin growth development team, to help us build an even better and more complete healthcare experience for Germany. As an early member of the team you will be a core player in building the foundation of our Germany engineering team. For us, it is important that you are user-focused, have a broad technical interest and that you do not mind working in all parts of a system. We do not expect you to know everything but we do expect that you take pride in understanding the end user and developing high-quality features.

What you will do:
Work across our entire tech stack: backend, mobile apps and web. Specialization over time will be possible.
Contribute to all stages in the product life cycle: design, implementation, testing, deployment and maintenance
Build features across the entire tech stack, e.g: Java, Kotlin, Javascript, React.
Operate our systems on Amazon AWS.
Work in a lightweight scrum process where we constantly streamline our tools and workflows making sure that each workday is productive and stimulating.
Have a big impact on what we build and how we build it.
Ensure success in Germany by understanding in what ways it is truly unique and make that sure we adapt to it.
Stay in close contact with our code development team in Stockholm by joining our different Tech clubs for knowledge sharing and best practice, as well as face to face meetings (traveling).
Who you are:

Have experience working with Java.
You are a positive team player.
You have 7+ years of experience.
You want to build a great product that users love.
You are a true generalist and driven by impact.
You are continuously learning new things and keeping up to date with new technology and best practices.
You like to share your knowledge and ideas with others
You are familiar with development tools and concepts such as Git and continuous integration/delivery.
You have a basic understanding of cloud hosting and have probably used Amazon AWS.
You like the idea of working in a rapidly growing startup environment.
You are free to travel to Stockholm regularly and working there from time to time.
What’s in it for you?
Amazing, friendly, smart colleagues from all over the world
The opportunity to grow and learn from knowledgeable co-workers and cross-collaboration across departments
Ability to have a big impact on what we build and how we build it, as each team is in control of their own environment
As a team, committing to goals, sharing both success and failures
The chance to be a part of the journey of building the future of healthcare
This is your chance to work for a meaningful company that encourages personal development and celebrates diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, or marital status.

We offer a unique opportunity to gain a broad and deep understanding of the inner working at Europe’s leading digital healthcare provider. We value grit and a can-do attitude; there is a long and challenging journey ahead of us. You are brave enough to set high goals and then work passionately to achieve them. Last, but not least, we think you believe in that by working together we will achieve greater things than by working alone. At Kry we care about each other and the world around us. Expect to have fun and learn new things every day!

Please submit your application by including your CV, LinkedIn, GitHub or Portfolio.

If you have any questions regarding jobs or our recruitment process, please read our FAQ or contact us on jobs@kry.se. Please note that we do not accept any email applications due to GDPR.

Du interessierst dich für die Anwendungsentwicklung oder für den Aufbau komplexer IT-Infrastrukturen? Der Gedanke, Kundenanforderungen aufzunehmen und daraus technische Lösungen zu realisieren, begeistert dich? Du möchtest Teil eines großen Projektteams werden und an jedem Schritt mitwirken – von der Planung über die Entwicklung und Implementierung bis hin zum Betrieb von individuellen Software-Lösungen (Cloud / on premise / Hybrid)? Dann komme jetzt als IT-Trainee zu Materna.

Das erwartet dich bei Materna


Dein sechsmonatiges Trainee-Programm beginnt mit flexiblen Startterminen und einem unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag als fester Mitarbeiter. Das Programm kombiniert spannende Aufgaben aus Consulting und Entwicklung. Als Trainee bist du vollständig in ein Projektteam integriert und wirst durchgehend von deinen Kollegen fachlich unterstützt.
Begleitend nimmst du an einem individuellen Schulungsprogramm teil: Hier trainierst du sowohl deine Soft Skills als auch methodisches Arbeiten in IT-Projekten. Standardzertifizierungen wie z. B. PRINCE2, SCRUM und ITIL sind wichtige Bausteine in deinem Programm. Im Vorfeld kannst du dich dabei für einen der vier folgenden Schwerpunkte entscheiden:
Anwendungsentwicklung: wirke mit bei der Planung, Entwicklung, dem Betrieb von Web-basierten Fachanwendungen und berate unsere Kunden im Umfeld mobiler Apps oder Workflow-Systemen.
Content-Management: unterstütze unsere Kunden bei den Themen mobiles Web sowie mobile Apps und werde Experte für Web-Portale sowie Web-Content-Management.
Service-Management: berate IT-Organisationen bei vielfältigen Aufgaben wie z. B. dem Aufbau von effizienten IT-Landschaften und realisiere solche Lösungen auf Basis von Cloud-Technologien.
Infrastruktur-Management: unterstütze die gesamte Prozesskette vom Anforderungsmanagement über die IT-Strategie, IT-Prozess sowie Architekturberatung und verantworte die Erstellung solcher Konzepte vom Design bis hin zum Betrieb.
Das bringst du mit:


Abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik o.ä. oder eine vergleichbare berufliche Ausbildung
Kenntnisse in aktuellen Technologien z. B. Java, JavaScript oder C#
Gute Analysefähigkeiten sowie Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Reisebereitschaft, wenn du dich für eine Consulting-Ausbildung interessierst
Du bist neugierig geworden? Dann lies hier, was uns als Arbeitgeber ausmacht und hier, warum unsere Kollegen Materna schätzen.
