Interessiert?
Dann bewerben Sie sich bitte hier mit Ihren vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen unter Angabe Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung und Ihres nächstmöglichen Eintrittstermins.

Jede unserer 75.000 außergewöhnlichen Persönlichkeiten bei Thermo Fisher Scientific erzählt eine einzigartige Geschichte. Kommen Sie zu uns und leisten Sie einen Beitrag zu unserer einzigartigen Mission.

position: Senior Software Development Consultant, Professional Services
description:
Unity's Consulting & Development team is looking for developers to collaboratively develop innovative software with Unity's largest customers across a variety of exciting fields, such as games, media and entertainment, manufacturing, automotive, aerospace and architecture. If you're technically skilled, customer-focused, and an excellent communicator, this job will suit you.

Your day-to-day work will include designing and implementing software systems either in or surrounding the Unity Editor and the Unity Engine, interacting with customers, analysing the Unity Engine source code, and keeping your skills and knowledge up to date.

In the longer term, you'll become an established technical expert within Unity. You can pursue opportunities including personal research, speaking at conferences, delivering training to customers and colleagues, and guiding Unity's direction by providing feedback and advice to our R&D teams.

This role might involve occasional travel to customers' offices and other Unity offices, primarily within Europe. Travel will generally not exceed 5 nights per month and is usually conducted during week days.

We're committed to maintaining a diverse team, and we welcome and encourage applicants with diverse experiences and backgrounds.

Responsibilities
Help the Engineering Manager scoping projects for customers across a wide range of verticals, such as games, media and entertainment, manufacturing, automotive, aerospace and architecture
Become embedded with external customer teams to develop interactive applications and tools
Visit customers for short-term consultations and give them advice on how to resolve their performance issues and improve their existing workflows
Build close relationships with Unity's internal development teams and provide customer feedback and uses cases to them
Efficiently solve problems, communicate, and educate our clients, both remotely and on-site at their offices
Requirements
Capable of developing and debugging code written in a large multithreaded C# or C++ codebase, using a multi-platform engine (e.g. Unity, Unreal, in-house)
Knowledgeable on how to profile, analyze, and improve performance, from low-level limitations to high-level architectural decisions
Experience in shipping multiple games or other real-time interactive applications, including a solid understanding of software development lifecycles
Fluent in written and spoken English, and able to communicate ideas and technical knowledge clearly via written reports
Comfortable when it comes to diving into areas outside of their expertise in order to help our customers
Bonus points
Experience in delivering training/technical talks and writing technical articles/documentation
Experience in writing shaders
Experience in the Data-Oriented Technology Stack (DOTS)
About Unity Technologies

Unity is the creator of the world's leading real-time 3D development platform, giving users the most powerful and accessible tools to create, operate, and monetize experiences for the real-time world. Unity empowers anyone, regardless of skill level and industry, to create 3D visual content using world-class technology, operate using resources that maximize ease-of-use, and monetize, so that they can find success with their creations.

The company's 1,000 person development team keeps Unity at the forefront of development by working alongside partners such as Google, Oculus, Autodesk, Microsoft and many more, to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Made with Unity experiences reach nearly 3 billion devices worldwide and have been installed more than 34 billion times in the last 12 months. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

#SEN #LI-BH1

In kaum einem anderen Bereich kommen Dynamik und innovative IT so zusammen wie in der Automobilindustrie.
Täglich entwickeln wir im Bereich Automotive bei CGI, als eines der weltweit größten IT- und Business-Consulting-Unternehmen, zusammen mit unseren Kunden maßgeschneiderte High-End Lösungen.
Dabei bieten wir ein breites Portfolio an Dienstleistungen aus einer Hand an und bauen dieses stetig weiter aus.
Wir sind ein familiengeführtes Unternehmen, in dem der Mensch im Mittelpunkt steht: Wir arbeiten wo wir zu Hause sind, nutzen individuelle Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten. Agilität ist bei uns keine Floskel, sondern eine Einstellung. Dabei setzen wir nicht auf Zeugnisse und Zertifikate, sondern auf die Skills die du mitbringst! So finden wir mit dir zusammen, die für dich passende Herausforderung.

Die Zukunft der IT neu gestalten im starken Konzern.

Außergewöhnliche Zeiten fordern uns heraus. Der digitale Wandel schreitet voran und CGI unterstützt und begleitet seine Kunden auf diesem Weg. Dabei bieten wir eine Vielzahl neuer Möglichkeiten innerhalb der Digitalisierung und der IT von Morgen.

Bei CGI macht Arbeit und Erfolg haben Spaß. Denn wir bringen Menschen, Prozesse und Technologie zusammen. Wir wollen nicht nur unsere Aufträge erfüllen, sondern auch unsere Kunden erfolgreich bei ihrem Wandel begleiten und sie immer wieder begeistern. Dass uns beides regelmäßig gelingt, verdanken wir in erster Linie unseren motivierten Kollegen. Die Identifikation mit unserer Unternehmensphilosophie zeigt im täglichen Miteinander, was das Arbeiten bei CGI so außergewöhnlich macht.

Es ist Zeit, Teil unseres Erfolgs zu werden und mit anderen etwas zu bewegen werde Member bei CGI!

Mehr Informationen zu CGI unter www.de.cgi.com

Aufgaben

Als Software Developer (m/w/d) bei CGI implementierst du Softwarelösungen, die individuell auf die Anforderungen unserer Kunden zugeschnitten sind. Unsere Projektlandschaft ist spannend und abwechslungsreich. Deshalb suchen wir auch nicht nach einem speziellen Softwareskill, sondern möchten mit dir gemeinsam den richtigen Einsatz finden.
Dabei übernimmst Du folgende weitere Aufgaben:
• Du konzipierst und implementierst Software im Team
• Du hast Lust dazu zu lernen und teilst gerne dein Wissen

Qualifikation

Wir suchen dich, wenn du
• Kenntnisse in einer einschlägigen Programmiersprache hast und mit entsprechenden Entwicklungstools umgehen kannst
• Dich mit den Prinzipien agiler Softwareentwicklung auseinandersetzt
• Interesse an neuen Technologien hast

Unity's Consulting & Development team is looking for developers that want to share their expertise with our customers and help them achieve their performance targets. Our customer base spans a wide range of exciting fields, such as video games, entertainment, manufacturing, automotive and architecture. If you're technically skilled, customer-focused, and are not afraid of constantly being pushed out of your comfort zone, this job will suit you.

Your day-to-day work will include visiting our customers and, by collaborating directly with their technical leaders, help them optimize their projects and workflows and educate them on best practices. As part of the role, you'll also interact heavily with various R&D teams across Unity and you'll get exposure to nearly all aspects of the engine.

In the longer term, you'll become an established technical expert within Unity. You can pursue opportunities including personal research, speaking at conferences, delivering training to customers and colleagues, and guiding Unity's direction by providing feedback and advice to

our R&D teams.

This role will involve periodic travel to customer and Unity offices, primarily within Europe. Travel is usually conducted during week days and won't exceed 50% of the time. We're committed to maintaining a diverse team, and we welcome and encourage applicants with diverse experiences and backgrounds.

Responsibilities
Visit customers on a regular basis for short-term consultations and give them advice on how to resolve their performance issues and improve their existing workflows
Build close relationships with Unity's internal development teams and provide customer feedback and uses cases to them
Efficiently solve problems, communicate, and educate our clients, both remotely and on- site at their offices
Help the Engineering Manager scoping projects for customers across a wide range of verticals, such as games, media and entertainment, manufacturing, automotive, aerospace and architecture
Occasionally become embedded with external customer teams to develop interactive applications and tools
Requirements
Capable of developing and debugging code written in a large multithreaded C# or C++ codebase, using a multi-platform engine (e.g. Unity, Unreal, in-house)
Knowledgeable on how to profile, analyze, and improve performance, from low-level limitations to high-level architectural decisions
Experience in shipping multiple games or other real-time interactive applications, including a solid understanding of software development lifecycles

Fluent in written and spoken English, and able to guide customers by clearly communicating ideas and technical knowledge via written reports

Comfortable when it comes to diving into areas outside of their expertise in order to help our customers

Bonus points
Experience in delivering training/technical talks and writing technical articles/documentation
Experience in writing shaders
Experience in the Data-Oriented Technology Stack (DOTS)

About Unity Technologies

Unity is the creator of the world's leading real-time 3D development platform, giving users the most powerful and accessible tools to create, operate, and monetize experiences for the real-time world. Unity empowers anyone, regardless of skill level and industry, to create 3D visual content using world-class technology, operate using resources that maximize ease-of-use, and monetize, so that they can find success with their creations.

The company's 1,000 person development team keeps Unity at the forefront of development by working alongside partners such as Google, Oculus, Autodesk, Microsoft and many more, to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Made with Unity experiences reach nearly 3 billion devices worldwide and have been installed more than 34 billion times in the last 12 months. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

#SEN #LI-BH1

Wir sind ein Technologie- und Beratungsunternehmen und helfen unseren Kunden dabei, ihre Prozesse, Produkte und Organisationen zu digitalisieren und modernisieren. Unsere Philosophie: Gutes Arbeitsklima = motivierte Mitarbeiter*innen = zufriedene Kunden. Der Erfolg gibt uns recht. Jetzt suchen wir dich zur Verstärkung unserer Teams in München, Augsburg und Berlin.

DU
Du hast dein Studium der Informatik, Physik, Mathematik oder ein anderes naturwissenschaftliches Studium abgeschlossen und konntest eventuell schon Berufserfahrung in der IT-Branche sammeln.
Du möchtest in spannenden Software-Projekten arbeiten und unseren Kunden dabei helfen, ihre Systeme stetig zu optimieren.
Du hattest schon Berührungspunkte mit Programmiersprachen wie beispielsweise Java, JavaScript, Node.js, Go oder Python.
Du interessierst dich für neue Technologien und möchtest dich tiefer in komplexe Softwareprodukte einarbeiten.
Du willst in einem agilen Team arbeiten und von Anfang an Verantwortung übernehmen.

WAS
Du kannst dich in unserem gesamten Leistungsportfolio deinen Wünschen und Fähigkeiten entsprechend entwickeln.
Wir arbeiten an Projekten für große Kunden in den Bereichen Microservices, IoT-Software und Web-Applications.
Wir entwickeln viel für die Cloud (z.B. AWS) und beschäftigen uns intensiv mit Containern und Serverless-Computing.
In der Frontend-Entwicklung setzen wir auf moderne Frameworks wie React, Angular und Vue.
Wir legen großen Wert auf DevOps, Continuous Delivery und die Orchestrierung von Systemen.
Im Rahmen unserer Partnerschaft mit Atlassian entwickeln wir zudem Erweiterungen für Jira und Confluence.
Mit unserer Unterstützung wirst du Zertifizierungen (z.B. Atlassian, AWS, Azure) erlangen und ein agiles Training besuchen.

WIR
Wir sind circa 80 Leute, verteilt auf unsere Büros in München, Augsburg und Berlin sowie verschiedene Home Offices.
Unser Leistungsportfolio erstreckt sich vom IT Consulting über das Software Development bis hin zum Systems Engineering in der Cloud.
Wir arbeiten in kleinen selbstorganisierten Teams und verzichten auf unnötige Hierarchien.
Wir setzen auf eine offene Kommunikationskultur, in der sich jeder mit seinen Ideen einbringen darf.
Wir arbeiten mit modernen Tools (z.B. IntelliJ, Slack, Zoom, G Suite, Atlassian Produkte, etc.) und bieten eine freie Wahl des Betriebssystems.
Wir glauben an das lebenslange Lernen und bieten kontinuierlich Workshops, Schulungen, persönliche Zertifizierungen und Lernzeit an.
Wir arbeiten primär in unseren gut ausgestatteten Büros oder im Home Office und sind nur gelegentlich beim Kunden vor Ort.
Durch die günstige Anbindung an das öffentliche Verkehrsnetz sind unsere Büros gut erreichbar.
Dank unserer flexiblen Arbeitszeiten mit Überstundenausgleich kannst du dir eine angenehme Work-Life-Balance schaffen.
Wir zahlen ein sehr gutes Gehalt und jede*r Mitarbeiter*in ist zusätzlich am Gewinn beteiligt.
Jeder braucht mal eine Pause - bei 30 Tagen Urlaub pro Jahr kannst du dich ausgiebig erholen.
Wir sind nicht nur Kolleg*innen - auch wenn wir momentan leider nicht zusammen kochen oder weggehen können, ein virtueller Kaffeeklatsch, Team- oder Spieleabend geht immer. :)

Erkennst du dich wieder und hast Lust, mit uns zu arbeiten?
Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung mit Angabe deines frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins und deiner Gehaltsvorstellung an [E-Mail-Adresse ausgeblendet; Bitte auf "Weiter zur Bewerbung" klicken] oder fülle einfach das Formular auf unserer Website aus.

Du bist neugierig, wie es ist bei der Scandio zu arbeiten?
Dann schau doch einfach mal auf unserer Instagram Seite oder auf unserem Blog vorbei.

Zudem haben wir die häufigsten Fragen zu unserem Bewerbungsprozess und dem Worklife in der Scandio hier gesammelt.

Company Description

We are a growing company with 7 years of experience and start-up character with a modern HQ in Grunewald, one of the greenest areas of Berlin. Our international team has a family atmosphere, great work-life balance and provides all what you need to become a champ. We provide tailor-made solutions for our customers; we offer optimal individual possibilities for the planning and realization of web and app projects. Due to the interdisciplinary fields of work, Bitlane offers an exciting work environment in various projects and tasks! We are searching for hands-on developers to join our growing team, who will have fun while accepting new challenges and elevate each-other to successfully reach company goals. We want to develop awesome projects alongside other talented developers and be a part of digitalization.

Job Description

We are looking for a software engineer passionate about web development from front- to backend. You will be responsible for participating in our product development from ideation to deployment and beyond. The ideal candidate has a thorough understanding of software engineering and development standards and best practices. Also, you should be a problem-solver with an inquisitive and innovative mind to leverage your software development skills to help build new services. You will be responsible for backend and front-end development on a wide range of projects and will work together with our international team on the various layers of our applications. The complexity of these projects can vary from small apps, to e-commerce shop systems up to whole CRM Systems and gated company portals. If you recognize your skills in this job description, we would be happy to receive your application!

Responsibilities:
Collaborate with our software team to design and launch new features
Improve our product and codebase with your analytical mindset
Develop and extend our existing web technology portfolio
Create and maintain tools to interact with the software and data
Support the test-driven development of the software stack (e.g. code reviews, unit tests, CI) and documentation
Defining a project scope together with a project manager
Communicating the status of your work and meeting deadlines defined by you and a project manager
Qualifications
At least 3 years front- and backend experience
Solid understanding of backend development and AWS development best practices
Strong knowledge of two backend frameworks (Laravel is an advantage)
Skilled in frontend development with a focus on cross browser support
Strong knowledge of one modern Javascript frameworks (Angular, React, VUE)
Experience using CSS preprocessors like Sass, Less or Stylus
Team working with version control system like git or subversion
Experience with integrating third-party APIs
Experience in building mobile apps is a big advantage
Fluent English - German is a plus, but not necessary
Additional Information
Detailed training with professional support
Permanent employment contract with home office options
Flat hierarchies and flexible working hours
Attractive remuneration
Regular further education offers
Coordinated team events
Fresh fruit, ice-cream, coffee, tea and cold drinks
High-quality office in the heart of the Grunewald
Sounds like you? Great, we would love to hear from you! Please include your CV and a short cover letter explaining who you are, what is your superpower and your salary expectations. Feel free to send us something that shows us a little more about what you’re interested in - be it your account on GitHub, Twitter, Instagram, Medium or your blog.

(Lead) Software Engineer - React Native (m/f/d)



Job description

We are a stealth-mode tech start-up creating a new path for mobility. We’re reshaping how people autonomously move in metropolitan areas – making getting from A to B safer, more sustainable and accessible for everyone.

Our diverse and international team brings together industry experience from both Silicon Valley and automotive industries from Europe – including Waymo, Zoox, Byton, Uber, Skype, Audi and BMW, as well as from having founded various other companies. We’re an inclusive equal opportunities employer looking for smart, driven and passionate people, no matter where you’re from.

We are currently hiring for our Berlin HQ. Our global team size is 75+ and we plan to grow to 250+ by next year and 1000+ in three years.

The Role

As (Lead) Software Engineer - React Native (m/f/d) you will be involved in delivering an amazing mobile experience for our driverless vehicle fleet. We look at our mobile app as an extension of the REE car. You would be working with a highly experienced Engineering and Design team in redefining what it means to be moving in a big urban environments. You will be also essential in defining the foundations of our product and culture.


Requirements

The profile
You are experienced with writing, testing, releasing and maintaining mobile apps with React Native for at least 3 years
You have been working with other native mobile platforms for at least 3 years
Therefore you have a deep understanding of differences between iOS and Android platforms
You are obsessed with high-quality mobile UI experiences
Passion for mobile analytics
Nice-to-have's
You have excellent problem solving, critical thinking and communication skills
You have worked in a fast-moving, agile environment before (e.g. a start-up)
You are a self-starter, enjoy taking ownership, are curious and you like building stuff
You have a track record of mobile apps you have worked on we can take a look at
You are contributing into the open source React Native community
Experience with GraphQL
You have experience in mobility sector
Our Values
We are drivers: At REE, everyone is a driver. We encourage everyone to act like a leader in their area.
We’re pioneers: At REE we’re doing work that has never been done before.We focus on results, which means we keep the bar high and are always pushing ourselves towards more ambitious projects.
We’re stronger as a team: At REE we believe that as a team we are much greater than the sum of our parts. We all aim for personal and professional growth — from learning a new tool to taking on more responsibility.
We build trust: At REE, We build trust through consistently doing the right thing and following through on our commitments towards stakeholders, users and society.
Our Offerings:
Be a part of fixing transportation in metropolitan areas all over the world – from Europe
Above-industry-standard compensation package and a generous stock option plan
You’ll be joining a highly committed, experienced and international team from over 25 countries.
Health promotion: contribution to a FitX or UrbanSportsClub membership, plus free and all-day usage of our Gravity Gym in the office
Compensation towards your Berlin public transport tickets
Healthy snacks, drinks and good coffee
Support for your relocation to Berlin – it doesn’t matter where you currently live!
We strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds and identities to apply. Each new hire is an opportunity for us to bring in a different perspective, and we are always eager to further diversify our company. REE is committed to building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do the best and most rewarding work of your career.

Come join the future!

position: Senior Software Architekt Automatisiertes Störfall-Management für Digitale Schiene Deutschland (w/m/d)
description:
Du willst an einem historisch einmaligen Vorhaben mitwirken und Deutschlands Bahnbetrieb in die digitale Zukunft begleiten? Hier kannst Du es – als Senior Software Architekt für automatisiertes Störfall-Management wirst Du zum Treiber für innovative Lösungen und erhältst eine einzigartige Chance: Du gestaltest Dein Thema von der Konzeption bis zur Umsetzung und baust zeitgleich einen der zukunftsweisendsten Bereiche in der Geschichte des Schienenverkehrs auf. Jetzt ist die spannendste Zeit einzusteigen!

Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir Dich als Senior Software Architekt Automatisiertes Störfall-Management für das Konzernprogramm Digitale Schiene Deutschland im Bereich „Digitaler Bahnbetrieb“ bei der DB Netz AG in Berlin.

Deine Aufgaben:

Neukonzeption von Produkten im Team mit weiteren Systemarchitekten und in Abstimmung mit dem Produktmanagement
Verantwortung der logischen und technischen Architekturentwürfe unter Nutzung des Projektstandards für modellbasierte Systementwicklung
Alt-System Analyse und Integration zu existierenden Drittsystemen (onboard und Landseite)
Zusammenarbeit mit Betriebsexperten bei der Definition von Regelwerksänderungen
Verantwortung für die Domänen automatisierte Entscheidungsfindung und Reaktionsplanung (Robotik), teilautomatisiertes Notfall- und Störfallmanagement (Bahnsystem)
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit der Funktionsentwicklung bei der Konzeption und Umsetzung von innovativen Funktionen in o.g. Domänen
Nachverfolgung der Umsetzung der Architektur in internen Projekten vom PoC über Prototypen bis zum zugelassenen Produkt
Dein Profil:

Du hast ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes technisches Studium, z.B. (Technische) Informatik, Mathematik, Elektrotechnik, Physik
Du kennst Dich gut mit der Systemarchitektur großer Softwaresysteme und der Herleitung funktionaler und nichtfunktionaler Anforderungen aus
Du hast Kenntnisse in Architekturtools und in agilen Tools wie Capella, Enterprise Architect o.ä. und JIRA/Confluence; idealerweise kennst Du toolgestützte SW-Architektur Analyse wie Speicher- und Laufzeitprüfung
Du solltest langjährige Berufserfahrung in der Spezifikation und dem Design von Systemen und Produkten in einem regulierten Umfeld, idealerweise in der Bahnindustrie und ein gutes Verständnis von Entwicklungsprozessen haben
Vorteilhaft sind weiterhin Kenntnisse im Aufbau von sicherheitskritischen SW-Komponenten und im Störungsmanagement von Bahn- oder anderen Verkehrssystemen
Es gelingt Dir Dich in einem hochdynamischen Umfeld auf Dein Ergebnis zu fokussieren
Wenn Du darüber hinaus über gute Deutsch- und fließende Englischkenntnisse verfügst, dann bist Du bei uns genau richtig!

Nutze jetzt Deine Chance und gehe als Pionier neue Wege! Bei uns bekommst Du die Möglichkeit, in einem Team aus Top-Experten mit führenden Playern der Industrie zu kooperieren und einen der technologisch spannendsten Bereiche zu prägen. Dabei arbeitest Du in der Atmosphäre eines Startups und genießt dennoch alle Vorzüge eines Großkonzerns.
Benefits:
Du schaffst Großes und bekommst nicht weniger zurück: ein marktübliches Gehaltspaket mit i.d.R. unbefristeten Arbeitsverträgen und Beschäftigungssicherung sowie vielfältige Nebenleistungen und eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge.
Faszinierende Projekte und Aufgaben bei einem der vielfältigsten Arbeitgeber des Landes fordern Dein Können und warten auf Deine Handschrift.
Wir bieten Vergünstigungen im öffentlichen Nahverkehr wie z.B. ein Job-Ticket für den täglichen Arbeitsweg.

Chancengleichheit und selbstbestimmte Teilhabe Schwerbehinderter und Gleichgestellter sowie eine respektvolle Zusammenarbeit sind innerhalb des DB Konzerns fest verankerte Grundsätze. Deshalb werden schwerbehinderte Bewerber bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt berücksichtigt.

Senior Geo-IT Developer (m,w,d)

Work at LiveEO in the vibrant Berlin Start-Up ecosystem

At LiveEO you will be working as a team lead and solution developer in a Berlin-based space Start-Up. Take our products to the next level and help us bring earth observation to the enterprise sector. Your task is to lead the development of analytical products for new business opportunities and iterate them with our business development team and potential customers.
Work at LiveEO
We are a young, open-minded, and diverse team with flat hierarchies, spanning different nationalities from all over the globe. We’re excited about space, satellites and new possibilities to disrupt markets with state-of-the-art earth observation technologies. We are conveniently located in the center of Berlin-Kreuzberg.
Your challenges
Coordinate a team of GIS specialists, software engineers and data scientists.
Manage customer-facing and internal projects for developing analytical products based on satellite data.
Take a proactive role in our agile organization and help the team with project planning and execution.
Support the spatial data management team by expanding, handling and maintaining our spatial databases.
Your profile
Ideally more than 3 years of professional experience as technical project manager / team lead in the geospatial industry.
Proficiency in signal- and geo-processing in Python is a must.
Experience with Remote Sensing Data
Advanced experience with spatial databases (PostgreSQL/PostGIS) is an asset.
Experience with cloud computing, especially AWS Batch clusters and Lambda functions is a plus.
Fluency in English for verbal and written communication is required.
You are willing to relocate to Berlin.
We encourage female applicants as well as applicants with migratory background.
*

*
Interested in this position? Send us your CV and a short cover letter and we will get to you as soon as possible.
*
Check out our website www.live-eo.com for more information about the company.
Art der Stelle: Vollzeit

Arbeitszeiten:
Montag bis Freitag
Leistungen:
Flexible Arbeitszeiten
Homeoffice
Berufserfahrung:
Remote Sensing: 2 Jahre (Erforderlich)
Projektmanagement: 3 Jahre (Bevorzugt)
Python : 2 Jahre (Erforderlich)
Englischkenntnisse:
Verhandlungssicher (Erforderlich)
Homeoffice:
Temporär, aufgrund von COVID-19

deineStudienfinanzierung ist die erste digitale Plattform, die Studierende von der Beantragung bis hin zum letzten zurückgezahlten Euro bei der Finanzierung des Studiums unterstützt. Unterstützt werden wir von namenhaften Investoren wie beispielsweise Axel Springer Plug and Play, Christian Gaiser (Founder KaufDa/Bonial), Lucas von Cranach (Founder & CEO OneFootball), Roland Grenke (Co-Founder dubsmash) oder Kelly Ford (ex-CMO N26).

Werde auch Du Teil unseres erstklassigen Teams und begleite uns auf unserer Mission, allen Studierenden in Deutschland ein finanziell sorgenfreies Studium zu ermöglichen.

Wir suchen ab sofort einen (Senior) Full Stack Web Developer (m/w/d) in Berlin. Nutze die ideale Gelegenheit, ein digitales Produkt mit modernem Tech Stack aktiv mit aufzubauen und dich und deine Ideen einzubringen!

Aufgaben
Maßgebliche Weiterentwicklung unserer responsiven Web App (basierend auf einem modernen Tech Stack aus ReactJS, Apollo, GraphQL und Prisma)
Konzeption und Implementation von anspruchsvollen Webkomponenten auf ReactJS Basis mit einem starken Fokus auf exzellenter User Experience
Sorgfältiges Testen der entwickelten Lösungen und Behebung von Fehlern / Bugs
Dokumentation der implementierten Funktionen und Komponenten
Perspektivisch Aufbau eines eigenen Teams und Verantwortung über Frontend-Entwicklung
Qualifikation

Job merken

Millions of people experience real-life adventures with our apps. We help people all over the world discover the best hiking and biking routes, empowering our users to explore more of the great outdoors. And we’re good at it: Google and Apple have listed us as one of their Apps of the Year numerous times – and, with more than 12 million users and 100,000 five-star reviews – komoot is on its way to become one of the most popular cycling and hiking apps. Join our fully remote team of 60+ people and change the way people explore!

To help us continue to grow, we ‘re looking for an experienced backend developer with knowledge in data science. Komoot possesses a unique dataset of user-generated content, ranging from GPS data from tours, uploaded photos, and tips, to implicit and explicit user feedback. To get the biggest value from this raw data, we need your excellent software and analytical skills. The challenges include automatic evaluation and classification of our user-generated content as well as innovative approaches to assembling them into consumable inspiration for users (e.g. auto-generated tour suggestions tailored to users’ sport and location). You’ll wrap up your algorithms into clean and scalable microservices in our modern cloud environment.

We believe that innovations based on data science will reinforce and extend our leadership in the outdoor market and your role will be decisive for komoot’s success.

What you will do
Work closely with our data scientists, web and mobile developers, designers, copywriters and product managers
Discuss product improvements, technical possibilities and road maps
Investigate and evaluate data science approaches for product enhancements (you can count on the support of experienced data scientists)
Turn prototypes into resilient and scalable REST APIs and background workers
Deploy and monitor your code in our AWS Cloud
Why you will love it
You’ll be challenged with a wide range of tasks for which there are no standard solutions
You’ll have full ownership: from concept, prototypes, and building, to deploying and monitoring
You’ll deal with diverse datasets (location data, social network, user content (images, text), external data sources like OSM, product analytics, ...)
You’ll contribute to a product with a vision to inspire more people to go outdoors
You’ll work in a fast-paced startup with strongly motivated and talented co-workers
You’ll enjoy the freedom to organize yourself the way you want
We let you work from wherever you want, be it a beach, the mountains, your house, a coworking center of your choice, our HQ in Potsdam or anywhere else that lies in any time zone situated between UTC-1 and UTC+3
You’ll travel together with our team to amazing outdoor places several times a year to exchange ideas, learnings and go for hikes and rides
Requirements

You will be successful in this position if you
Have a passion for finding pragmatic and smart solutions to complex problems
Have 3+ years of professional experience in backend development in the cloud
Have 2+ years of professional experience in Kotlin/Java/Scala
Have 2+ years of professional experience in Python
Know SQL and NoSQL
Have a solid understanding of math and statistics
Have a solid understanding of data science fundamentals
Master Jupyter, pandas, NumPy, matplotlib/seaborn, scikit-learn
Bonus: BigData experience (Spark, Presto, Hadoop)
Bonus: Infrastructure as Code
Bonus: Deployment, CI and monitoring
Have strong communication and team skills
Have a hands-on attitude and are highly self-driven
Sounds like you?
Then send us the following:
Your CV in English highlighting your most relevant experience
A write-up explaining who you are and why you are interested in working at komoot
Examples of your work (e.g. GitHub Repositories, PDFs, Slideshare, etc.)
Feel free to send us something that shows us a little more about what you’re interested in, be it your Twitter/Instagram account, a blog or something else

Are you interested in building the next generation, cloud-based commerce system for AWS thats used by millions of customers worldwide? Are you excited by the idea of building real-time stream processing systems that operate at Petabyte scale? Do you want to make an impact at a $10-billion-a-year business? Then we need to talk!

Computing AWS bills, at its core, is a challenging, distributed systems problem that requires calculations performed over trillions of usage records, millions of accounts, and hundreds of thousands of different rates. Furthermore, our applications must meet strict requirements for accuracy and once-and-only-once processing.

As a software developer, you have the opportunity to develop a federated billing system that supports new pricing models using cutting edge technologies like Kinesis, DynamoDB, S3, Lambda, and more. Additionally, you will build meaningful software that helps AWS to bring our largest customers over to the Cloud. And finally, as an Amazon engineer, you get to own the full lifecycle of your systems, work on challenging problems at "Amazon Scale", and collaborate with high-performance technical teammates and having fun doing it.

If all of this sounds exciting to you, then please come join us and help shape the future of the Cloud.

Basic Qualifications

· Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree based on 3 years of work experience for every 1 year of education
·
· 5+ years professional experience in software development
·
· Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design
·
· Computer Science fundamentals in data structures
·
· Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis

Preferred Qualifications

· Strong Java coding skills; you will be able to discuss in depth both the design and your significant contributions to one or more projects using the Java language
·
· Experience with distributed system performance analysis and optimization
·
· Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences
· Experience with distributed (multi-tiered) systems, algorithms, and relational databases
·
· Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions
·
· Deal well with ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly

ABOUT US:
As one of Berlin's fastest growing SaaS scaleups, Vimcar is redefining business mobility. By combining live car data and a set of cloud-based applications, we offer real-time insight into vehicle activity to help our customers reduce the operational costs for their fleets.
By serving SMB's to large enterprises in DACH and the UK, Vimcar already has 90,000+ cars connected, resulting in an ARR of ~15m. Headquartered in Berlin, more than 150+ employees from 25+ countries are working towards our mission to build Europe's leading fleet tech company.


THE ROLE:
Vimcar is searching for a Senior Software Engineer for its Data Integrations Team. Our 90,000+ connected cars are constantly sending us real-time data like location and vehicle status. The main responsibilities for the team are to receive, process, store and extract value from this data. The algorithms used to turn this raw data into something meaningful are central to the company.
You help build and maintain a stable, high-performance and scalable system.
You collaborate closely with our CTO, the Team Lead and engineering team to guide the architecture of an interesting, evolving, business-critical system for processing and analyzing a variety of streaming data.
You take part in the ongoing improvements to the core logic for extracting meaningful data from our large streams of data.
You embrace a holistic approach to development where the team is responsible for its own infrastructure, CI/CD and quality assurance (supported by a test-automation specialist within the team).


YOUR PROFILE:
5+ years experience in modern Java development
7+ years building, growing and maintaining modern backend architectures
Experience with designing architecture for: big data stream processing and analysis, big data time series storage, and distributed systems
Development experience with AWS especially in the area of processing and analyzing large amounts of data (eg: DynamoDB, Kinesis)
Ability to use your experience to help elevate and amplify the work of the whole team
View software development as a group activity
Strong communication skills in English; German not required
[Bonus] Working experience in a programming language other than Java

Wenn es darum geht, zukünftig Millionen Fahrgäste und tausende Züge auch digital auf den Weg zu bringen, braucht es die besten IT-Experten. 8.000 haben wir schon, aber längst nicht genug. Als DB Dialog sind wir das Kunden-Kontakt-Center der Deutschen Bahn. Mit digitalen Lösungen beantworten wir Kundenanliegen über alle Kanäle hinweg – ohne den menschlichen Aspekt der Kommunikation zu vernachlässigen.

Im Rahmen des Ausbaus unserer IT-Abteilung suchen wir Dich für eines unserer (agilen) Teams. Je nach Deinen Stärken und Interessen kannst Du Deine Fähigkeiten bei uns entweder im Contactcenter-Team mit dem Schwerpunkt Multichannel-Contact-Center-Anlagenn oder im Software-Team mit dem Schwerpunkt Webapplikationen und Cloud einbringen.

Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir Dich als Senior DevOps Engineer an den Standorten Berlin oder Schwerin.

Deine Aufgaben:

In Deiner Rolle erarbeitest und vermittelst Du für Dein Team Standards und Best-Practices, verantwortest eigenständig die Automatisierung von IT-Prozessen (Continous Integration, Continous Delivery, Testautomation) und führst Administrations- und Konfigurationstätigkeiten aus
Deine Erfahrungen mit Konfigurations- und Automatisierungstools bringst Du aktiv ein, begleitest die Migration unserer OnPremise-Plattform in die Cloud und hast die IT-Sicherheit dabei stets im Blick
Im Rahmen Deines Aufgabengebietes erarbeitest und konzipierst Du Lösungen für Deine Kunden und berätst Deine Stakeholder hinsichtlich Themen der Digitalisierung und DB Dialog Anwendungen
Technische Tests führst Du eigenständig durch, unterstützt bei fachlichen und analysierst und behebst Fehler im Second und Third Level Support
Du erstellst eine Root Cause Analyse und setzt die daraus entstehenden Maßnahmen um
Arbeitsergebnisse und Systeme dokumentierst Du in bereitgestellten Ticketing- und Wissensplattformen

Dein Profil:

Du besitzt ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation mit entsprechender Berufserfahrung
Sehr gute Programmierkenntnisse sowie Kenntnisse von Servern, Betriebssystemen und Netzwerkdiensten kannst Du vorweisen
Du bist fit wenn es um die Dokumentation mit EML / UML etc. geht
Weitreichende Erfahrungen mit Cloud-Umgebungen und Technologien wie CI/CD sowie Testautomatisierungen bringst Du ebenfalls mit
Neben Deinem fachlichen Know-how überzeugst Du durch eine hohe Kunden- und Teamorientierung analytisches Denkvermögen sowie die Fähigkeit zur Komplexitätsreduzierung
Du hast Spaß daran, eigenverantwortlich, strukturiert und konzeptionell zu arbeiten

Du erfüllst nicht alle Anforderungen, möchtest Dich aber verändern und weiterentwickeln?
Wir unterstützen Dich und freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung.

Benefits:
Du schaffst Großes und bekommst nicht weniger zurück: ein marktübliches Gehaltspaket mit i.d.R. unbefristeten Arbeitsverträgen und Beschäftigungssicherung sowie vielfältige Nebenleistungen und eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge.
Gezielte und individuelle Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten auf Fach-, Projekt- oder Führungsebene geben Dir eine langfristige Perspektive.
Wir unterstützen Dich bei der Suche nach Kitaplätzen oder Ferienbetreuung für Deine Kinder. Außerdem kannst Du Auszeiten für die Pflege von Angehörigen oder Sabbaticals nehmen. Je nach Job ist eine flexible Gestaltung von Arbeitszeit/-ort möglich.

Chancengleichheit und selbstbestimmte Teilhabe Schwerbehinderter und Gleichgestellter sowie eine respektvolle Zusammenarbeit sind innerhalb des DB Konzerns fest verankerte Grundsätze. Deshalb werden schwerbehinderte Bewerber bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt berücksichtigt.

At Zattoo we are building the TV platform of the future. To make that possible, we are looking for an experienced Software Engineer in Test (f/m/x) to join our streaming/video backend team.

As the demand for unicast TV delivery is constantly growing, we are scaling out our custom-built delivery infrastructure to serve linear and non-linear video data on a multi Tbps scale. Because we control the whole chain from ingestion through encoding/transcoding, to packaging and delivery, there are many exciting areas to work on and to push TV to a new level.

You will play a key role in designing test cases, developing automation tests and extending test coverage of our video backend services. You are responsible for delivering high quality services for optimizing video traffic flow, access authorization and logging/reporting. You will be working together closely with the core video, middleware, data and SRE/Ops teams to build and test services that link all of them together.

Tasks
Review requirements, provide estimates and create comprehensive, well-structured test plans and cases based on business requirements.
Take active participation in coding and reviewing to make sure new code is testable
Design, develop, execute and maintain manual, unit, integration and performance tests
Lead continuous integration/deployment efforts
Write custom in-house testing tools to verify specific parts in our streaming ecosystem
Track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect counts
Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies
Requirements
2+ years proven work experience in software quality development
Hands-on experience with coding in one of these languages: Go, C++, Python
Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processes
Self-driven and proactive mentality
Experience in writing clear, concise and comprehensive test plans and test cases
Hands-on experience with automated tests and testing tools
Experience of system and integration testing in microservice architectures
Experience verifying encoding quality using VMAF/PSNR
A BS/MS degree in computer science or similar discipline
Bonus: Experience with performance and/or security testing
Bonus: Experience in testing video processing services
Benefits
Highly motivated, growing, diverse team made up of 33 different nationalities
Flexible work schedules and options to work from home
Flat hierarchies and open door policy
Competitive compensation and vacation entitlement
Social events ranging from company lunches and after work drinks to annual off site company events
Free yoga classes, German language classes and health checks
The Product Creation Team

At the heart of Zattoos organisation there is a group of people who are extremely passionate about TV Products and Technology. This diverse group of engineers, product managers, designers, SRE, network, QA and support specialists cover a large area of expertise and are building our vision of the streaming age TV platform. We value high quality, user oriented and sustainable work and strive to be at the forefront of technology and collaboration.

We encourage everybody to express their ideas and give autonomy and focus to independent teams. Our dream is to let people watch their favorite TV content in the simplest and most comfortable way. We see our strength in disrupting traditional broadcasting technology while collaborating closely with the great companies that produce this content

We are Zattoo

Zattoo enables our users to view indiscriminately and we reflect that in our team too. Regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by law we encourage everyone to apply and will give everyone equal consideration. JOIN US AND BECOME PART OF OUR STREAM TEAM!

Who We Are

Cobalt (cobalt.io) is a fast growing cybersecurity start-up headquartered in San Francisco. Cobalt is providing a Pentest as a Service Platform which leverages the sharing economy to find global security talent to help secure companies and their users. We have Scandinavian roots, an American base and a global outlook. Our offices in San Francisco, Berlin, and remote roles are characterized by a fun, fast-paced and collaborative culture based on individual responsibility and ownership.

Description

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help us convert our existing website into an effective sales channel and optimise the overall sales process, attract new visitors, improve customer conversion rate, reduce customer acquisition costs and achieve many other essential business goals being a part of a Growth Team. You will contribute to the way we build, maintain, and improve our software stack. You will work in a fast paced, agile environment, collaborating on a daily basis with our Engineering teams and Product Management.

What You Would Do
Work within a remote friendly engineering team (with opportunity to work in the Berlin office), following Agile and continuous automation processes to build out the best possible experience for our customers.
Partner with product, marketing and sales teams to gather requirements, brainstorm solutions and deliver creative solutions that meet needs with respect to usability, performance, aesthetics, reliability and realistic implementation schedules.
Work in a small, fast-paced, collaborative startup environment where you will certainly be able to make an impact as we aim to build the best penetration testing as a service platform.

6+ years of professional experience with web/software development
Experience working with microservices architecture, distributed systems, and RESTful APIs
Experience working with any cloud infrastructure, preferably GCP
Experience with continuous deployment processes
Knowledge of application architecture, security and reliability concepts
We work with Ruby on Rails and NodeJS, be ready to use (learn if needed) them on a daily basis
Good organization skills, excellent written and verbal communication in English.
Comfortable working in distributed environment
Why You Should Join Us
Opportunity to join and grow in a passionate, rapidly expanding industry

Company Intro & Mission


As one of the most successful and fast-growing FinTech startup companies in Europe, we are currently experiencing exciting growth and development. We are revolutionising the way people file their taxes; helping them to save money, time and stress by putting a personalised digital tax consultant into the palm of their hands. Our user-friendly Taxfix App enables people to file their tax declaration within 22 minutes on average, without any prior tax knowledge or the complicated forms associated with it.

Our offices in Berlin and Madrid are home to a diverse team of 200+ people who come from more than 40 nations around the world!

Our Tech Environment


The tax industry is outdated and we have embraced the disruption we can cause here by innovating and thinking outside of the typical "Tax box". We have created our own modelling language - TaxML so our tax experts can focus on designing user journey, while developers can focus on improving the product.

Our Tech stack is React and React Native on the frontend, NodeJs and Elixir on the backend. Everything is running in Docker, orchestrated by Kubernetes and powered by Google Cloud Platform. We are big fans of decentralised end-to-end ownership, cross-system contracts, internal open-source and data-driven decisions.

Our cross-functional teams have full exposure to all of the tech, and we support your development with the areas you want to grow. We have introduced internal Tech communities where you can join the one that excites you the most! We hire for your values and drive to learn - not just your technical skills, we love to foster growth from within.

We love to welcome the Berlin Tech community to our home here at Taxfix for Meetups and events.

Your responsibilities
Be part of a multidisciplinary product team working with the latest technologies for our German Country Market.
Be responsible for developing scalable micro-services that support our Apps and our core Tax expert system.
Be an important player in the integration of different APIs of the electronic tax filling systems of different countries.
Build and maintain scalable micro-services using NodeJS and TypeScript.
Apply innovative AI technologies to build intelligent software that can continuously assist users in collecting tax relevant information, enabling a fully-automated and optimised tax return at the end of the year.
Be involved in important product decisions and work closely with the whole team to deliver top-notch Apps.
Our team is looking for someone who is pragmatic, applies the best software engineering principles to build simple abstractions for complex problems, and who enjoys working in an agile environment.

We're a fit if you bring these qualities with you

Passion for crafting high quality and elegant code.
Strong programming skills in JavaScript with 4+years experience in backend development using NodeJS,
Previous experience building maintainable and scalable systems based on reliable and fault-tolerant services.
Good understanding of distributed system and requirements for high availability.

At Collins Aerospace, we work side-by-side with our customers to tackle the toughest challenges in aerospace and defense. Avionics Systems

Products for the aerospace industry
We have established ourselves as a leading supplier of customized electronics solutions for the aerospace and defense industries. Collins Aerospace in Heidelberg supplies integrated navigation and communications systems for a wide range of military applications and is a global leader in satellite reaction wheel technology.

We are redefining aerospace.

position: Senior Software Engineer / Full-Stack Web Developer (PHP + JS + PGSQL, m/f/d)
description:
We digitize the logistics industry, a 350+bn market in Europe! As the leading online road freight forwarding company in Germany, we offer business customers a fully digital booking experience for logistics services with one click only and as simple as online shopping.

Our five core values guide us in our interactions with customers, partners, and among each other
We solve the problem first
We are different together
We celebrate success
We deliver on our promises
We empower growth
Tasks


We are looking for you (m/f/d) to further accelerate our strong growth phase in our base in Berlin. Our Tech-Team is responsible for the delivery and maintenance of critical systems and user-facing parts of the platform and thereby plays a central role in the companys success! As a Senior Software Engineer / Full-Stack Web Developer (PHP + JS + PGSQL, m/f/d) you will become responsible for all (critical) parts of the platform and transform InstaFreight as a forwarding company to the market leader in the European road-freight traffic. In the future your project tasks include maintaining and improving our Product:
You are a Swiss Army Knife: you think outside the box and happily throw yourself at any problem
You are a positive and forward-looking human being - robots are cool and all, but we are a team that likes working together
You plan, propose and implement big and small projects from start to finish, improve and optimize as the requirements change, drive evolution of architecture, ensure reliability, test, monitor and add resilience
You understand that great results are delivered as a team effort therefore you collaborate closely with others, splitting and delegating tasks or pair programming as necessary, to leverage different skill sets and specialties across the team
Adopt, share and adapt conventions and best-practices - level up individually and as a team over time
Requirements
You have several years of experience with this tech stack:
PHP (we work with Phalcon, but that's not a requirement), SQL
JS (mostly vanilla and some react & redux), HTLM & CSS
Python & Node.js are a plus
data storage: SQL & NoSQL; PGSQL is a plus
Principles: agile, CI, SOLID
You are self-motivated and strive to find pragmatic, incremental paths to success, even when faced with big challenges
You are a positive and forward-looking human being - robots are cool and all, but we're a team that likes working together
You are willing to learn & master any technology, language, or development environment that we might need in the future
You value code quality and scalability
You feel comfortable owning complex systems and keep calm in tense times
You have excellent communication skills in English, spoken and written
Benefits


Take the driver seat
Take charge - Be accountable for your own field of responsibility from day one onwards.
Have impact - Drive development projects and steer the course of the company.
Make mistakes - Take risks, learn from failures and grow personally with us.
Hit the gas pedal
Learn as you go
Benefit from training, mentoring and feedback while supported by a great learning environment. Additionally our InstaSMART Academy offers exciting monthly insights and learning.
Accelerate - Leave your comfort zone and climb your personal growth ladder step by step.
Outgrow yourself - Unlock your full potential and accomplish things you hardly dare to dream of.
Enjoy the ride
Be part of the team - Join a great group of individuals standing behind a common goal.
Have fun - Take part in our legendary parties, company events or just the regular office craziness.
Write history - Shape the future of an entire industry together with us.
You couldn't find the perfect fit in our open positions? Just talk to our HR Managers and send out your CV!

We are DONE! Berlin, an international company in the field of organizational consulting. This also includes the recruitment, which we take over for renowned ventures or startup customers nationally and internationally.
For Our client, an open innovation collaboration platform, founded by one of the biggest German manufacturers in the consumer goods industry with worldwide brands, we are currently looking for Microsoft Azure DevOps Engineer (m/f/x). This is an exciting opportunity of joining an innovative corporate startup, to build and release pipelines

Tasks
Implement containerized solution using Docker and Azure Kubernetes Service
Setup development/quality/production environment on Azure platform
Define Azure Build and Release Pipelines for development/quality/production environment
Design an Azure app service web app by using Azure CLI, PowerShell, and other tools
Create an APIM instance, configure authentication for APIs, create an API gateway, and define policies for APIs
Requirements
Solid experience with Agile/Scrum methodology
Solid experience on version control systems (GIT experience is mandatory)
4+ years of experience delivering enterprise solutions on the Microsoft Azure platform
Solid understanding of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery best practices
Good understanding of full-stack web application development technology

Benefits
We love people who are committed to what they do and are driven by entrepreneurial spirit. Thats why you own your projects and take responsibility right from the start.
What brings us together is our unique collaborative spirit within cross-functional teamwork and agile communication practices.
We love to see our employees grow professionally and personally.
We support life-long learning in trainings, by digital means, and through coaching in our feedback-driven culture.
Competitive salary package
Office in Berlin Kreuzberg with free drinks, fruits, and snacks
We're looking forward to hearing from you!

Tasks


You are passionate about software development and feel most comfortable in a highly motivated team? In the innovative environment of e-mobility you can apply your skills and help shape tomorrow's technology today.

Here is your mission:
Make charging even smarter with our mobile electricity meter
Independently develop new features from design to coding to testing
Extend the embedded software for our SmartCable and SimpleSocket with focus on Java application on an embedded Android platform
Perform code reviews and analysis and create patches
Use agile processes, methods and tools
Work closely with our hardware and backend teams
Requirements


To succeed in this role, you have
a successful completion of a technical university degree, e.g. computer science or a comparable qualification
very good knowledge in Java and with Linux
experience in the series development of complex embedded systems, preferably in the Linux or Android environment
the ability to oversee complex systems from start to finish
a strong passion for development, creativity and pragmatism
team spirit, flexibility and resilience
fluent in English and German
basic knowledge of electrical engineering is advantageous
Benefits


You will become part of a future-oriented company supported by the world's leading energy and automotive companies.

At the innovative and conveniently located EUREF campus in the heart of Berlin-Schöneberg, we will set up a modern, well-equipped workplace for you.

You will become an important part of a creative, very cooperative team of highly motivated talents from all over the world. Together we will further develop the future topics of electromobility, SmartCities and the energy turnaround - definitely a job with meaning - and this internationally and globally.

Your further development is assured in our agile, innovative and fast-growing environment, because there are exciting development opportunities and plenty of room for your own ideas.

We also learn more every day and grow with our challenges, so don't be afraid to apply if you don't have some knowledge yet. We look forward to receiving your application with details of when you can start and your salary expectations.

Develop new tech skills while putting your energy into outcomes that benefit society as a whole
Join a remote-first team, with a hub in the heart of Berlin (work from home or at our office)

Very nice colleagues, office dog and only projects that have the potential to create impact at scale!

Progressive web-apps, Mobile apps, REST APIs, Content modelling, Component-based frontends, and connecting the best cloud-based tools to solve meaningful problems!

position: Working Student (m/f/d) Software Engineering & Deep Tech
description:
You’re kind of a nerd. We’re kind of nerds.
We should get to know each other.


Working Student (m/f/d) Software Engineering & Deep Tech


Code number: PDG-W-1593413175-E
Entry level: Working Student
Location:
Berlin
Organization:
Porsche Digital GmbH

Tasks

As a working student in Porsche Digital’s “Software Engineering & Deep Tech” Chapter in Berlin, you will work on various aspects of product development with a focus on process automation. In addition to your hands-on contribution in the form of code, participation in stand-up meetings and sprint planning rounds (Scrum), you will also work on research-oriented technology scouting topics. These selected deep-dives depend on the current need and on your individual technical background and interests. Examples are DevOps, cloud computing infrastructures, machine learning algorithms as well as blockchain, quantum computing applications and simulations. Feel free to bring in your specifc talent!

Qualifications

Enrollment in a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Math, Physics or equivalent.
Fast and eager learner.
Open mindset and likes to work in an international, fast-paced environment.
English skills, German is a plus.
Hands-on mentality with first software development experiences in practice.
A passion and solid foundations in at least one of the following topics:
Software Development
Data Science
Quantum Computing
Blockchain
Software Language Engineering
Earliest start date: July 2020

Duration: Initially 6 months, with the option for extension

At a Glance

Lightweight, agile, efficient - that’s what the Porsche experience is about. Innovating how we develop, manufacture and deliver our products, The Porsche Digital GmbH in Berlin works hand in hand with Porsche departments, as well as Porsche subsidiaries, partners and startups to transfer the Porsche experience to the digital world.

Our cross-departmental product teams develop intelligence software based on deep expertise about Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, and Internet of Things. We work along a lean digital product innovation approach merging agile ways of working like Design Thinking, Lean Startup and Scrum. Cross-organizational product teams follow a user-centered product development process to create Minimum Viable Products in a rhythm of 3-month iterations, while spreading new work culture within the Porsche organization.

As a lab team, we support Porsche innovators with studies, workshops, user research, knowledge exchange, on-the-project training and software development, validating desirability and feasibility from the first idea to Minimum Viable Products to ready-to-scale digital products with well thought through business and platform designs.

Porsche Digital Berlin is the automotive hub of Berlin’s technology and startup ecosystem, where creative people and innovators of all kinds are drawn to find a home base for their visions. Right in the heart of Kreuzberg-Friedrichshain, nearby the River Spree and not far away from our Berlin-based startup accelerator APX, the Porsche Digital Berlin is one of six locations of Porsche Digital worldwide, along with Ludwigsburg, Tel Aviv, San Francisco, San Jose and Shanghai. Porsche Digital is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Porsche AG.

Exclusive look behind the scenes

position: Senior Software Development Engineer - Amazon Redshift Spectrum
description:
We are searching for Senior Software Development Engineers with passion for large-scale system building and data-intensive applications. If you are motivated by the fact that your code helps thousands of the world biggest companies to get insights from their data this role is for you!

Our cloud data warehouse Amazon Redshift manages all the work needed to set up, operate, and scale a data warehouse, from provisioning capacity and installing software to monitoring and backing up the cluster, to applying patches and upgrades. With Redshift Spectrum, our customers can easily query data from Amazon S3, thereby scaling their warehouse out to Exabytes and allowing them to integrate data in all kinds of file formats from their data lake into their analytics.

As Senior Software Development Engineer at Amazon Redshift Spectrum, you will:
· Translate functional and technical requirements into system designs.
· Develop and enhance Redshift Spectrum components that are maintainable and testable, thereby leveraging the latest agile software engineering methodologies.
· Participate in code and design reviews to maintain our high development standards.
· Operate a large-scale, distributed service in the cloud.
· Mentor other new engineers and help mature a fast-growing team.
· Have responsibility for overall system architecture, scalability, reliability, and performance.
Joining the Amazon Redshift Spectrum team gives you the opportunity to:
· Work on the latest technology, as we constantly build the latest research concepts into Redshift Spectrum.
· Be part of something big, as you are working on a key pillar of AWSs extensive service portfolio and thousands of Amazon Redshift customers benefit from your contributions.
· Learn from the best, as you are working on challenging engineering tasks in a team of very experienced experts that are close to support you.
· Be part of a great team, as we invest a lot to create an inclusive environment that allows you to perform at your best, while maintaining a fun atmosphere.

Basic Qualifications

· 5 or more years of experience in professional software development
· Experience in writing system software in a systems language such as C or C++
· Masters in Computer Science or Engineering, or equivalent experience.
· Very good knowledge of data structures and algorithms.
· Ability to design software components and write high-quality code that is robust and easy to maintain.
· Ability to work in a fast paced and agile development environment.
· Experience debugging, diagnosing, and trouble-shooting software.
· Good communication skills, analytical abilities, and design skills.
· Experience with database internals especially query optimization, and query execution.

Preferred Qualifications

· PhD in Computer Science.
· Experience in writing multi-threaded programs requiring concurrency and synchronization mechanisms.
· Experience delivering and operating large-scale, highly available distributed systems.
· Proven ability to drive tasks to completion and take ownership of projects.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

What started as an underground art movement has now grown into the world’s most passionate online photography community and marketplace. description:
About SoundHound:

At SoundHound Inc., we believe every brand should have a voice. As the leading innovator of conversational technologies, we're trusted by top brands around the globe. Position: Full time
Salary Range: 50k - 75k yearly
About Gnosis:
We believe in a redistributed future. Gnosis builds new market mechanisms to make this future possible. Through decentralized platforms on the Ethereum blockchain, we enable the distribution of resourcesfrom assets to incentives, and information to ideas.
Gnosis was founded as part of ConsenSys, the globally leading Ethereum venture production studio, in 2015 by Martin Köppelmann and Stefan George. A ConsenSys spoke that was spun out to become a fully-fledged company early 2017, Gnosis was able to raise sufficient funding in their token sale last April to make the company a safe workplace for the next years to come. Now counting 50 employees, Gnosis is a Gibraltar based company with team members spread out all over the world and a main development hub in Berlin: Full Node, a co-working space for blockchain companies in the heart of Berlin Kreuzberg.
Our products are interoperable, allowing you to create, trade, and hold assets. While our prediction market platform allows anyone to build customized forecasting applications, our decentralized exchange models contribute to the stability of scalable token economics and enable access to arbitrage-free marketplaces. Additionally, our Gnosis Safe wallet aims to set a standard for secure, user-controlled fund storage.
Our decentralized platforms and applications provide foundational infrastructure, assuring security, stability, and foresight for the longevity of blockchain-driven technologies.
Join in on our mission to build the future!
About the role:
We are looking for an experienced systems engineer to join the OpenEthereum Client Development team.

The GCD team's goal is to develop a fast, light and robust ethereum 1.0 client in order to support a strong multi-client ethereum ecosystem. Gnosis is convinced that having a multi-client ethereum ecosystem is mission-critical for the ethereum blockchain. The client software is leveraging the advantages of Rust in order to achieve being one of the fastest and lightest clients.

You have the opportunity to work with us in the trendy kiez of Kreuzberg - where we run our beautiful co-working space for blockchain projects, Full Node. Also, you can join us as a remote employee and work from your hometown. Currently half of our team is working remotely.

What you'll do:
Implementing new upcoming Ethereum Improvement Proposals
Researching elegant designs, in order to keep the client light and fast.
Incorporate new user's feedback
Maintain the production code
Deliver high-quality code for features from concept until production
Contribute to our growing test suite
In the team of approximately 5 Rust-developers, you will have a shared responsibility for the design, development, and maintenance of the client
Who you are:
You have 3+ years of experience in system engineering, preferably in Rust, but other languages are good as well (C++, Go, ...)
You have 1+ years of experience in system engineering in Rust
Structuring processes for demanding infrastructure is your strength
You have good general programming and algorithm skills.
You have a good understanding of the Ethereum blockchain.
You care deeply about the quality and readability of your code.
You proactively drive technical direction such as improving performance, preventing issues, data usage, refactoring the codebase.
Leadership and architecture experience are a plus.
What we can offer you:
Make your mark in a growing, disruptive technology:
Be a part of an innovative blockchain company as we help drive change in a number of important global markets, including finance, insurance, and information discovery.
Flat hierarchies:
This means fewer processes and bureaucracy - see more of your ideas come to life!
Be set up for success from the start:
We'll equip you with the latest hardware, and plenty of learning opportunities through our fortnightly Brown Bag Lunches, guest speakers, meetups and workshops at Full Node, team knowledge sharing sessions and generous budgets for conferences and individual learning.
Flexible work and vacation times:
We truly believe in and stand for work-life balance. We have a great flexible work policy and a generous vacation allowance that supports you in living your best life!
Work and hang out with us:
On top of the events at Full Node, we have weekly breakfasts, monthly team dinners, an abundance of healthy snacks and drinks (including top-notch coffee!) Did we mention a company-wide annual offsite?
Conferences and Educational Budget:
At Gnosis, we support your growth and development with a generous annual education and conference budget.
Grow with us:
We're growing rapidly, the industry is expanding fast, and we have a lot to do. If you're someone who loves taking initiative and get things done, there's a lot of opportunities for your individual growth.
How to apply:
Please apply with your (English) resume and a short personal introduction.

We look forward to your application!

Variety is the spice of life and a celebrated component of our culture. At Gnosis, we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer: all qualified applicants are considered for positions regardless of race, ethnic origin, age, religion or belief, marital status, gender identification, sexual orientation, or physical ability.

Teraki is a Berlin-based, tech-driven company enabling true low-latency mobility by solving the big data problem for autonomous driving.

We stand for innovation in the rapidly developing connected car, self-driving, and 3D mapping worlds. Teraki provides data reduction and data processing solutions for Automotive (IoT) applications which enable the launch of new applications by reducing costs. With that we help our customers in the challenges that are posed by the data to be computed in (connected) cars for all sensors, video and 3D point cloud data. Teraki’s algorithms are suited to improve the quality of data to meet the strict safety criteria of automotive applications. As a side effect, less data needs to be acquired and less hardware has to be deployed to maintain the strict requirements of automotive hardware.

This combination makes it the best (and often the only) available solution for embedded use cases. We serve the OEM, Tier-1 and Aftermarket (Fleet-management, Telematics) by technically and economically enabling use cases such as Predictive Maintenance, UBI, Fleet-management, Telematics and Autonomous Driving. We focus on the B2B market. i.e. OEM, Tier1’s and Aftermarket players.

Hey,

für unser Team von mysimpleshow suchen wir eine neue Kollegin (m/w/d) im Frontend, die sich als Teamplayer gut in unseren agilen Entwicklungsprozess basierend auf SCRUM einfügt. Aufgaben


simpleshow startete 2008 als Medienagentur mit der manuellen Produktion von Erklärvideos. Die Erklärexperten von simpleshow helfen die komplizierter werdende Welt für jeden verständlich zu machen.

Die manuelle Produktion wird mit der Webanwendung mysimpleshow seit ca. 2 Jahren von einem jungen Entwicklerteam in Kooperation mit externen Partnern digital nachgebaut.

Nicht nur nachgebaut die Vision ist es ein Produkt zu schaffen, welches es jedem Nutzer ermöglicht ein Erklärvideo quasi vollautomatisch erstellen zu lassen. Dazu kann auch heute schon aus einem geschrieben Skript ein Video generiert werden, welches der Nutzer in Zwischenschritten noch individualisieren kann.

Qualifikation
Du bist ein/e begeisterte/r und erfahrene/r Frontend-Entwickler/in
Du bist ein Vorbild und kannst dein umfassendes Wissen über Software-Entwicklung mit Frontend-Technologien an das Team weitergeben
Als Lead im Frontend nutzt du deinen Freiraum um neue Ideen auf eigene Initiative zusammen mit deinen Kolleg*innen voranzubringen
Du kennst dich hervorragend aus in Angular
Du hast am besten schon mit AngularJS gearbeitet
Du verstehst Redux und hast schon mit NgRx gearbeitet
Du beherrschst git
Du gehst analytisch vor und schreibst sauberen und performanten Code
Du legst Wert auf eine gut strukturierte Anwendungsarchitektur
Du hast Spaß daran, neue Produkte von Anfang an mit zu entwickeln
Du hast ein Auge für Design sowie ein Gespür für Usability und willst uns dabei helfen, dass unsere Nutzer mit noch weniger Klicks professionelle Erklärvideos produzieren können
Du kannst gelegentliche Unterstützung bei der Anpassung von Wordpress-Themes leisten
Du verstehst und sprichst gut Deutsch und Englisch
Unseren kompletten Technologie-Stack findest du hier https://stackshare.io/simpleshow-gmbh/mysimpleshow-frontend

Benefits


Wir sind ein lockeres und offenes Team programmieren auch manchmal außerhalb der Büroräume und treffen uns gerne mal nach der Arbeit zu einem Bierchen. Für das mysimpleshow Dev-Team zu arbeiten heißt viele Freiräume zu genießen, so kannst du dir deine Arbeitszeit sehr frei einteilen und auch flexibel Home-Office machen das beinhaltet die Verantwortung sich seine Zeit selbstdiszipliniert einzuteilen und selbstständig arbeiten zu können.

KLINGT NACH DIR?

Dann freuen wir uns auf deine vollständige Bewerbung, um dich besser kennenzulernen. Kurz. Knapp. Simple.

Bitte vergiss nicht, uns deine Angaben zum Eintrittstermin & deine Gehaltsvorstellungen zu nennen.
