We are Kolibri Games - a mobile games developer from Berlin. Our two games have over 100 million downloads and we are on a mission to become the most player-centric games studio out there.

We believe in players, creating value, learning, but, most of all, we believe in people. We strive to offer you a fair recruitment process and a great candidate experience, as well as a friendly environment to work in, with plenty of opportunities to learn and grow. Help us bring joy to people, we promise you will have fun by doing so :)

Senior Unity Games Developer (f/m/d)

We are looking for a Senior Unity Developer to join us and work with one of our games, which are played by millions of players.

At Kolibri Games, we have a unique approach to development: we work in weekly sprints and release features/updates on a weekly basis. You would therefore actively contribute to the ongoing development of new features, directly impacting a hugely popular game.

We're looking for a passionate Unity developer who will enjoy working in a fast-paced environment on Free to Play Mobile titles.

Responsibilities
Implement UI, game logic and new features in a fast and agile environment
Optimize game elements by incorporating player feedback
Write tests and robust code to be used by millions of users
Autonomously drive projects
Coordinate improvements to the game
Constantly share knowledge company wide
Show ownership and be responsible for the development of new features
Support and contribute new ideas to game design
Required skills
At least 2 years of professional experience with Unity3d
Experience with optimizing performance of mobile games for both iOS and Android
Software development experience in C# or other general purpose programming languages
Familiarity with reactive programming and dependency injection frameworks, like UniRx or Zenject
Ability to quickly get up to speed with existing code
Awareness of and ability to leverage industry best practices and solutions and apply the right solution for a given problem
Must be proactive, self-directed and organized
Desirable skills
Wide understanding of different game technology areas (gameplay, graphics, tools etc.)
A passion for mobile games
Your Benefits – We’re game to support you

- Competitive Salary - We believe that top performers should receive top payment
- Training Budget - We believe in learning. A generous personal learning budget to spend on learning and development, including books, workshops and attending conferences. We also offer in-house training such as coding and German classes
- Flexible working hours and Home office – We believe in a good work-life balance
- Equipment - State-of-the-art technical equipment, including laptops and phones, which may also be used in your free time
- Health and Fitness - We pay €50 towards a monthly gym membership or a fitness activity
- Relocation - Relocation support to help you move to Berlin
- Pension - Opportunity to save for your pension tax-free

Bonus Level – We love to have a good time, too

- Food and Drinks - Fresh fruits to keep you healthy and fresh coffee to keep you alert. We also have a fully stocked fridge with Smoothies, Coke, Club Mate, beer etc
- Parties and Team Events - Apart from our regular parties, BBQ’s and movie nights we also have a team event budget you can use to buy games or sports equipment to make working here even more fun
- Company Holidays - Every year we go on an amazing company holiday to relax and bond as a team. Last summer we went to Greece!
- Friday Celebrations - Company-provided dinner and drinks on Friday afternoons

Kolibri Games is an equal opportunity employer. We come from 25 different countries and many different backgrounds. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, regardless of their age, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, physical appearance or disability.

We are an international studio, so don’t forget to send in your application in English. Although it is not mandatory, we always appreciate a cover letter stating your motivation to join us.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Oliver Moser

Geschäftsführer

We are now looking for experienced test automation engineers to work on our cloud operations platform turning the best open source technologies into frustration-free cloud services. You’ll be part of a team working on the Aiven cloud platform, further extending the test automation and test infrastructure and focusing on more complicated scenarios, like performance testing and upgrade tests. You will also be fixing bugs and adding test cases for those and, depending on your interests, you can also participate in feature development.

Our philosophy is to automate everything and to avoid repetitive manual work in everything we do. Our own backend systems are mostly implemented in Python with bits of Java, Go and C. We offer and operate a number of complex open source databases such as PostgreSQL, MySQL and Apache Cassandra as well as other open source data technologies like Apache Kafka.

Requirements

To succeed in this role, you need a strong background in software engineering and test automation. We are looking for self-driven test automation developers who are enthusiastic about programming and willing to help others. We value analytical problem-solving skills and an openness to new ideas.

Key requirements for success in this role include:
Excellent development skills in Python (pytest)
Keen interest in test automation
Experience on using Linux in development
Fluency in English, verbal and written
What we value:
Hands-on experience with some of the following systems: Apache Kafka, Apache Cassandra, PostgreSQL, MySQL and Elasticsearch
Experience and interest on infrastructure as code
Good understanding of security (software, networking)
Benefits

What we can offer:
A fast growing tech company with plenty of opportunities for everyone to develop and progress your career
Lots of autonomy to be creative and work “your way”
Participation in employee stock option plan
Relocation package
Mobile phone and subscription
Flexible working hours
Cool Office in the centre of Berlin (Prenzlauer Berg) and remote working flexibility
Office snacks, soft drinks, treats and fruits
You will be part of a highly-skilled, tight-knit team of around 80 people, learn from our experience and make your contribution essential to what is becoming a great success story. If you’re interested, send us your application.

Do you believe in beauty when it comes to programming? Do you have a vivid interest in elegant algorithms? Are you fluent in C++? If so, we would like to meet you. Here is what we offer in a nutshell:

A wide array of extremely challenging C++ development tasks
An international team of brilliant minds
A working environment that makes this team stay and grow
Enough time to make sure that every detail of your solution is perfect
A flat organization and plenty of room for your ideas
No scheduled meetings
Family-friendly working hours, no deadlines, no overtime
Support for relocation
A competitive salary from the start and a raise to EUR 120,000 annually after only one year

About Company

Think-cell is a fast-paced software company in Berlin, Germany, with a focus on developing graphics products that stand out from the crowd. More than 700,000 users world-wide rely on our software for their daily business as it makes creating graphical presentations so much easier, faster and more enjoyable. Among our customers are many renowned consulting companies and large international corporations.

We do not have to make compromises with regard to code quality and beauty, because think-cell is profitable and has no outside investors. We are willing to go the extra mile of developing sophisticated algorithms and refining our user interface, and we are proud of our many happy customers. The fact that the company is owned and managed by seasoned computer scientists certainly contributes to a working environment that makes exceptional developers come and stay.

Language

Everything we do is C++. Even our customer portal is written in C++. There is some Assembler glue code where it is necessary, and our build scripts are written in Python, but other than that think-cell is all about C++.
Naturally, we use C++11 features like lambdas and rvalue references throughout our codebase, and have switched to C++14 where our compilers support it.
We fund the working group for programming languages of the German Institute for Standardization (DIN). Some of our employees are members of this committee and vote in the international standardization process of ISO/IEC C++.
We sponsor the Standard C++ Foundation helping them to promote the understanding and use of modern Standard C++ on all compilers and platforms.

Library

We use Boost throughout our code, e.g., Boost.Spirit for parsing.
We have our own range library, in the same spirit as Boost.Range or Eric Niebler’s range-v3, but going further, for example, by unifying internal and external iteration. We gave a talk about it, and most of the code is public.
We develop our own cross-platform library to support Mac and Windows with a single code base.
We have our own reference-counting and persistence libraries to save and restore whole object trees.
We have an extensive bug reporting infrastructure. Assertions and error checks stay in the release code, and our software automatically reports bugs to our server. The server analyzes the bug, categorizes it and files it in a database that all developers can access. If an update fixes the bug, the user can download the update directly from a bug response web page.

Algorithms

think-cell was founded on the idea for an algorithm for automatic slide layout, and we are still on an exciting journey towards that ambitious vision. You can see our most recent release in action!
We developed a new algorithm for automatic point cloud labeling that allows labels to be positioned away from the actual points.
We developed a new algorithm for automatic column chart labeling.
We are working with John Forrest – author of the linear solver CLP – to make his simplex code faster on our kind of problems.
We developed many generic data structures that are not in C++ or Boost, for example partitions.
Our software not only produces charts, it is also able read them back from paper. For our chart recognition tool, we rely on OpenCV and the Leptonica Image Processing Library.

Reverse Engineering

We do lots of reverse engineering with the disassembler IDA from Hex-Rays, in order to achieve things that are not possible via the documented Microsoft Office API.
We wrote probably the best function hooking engine out there. On each start of our software, we patch the Microsoft Office executables in memory. Rather than hard-coding patch addresses, we search for small chunks of assembly code to be robust against minor changes in the executables.

About this job

We are looking for smart, creative developers with a solid theoretical background. Developers we have hired in the past mostly hold an exceptional master's degree in computer science or even a doctorate. You will work largely independently and will be responsible for the whole range of activities when implementing a new feature. You should be able to look at a problem from the user's perspective and discuss abstract concepts with fellow developers. We expect each of our developers to do architecture, design, implementation, customer feedback and bug fixing, rather than splitting these activities between several people. We thus put everyone in control of their own work.

At think-cell, there are no deadlines, and no scheduled meetings. A feature is ready to be released when you are convinced that you have implemented the best possible solution. Meetings take place as needed, with only the people that are actually involved being required to be present. At any time in the process, ideas, suggestions and criticism from anybody in the hierarchy is welcome and is seriously considered. Your ideas are welcome, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better.

We have published several scientific articles in the areas of Artificial Intelligence and Computer Graphics and we will encourage you to do the same. We sponsor visits to conferences and have close relationships with universities and research institutes in the U.S. and Germany.

think-cell encourages a healthy work-life balance. We do not work at night or on weekends, and support our staff's families with a full-time company nanny. She is available for free when children are sick, or when you just feel like spending an evening out.

We pay very competitive salaries and offer our developers EUR 120,000 annually following one year of employment. If necessary, we will go out of our way to help you relocate to Berlin, and will do what we can to help you acquire a work permit. While you should be able to communicate effectively in English, knowing German is not required. German language courses can be arranged, if desired.

Merantix Labs - Front-End Developer

Full-time - Berlin, Germany

Are you excited about developing solutions for clients from different industries? Are you passionate about huge data sets and machine learning? Do you want to work in a fast-paced environment and take over responsibility and ownership? Then this is for you: We are looking for a talented full stack engineer to help us build cutting edge machine learning solutions for our clients!

What we Do

Merantix is a pioneering technology lab and incubation platform for Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to conceptualize, build and scale AI products that transform entire industries and organizations. Merantix incubation platform is distinct in its access to world-class engineering and business talent, its trusted brand among corporations and regulators as well as its sophisticated technology stack, all of which accelerate prototyping and productization.

MX Labs conceptualizes, builds, and scales machine-learning solutions for clients across all industries. Our current projects include developing logistics solutions for retailers, quality assurance tools for manufacturing, machine-learning systems for financials providers and a cancer detection system for a healthcare provider. We take advantage of three core competencies: our experience applying machine learning, our expertise fostering enterprise partnerships to assemble vast datasets, and our culture of rapid iterations to build scalable products.

Our team is made up of entrepreneurs, scientists, and engineers from premier universities around the world. Many of us have PhDs and work experience at top tech companies. We’re based in Europe’s startup capital, Berlin, and are growing quickly!

Your Role

Your responsibilities as part of the engineering team at MX Labs will include:
Design a visualization environment which allows clients and researchers to easily interact with data;
Conceptualize and build large-scale web applications for the deployment of deep learning models;
Develop applications and tools for data integration, experimentation, quality & modelling;
Work with and contribute to cutting-edge open-source frameworks.
You will interact with clients from various sectors. The tasks are diverse and non-repetitive, building new and innovative systems using state of the art research and infrastructure. Some projects require a quickly prototyped proof-of-concept or local demo; others require production-ready applications securely deployed to a client’s infrastructure.

In addition, You will get a chance to work closely with the whole Merantix Studio team as well as discuss machine learning, data pipelines, infrastructure and related topics with our growing team of engineers and domain experts in other ventures.

Your Qualifications

We define ourselves by a culture of ownership and cooperation. We are looking for driven, capable, visionary and prudent talents with proven track records of personal, academic and professional achievement:
BA/BS in computer science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience
Solid competence in software engineering with a common programming language such as Python, Go, C++, or similar
Competence and experience with HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript
Experience designing, implementing, and interacting with REST API’s
Experience in web technologies, such as Node/Flask/Tornado, Angular/React/Svelte/Vue/Bootstrap, D3.js/three.js/Pixi.js, or similar.
Passionate about creating outstanding products with a simple interface using elegant solutions

Preferable qualifications (Full Stack Developer):
MS in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical field
Industry experience developing web applications for data processing and visualization
Experience with SQL (such as PostgreSQL or MySQL) and NoSQL databases (such as BigTable or MongoDB)
Experience with large-scale data integration (ETL, data lakes, data warehouses)
In depth experience scaling cloud infrastructure (e.g. GCP, Azure, AWS, Docker) in production
You understand and advocate for sound engineering practices including: agile methodology, code review, version control, clean and maintainable code, CI/CD
Entrepreneurial mindset, hands-on mentality, resilience and a passion for solving big challenges using elegant solutions.
Working at Merantix

Our hierarchy is flat and communication direct, which means that we operate and learn fast, as a team. You are a great fit for our team if this describes you:
Entrepreneurial mindset: Creative, focused, and not easily discouraged;
An ability to work in a fast-paced, highly innovative environment where ambiguity is the norm;
Excellent technical and analytical problem-solving skills, with the ability to step back and contextualize the problem and its root;
Independent but cooperative mindset;
Strong organizational and multitasking skills with ability to prioritize appropriately and effectively;
Love what you do (and own it).
In addition to a competitive salary you can expect the following:

Engaging topics:

Merantix offers unique insights in applied machine learning research and development, working with a group of highly talented engineers and entrepreneurs. Joining a dynamic, young company with an interdisciplinary team, you are encouraged to pursue your curiosity for a variety of topics and to approach challenges in creative and innovative ways.

Dynamic working culture:

Merantix offers a dynamic and flexible work environment in an international team. We are a fully trust-based organization and believe in ownership of work, personal responsibility, and the motivation of our people. We have flexible working hours and offer free drinks, fruit, weekly team lunch, and many more. Constant training inhouse, in workshops and at least one conference attendance a year is important for us.

Excellence:

We are driven researchers, developers and entrepreneurs who believe in what they create and are committed to the success of their ventures. In order to build disruptive products, we strive for outstanding quality and visionary ideas in a high-performance environment.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity. We consider all applications equally regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity. We strongly encourage individuals from groups traditionally underrepresented in tech to apply, and we can help with immigration.

Senior Geo-IT Developer (m,w,d)

Work at LiveEO in the vibrant Berlin Start-Up ecosystem

At LiveEO you will be working as a team lead and solution developer in a Berlin-based space Start-Up. Take our products to the next level and help us bring earth observation to the enterprise sector. Your task is to lead the development of analytical products for new business opportunities and iterate them with our business development team and potential customers.
Work at LiveEO
We are a young, open-minded, and diverse team with flat hierarchies, spanning different nationalities from all over the globe. We’re excited about space, satellites and new possibilities to disrupt markets with state-of-the-art earth observation technologies. We are conveniently located in the center of Berlin-Kreuzberg.
Your challenges
Coordinate a team of GIS specialists, software engineers and data scientists.
Manage customer-facing and internal projects for developing analytical products based on satellite data.
Take a proactive role in our agile organization and help the team with project planning and execution.
Support the spatial data management team by expanding, handling and maintaining our spatial databases.
Your profile

Experience with Remote Sensing Data
Advanced experience with spatial databases (PostgreSQL/PostGIS) is an asset.

Perseus Technologies GmbH is part of the HDI Group and was founded in September 2017 with the vision of enabling permanent IT security and data protection.

The aim of Perseus' employee-centric offering is to establish a long-term cyber security culture along all phases of a cyberattack. The Perseus 360-degree concept includes browser-based employee training, 24/7 cyber emergency assistance, intelligent anti-virus software and a cyber protection letter.

We are more than 50 employees from over 12 nations and work together in the Fintech Hub H:32 in the heart of Berlin.

As a Senior Backend Developer at Perseus, you will work with a small team of highly skilled developers delivering experience behind our Security Club. You will be responsible for writing, testing, maintaining and measuring security domain products using your professional skills.

What we would like to see in you:

Competitive salary.

Working with a great team in our amazing office in fintech hub H32 incl. free drinks and snacks, community events and other employer benefits (e.g. discounts for transportation tickets, gym memberships, local restaurants and more).

position: Fullstack Software Engineer (Ruby, ReactJS) - CX Logistics
description:
Marley Spoon (ASE:MMM) is bringing delightful, market fresh and easy cooking back to the people, while re-inventing the global food supply chain to reduce unethical food waste. We are connecting consumers with quality producers, providing fresh ingredients directly to customer's homes and we are present in Europe, the US and Australia, shipping about 100 000 food boxes every week.

Our CX Backend team composed of ten engineers and we’re aiming to grow it to twenty. The team will be then organised in four sub teams (core 1 & 2, logistics and product). You will be part of the logistics team which maintains one of our most critical internal tools called Ziplog. This tool is used by our logistics managers to decide where, when and how we deliver. At the moment, the tool can already cover the normal use cases but we need it to become smarter and handle incidents, so we can still delight our customers.

Your role is instrumental in supporting global spanning and getting Marley Spoon equipped for the current massive growth and the potential ahead.

Tech Stack
Ruby, Ruby on Rails
ReactJS
GraphQL
Kafka
Docker, Kubernetes
AWS
Jest
Your role
Write testable and readable code, that runs fast and reliably
Shape the future of our backend architecture and tooling within a small sub-team of backend engineers
Rebuild the Ziplog tool and migrate it to AWS, along with the team
Work closely with the other teams and your teammates to arrive at the best possible feature implementation
Be a customer yourself so you're a direct user of what you're building. You'll receive the product for free of course ;)
Requirements
Several years of experience
Professional experience in Ruby & ReactJS
Strong testing mindset
Worked on a microservice architecture before or have experience in spanning applications across the globe
Excellent communication skills
A drive to learn and improve yourself and others around you
Proactive and collaborative
Benefits
Autonomy & Impact
Flexible working hours, home office and a remote work friendly environment
Spend 5% of your working time on personal learning and development
Conference / Training budget

Possibility to trade part of your salary for double the amount of stock options

Free food boxes delivered to your doorstep

Gym membership & language courses
Friday drinks and many after work events
An open, diverse and respectful culture with over 50 nationalities

position: Full Stack Developer (m/w/d) für innovative Cloud-Service-Plattform
description:
Full Stack Developer (m/w/d) für innovative Cloud-Service-Plattform Entwicklung

Zur Unterstützung unseres* Entwicklerteams suchen wir *Full Stack Developer (m/w/d), die sichinTechnologienaus den Bereichen Cloud Computing, Künstliche Intelligenz und Quantum Computing zuhause fühlen oder Interesse haben sich in diesen Bereichen schnell und zielgerichtet weiterzuentwickeln und bereit sind auf Basis agiler Methoden in einem motivierten und kollegialen Team zu arbeiten.

Die 2007 in Berlin gegründete StoneOne AG versteht sich als „Web Service Factory“, die maßgeschneiderte Technologien und Lösungen für die digitale Transformation entwickelt. Im Fokus stehen dabei Software- und Service-Plattformen, etwa für das Internet der Dinge, Künstliche Intelligenz und Quantum Computing. Zielgruppe sind vor allem Unternehmen, die auf Basis der Web Service Factory und flankierender Dienstleistungen eigene Lösungen als Cloud-basierte Services anbieten wollen. Dabei setzen wir auf neueste Technologien und Frameworks für die Entwicklung von Cloud-native Applikationen. Um neueste Technologien für unsere Kunden zu analysieren und nutzbar zu machen, beteiligen wir uns regelmäßig an Forschungsprojekten, um technologisch ganz vorne mitzumischen. Unsere Kunden sind typischerweise Softwarehäuser, Service Provider und IT-Abteilungen großer Unternehmen, die unsere Web Service Factory für spannende neue Services oder die Modernisierung von Legacy Systemen nutzen.

Das erwartet dich bei StoneOne
Als Full Stack Developer bist du Teil eines agilen Teams und treibst die Entwicklung einer neuen Plattform für Quanten-unterstützte Künstliche Intelligenz voran. Außerdem entwickelst du interdisziplinären Zusammenspiel mit Quantum- und KI-Spezialisten skalierbare Softwarelösungen für unsere Kunden
Du arbeitest in einem agilen und kollegialen Team, in einem Unternehmen mit offener Kultur, kurzen Entscheidungswegen und einer flachen Hierarchie
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und viel Gestaltungsspielraum bieten Freiraum für eigene Ideen, Lösungswege und eine optimale Kombination von Beruf und Freizeit
Du bekommst einen attraktiven, gut ausgestatteten Arbeitsplatz mitten im Herzen der Metropole Berlin – mit sehr guter Anbindung an alle öffentlichen Verkehrsmittel
Wir unterstützen dich bei deiner fachlichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung sowie Zertifizierungen, denn für uns gilt hier – Stillstand ist Rückschritt
Das erwarten wir von dir
Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder vergleichbare Kenntnisse aus anderen Studiengängen wie zum Beispiel Mathematik oder Physik
Du bringst mindestens 1 Jahr Entwicklungserfahrung mit Java im Umfeld komplexer Anwendungssysteme mit
Du besitzt fundiertes Know-how in der Software-Entwicklung mit Webtechnologien wie Vue.js, Angular, HTML, CSS und RESTful Services – Kenntnisse in Technologien wie GraphQL, Web Components, Spring Boot, Quarkus und Kubernetes sind von Vorteil
Du bringst Engagement, Teamfähigkeit und ein Bestreben nach fachlicher und persönlicher Weiterentwicklung mit
Du hast gute Kenntnisse der deutschen (mindestens B2) und englischen Sprache
Interessiert?

Bewirb dich bei uns einfach per Mail an Silke Klemann

Wir freuen uns dich kennen zu lernen!

Art der Stelle: Vollzeit, Festanstellung

Arbeitszeiten:
8-Stunden-Schicht
Montag bis Freitag
Leistungen:
Flexible Arbeitszeiten
Homeoffice:
Temporär, aufgrund von COVID-19

position: Senior Java Developer (m/f/d) flexible home office possibility
description:
What were looking for

Do you want to use your skills to join a motivated team? LucaNet offers you many different opportunities in our software development department. The spectrum ranges from product and app development to the development of inhouse analysis tools to working on our cloud solution.

Apply now if you agree on most points:
You have successfully completed your studies in computer science or a comparable course of study and are convinced that youre the right person for us.

Imagine yourself designing and implementing the next breakthrough AI/Machine-Learning services, enabling AI for everyone at the start of the company's explosive growth.

At super.AI, we are building services to enable AI/Machine Learning technologies for the masses. We are at the exciting stage where the growth of our company forces us to do aggressive hirings to realize our visions quicker.

What you'll do:
Design/implement a system orchestrating machine learning workflows
Build SDKs to enable engineers using our platform easily
Build tools to enable our AI engineers be efficient in developing new AI solutions
Build CI/CD pipelines for our microservices-based infrastructure
You will be part of team discussions on architectural design and solutions
What we are looking for:
Smart, humble, hardworking, and collaborative
By smart we don't necessarily mean high IQ (although a huge plus), but an affinity toward learning. We want to automate as much as possible so we can focus on the few things that require human intelligence and creativity.
By humble we don't mean submissive or unambitious, we mean it in the same way Roger Federer is humble.
By hardworking, we don't mean long hours (be with your family). What we mean is while you're here you're doing the best work of your life. It means being disciplined, professional, focused, gritty, resilient, and resourceful.
By collaborative, we don't mean submissive or deferential, it means taking leadership from everywhere. "I'm taking responsibility to fix this system", if there's a lack of trust "I'm going to address it", if goals are unclear "I'm going to deal with it", it's about being a meritocracy
All four of the above are required. We all know people missing one of these and it's not nice to work with them (e.g. someone who is smart and hardworking but not humble and collaborative).
Paradoxical
The people we like the most are smart but humble
Wants to win no matter what, but will not cross lines of integrity to get there
Strong beliefs weakly held, etc.
3+ years of software engineering experience
3+ years of experience designing, coding (Java, Python), testing and debugging large scale systems
Good understanding of QA best practices in CI/CD processes
Solid experience developing cloud software services and an understanding of design for scalability, performance and reliability
If this resonates with you, it would be amazing to get to know each other- reach out and send an application!

Wir suchen ab sofort zur Verstärkung unseres Teams eine/n Senior System Architect / DevOps Engineer (m/w/d)

Als Atlassian Platinum Solution Partner und AWS Consulting Partner ist die demicon GmbH Spezialist für ganzheitliche IT-Lösungen. Was Dich erwartet
Als Mitglied eines interdisziplinären Teams bist Du vor allem verantwortlich für den Entwurf sowie die Implementierung von geeignete System-Architekturen für unsere Kunden.

Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Kunden aus unterschiedlichen Branchen zusammen und führst mit ihnen Anforderungsanalysen und Workshops durch

Wer du bist
Im Idealfall hast Du ein Studium der Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Medieninformatik o.ä. abgeschlossen. Bei entsprechender Qualifikation oder Berufserfahrung spielt das Studium für uns jedoch keine Rolle

As a Working student Software Test Engineering at simplesurance you will have the chance to dive deep into Software Testing and be a high valued part of our multicultural team. You don't just find bugs – you contribute to our complete product.

Fernarzt (www.fernarzt.com) is a telemedicine platform that connects patients to physicians and coordinates the purchase of medications prescribed. Thereby, Fernarzt enables patients to receive fast, safe and competent medical care for common diseases. Based in London and with offices in Berlin, the mission of the company is to provide a digital service to reduce time and facilitate access to healthcare. Fernarzt was founded in 2017 together with the Digital Health platform Heartbeat Labs.

Join us as Senior Backend Software Engineer (m/f/d) and help us to advance telemedicine in Germany!
YOUR ROLE
Build and maintain the secure and reliable infrastructure for the telehealth platform
Ensure the reliability of the systems by setting up sufficient monitoring and alerting systems and tools.
Help to troubleshoot networking, hardware, and general performance issues.
Participate in design, planning and the development of new web applications and services using cutting-edge technologies and frameworks in a service-oriented platform.
Continuous improvement of the Fernarzt technical solutions in adherence to industry best practices and business needs.
Being a mentor and coach for other engineering team members
YOUR PROFILE
You have 5+ years of experience as a Developer, ideally in a Start-up environment.
You are passionate about Software Engineering.
You have great skills in PHP and you follow current best practices.
Experience working with other languages (eg. Golang, Scala, Kotlin, Java) is a plus.
You know how to work with Docker and what Kubernetes is.
Experience of working with Cloud Platforms like AWS, Google, DigitalOcean.
You are pragmatic, enjoy taking responsibility and you always set high-quality standards for yourself.
TDD, DDD, CQS, CQRS, ES, and SOLID do not seem to be meaningless combinations of letters to you.
You are a confident Linux user.
Excellent communication skills (business fluent in English, German a plus).
Team player, seeking to work with distinctive entrepreneurial individuals.
You are detail-oriented and decide based on data & insights.
You execute with ownership, determination and free of politics and you have a hands-on mentality.
THAT’S WHY FERNARZT FITS YOU
Innovation and Healthcare are your passion? Ours as well! As a digital health player, we provide you the platform to contribute with your talent, come up with new ideas and shape our vision.
Join a start-up with a strong PE investor that is entering its next scaling phase with many opportunities to influence where the business is heading.
In a dynamic start-up environment, you get a lot of insights into different areas, sometimes start from scratch, and can get really hands-on.
Teamwork is key! We want to achieve goals together. This also includes the necessary freedom so you can freely develop - professionally and personally.
Do you think now - That's me! Then we are looking forward to your application!

Comtravo - Making Business Travel Radically Simple

We are a team of travel experts, tech enthusiasts and customer support heroes – with the shared purpose to simplify business travel. Comtravo provides small and medium-sized companies a truly unique solution. Travelers or travel managers can book and manage their business trips with one simple text message. Using state-of-the-art technologies, such as NLP and machine learning techniques, we are automating our fulfilment pipeline. This enables our in-house travel experts to focus on complex requests and the individual needs of our clients.

Our tech stack:

The backend is primarily built in Node.js / Typescript and consists of around 20 major RESTful services plus around 60 microservices. We make heavy use of Docker and Terraform and are running on AWS.
Services are coupled by events and run on AWS ECS and Lambda.

We invest heavily in shared components, libraries, automated tests, monitoring and sane interfaces. Together with a strong CI/CD pipeline we are able to release many times per day to production.
YOUR TASK
You develop and optimize our booking platform and creating a smooth and pleasant end-user experience for our customers and internal stakeholders
You maintain and optimize existing features and services for performance and stability
You are responsible for the design and implementation of complex, scalable data processing
You troubleshoot and work out solutions for complex and challenging problems
You collaborate with our developer team on infrastructure optimization
You work in close cooperation with other developers, our product team and
You foster a culture of transparency and communication and challenge others while letting them challenge you to deliver the best results possible
YOUR PROFILE
You have a degree in Software Engineering (or a related field)
You have a solid background knowledge in Computer Science (Data Structures, Algorithms, Design Patterns, Scaling)
You have a minimum of 4 years professional experience in software development
You have the ability to write production ready code in Node.js / Angular 2+ / Javascript/ Typescript
You have a strong focus on Code Quality, Robustness, Automation, Testing and Monitoring
You have basic knowledge in Linux and Docker
You have experience with Amazon Web Service (AWS)
WHAT WE OFFER?
Competitive salary & flexible working hours
Attractive benefits for flights and hotels for your personal travels
Company pension plan
German classes
Corporate discounts with external partners
An exciting job in a High-Tech startup in Berlin, the Silicon Valley of Europe
Access to a great network of entrepreneurs in Berlin and some of the best travel & B2B investors in EU
Influence the development of the company
Cooperation with an extremely strong and competent team, which built up several global businesses
Transparency with flat hierarchies where every person is highly valued
Company parties, weekly team lunches and a lot more events
A loft office in the heart of Berlin with everything you need (e.g. free fruits, snacks & drinks)
Interested? Then go ahead and apply now !

For our office in Berlin, Prenzlauer Berg, we are now looking for experienced backend developers to work on our cloud operations platform turning the best open source technologies into frustration-free cloud services. The Network Planning Optimization team drives and builds our optimization use cases in network planning, ranging from bus circulation optimization to an automated schedule creation.

Für die Product Area Acquisition & Loyalty suchen wir aktuell einen weiteren Software-Entwickler. Wir haben uns zum Ziel gesetzt, Neukunden*innen für idealo zu gewinnen und diese durch geeignete Maßnahmen in wiederkehrende „idealo Lovers“ zu verwandeln. In unseren Teams kannst du u.a. Funktionen wie den Preiswecker, Datenbereitstellung für CRM-Maßnahmen, Recommendation Engine, SEO Dienste und Identitätsmanagement weiter entwickeln.

Stellenanforderungen
Deine Aufgaben
Du bist Teil eines cross-funktionalen Entwicklungsteams, dass immer nach den besten technischen Lösungen sucht
Wir arbeiten in einem agilen Team, und daher begleitest Du den gesamten Entwicklungsprozess von einer Idee bis hin zu einem Produkt, das hunderttausende User täglich in der Hand halten
Du verwendest moderne Technologien wie Spring Boot, Spring Cloud, AMQP (vorrangig mit Kafka) and Machine Learning
Du entwirfst und implementierst skalierbare und hoch verfügbare Microservices und Web-Anwendungen die uns unseren großen VM und OpenShift Clustern laufen
Du treibst unsere Innovation vorwärts und strebst nach technischer Exzellenz. Du arbeitest eng mit dem Produktmanagement zusammen, um das bestmögliche Produkt zu erstellen

Das bringst Du mit
Du kennst dich sehr gut mit Java 8 und dem Spring-Framework aus
Du bist hochmotiviert mit den neuesten Technologien zu arbeiten und besitzt ein agiles Mindset
Du weißt, wer Uncle Bob ist und verstehst worüber er redet
Du lebst Test-Driven-Development und siehst es nicht nur als Buzzword an. Ein Plus ist es, wenn du dich auch mit Domain-Driven-Design auskennst
Konzepte wie Software Craftsmanship, Clean Code, Continuous Deployment werden bei Dir großgeschrieben
Du zögerst nicht, uns auch in Frontend-Aufgaben tatkräftig zu unterstützen. Grundwissen zu aktuellen Frontend-Technologien ist ein Plus
Du hast eine fundierte Meinung und vertrittst sie auch - und respektierst es, wenn andere das ebenfalls tun
Da wir englischsprachige Teammitglieder haben, scheust du dich nicht, dich mit uns auch auf Englisch zu unterhalten und zu diskutieren
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Kreativität und Innovation! Um idealos Bekanntheit zu steigern, ist uns keine Idee
zu verrückt
Vertrauensarbeitszeiten. Wir bieten Dir genügend Freiraum bei der Gestaltung von Freizeit und Beruf
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Ein dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld und optimale Arbeitsbedingungen bieten Dir die ideale Grundlage, Deiner Kreativität und Leistung im Beruf freien Lauf zu lassen
Onboarding Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 900 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen Dich so, wie Du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.

idealo stellt während der COVID-19-Pandemie weiter ein.

Wir stellen weiterhin Bewerber*innen aus der ganzen Welt ein! Aufgrund der andauernden COVID-19-Pandemie prüfen wir fortlaufend in Absprache mit den Behörden, ob und wie wir Bewerber*innen aus EU- und Nicht-EU-Ländern einstellen können. Wir bitten jedoch um Dein Verständnis, dass wir aktuell nur individuelle Einstellungsentscheidungen in enger Absprache zwischen Bewerber*in und den Behörden treffen können.

Our vision at Architrave is to revolutionise the processes and workflows within the Real Estate industry, by building and providing a data-driven SaaS platform. The mission is not only to transfer paper into documents, but to really digitalize the industry.

We strive for constant innovation using state of the art technology, to not only extract data but to analyse and learn from it, using Machine Learning and other BigData technologies in order to create real value and a unique experience for our customers.

Be part of this one-of-a-kind organisation and join us in our journey towards the revolution of data and Real Estate.

Just last year, Architrave won the PropTech of the Year Award!

Tasks
Design and implement a cutting-edge, service oriented architecture from scratch which focus on Integrations (APIs) and BigData, facilitating Cloud services (also FaaS) to maximise efficiency and performance
You will take a major role in architectural, design and implementation decision-making
You are a passionate driver and supporter within your future team of engineers; mentoring and helping junior engineers to develop further
You are an advocate and practitioner of modern software development methodologies such as continuous delivery, TDD and Scrum
Requirements
Expert knowledge in one modern object oriented language like Python, Java or Golang, as well as profound knowledge in at least one other language
Feeling comfortable in working with and designing microservice architectures while following principles like API-first and using event based communication
Professional experience with Design Patterns, Design Principles and Software Architecture
Passion for clean and beautiful code, while keeping an eye on simplicity and pragmatism
Experience and strong belief in lean and agile product/software development
A desire to constantly learn and improve your own skills as well as helping and mentoring junior teammates
Not afraid to jump into new things Curiosity and creative outside-the-box problem solving
Experience with Cloud environments (AWS, Google Cloud) is a plus
Fluent in English is a must, German skills are a plus
Benefits
A competitive compensation, flexible working hours and a family friendly work ethic
A great place to grow and to take over responsibility, professionally and personally
Flat hierarchies, short and open communication flows and quick decision-making processes
A working environment that values individuals and embraces knowledge sharing
A highly motivated and talented team that likes to prepare lunch together but also play ping-pong together in a light-flooded office area
Free drinks and a fully equipped kitchen
So, what are you waiting for? We look forward to receiving your application (CV)!

Wed also appreciate if you forward this to anyone you think might be interested. Thanks a bunch!

We're looking for a Software Development Engineer (SDE) who is excited about the opportunity to be part of the tech team building internal web applications on AWS for internal Amazon customers.

The ideal candidate is passionate about software development and has a track record of leading design and implementation of new products and features. Basic Qualifications

· The role is based in Leipzig
· Demonstrated proficiency in at least one modern programming language, such as Java (preferred), Kotlin, or Python
· Proficient in Computer Science and development fundamentals, including object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, and complexity analysis
· Creates reliable/maintainable code and finds creative and scalable solutions to difficult problems

· English language fluency (written & verbal), German language preferred but not a must



Preferred Qualifications

·
· Educational background (e.g. Masters, PHD) in Computer Science
· 5+ years industry experience as a Software Engineer or Developer
· Demonstrated proficiency in multiple modern programming languages, such as Java, Kotlin, or Python
· Experience communicating directly with users, software development teams, or management in order to share plans/vision or collect data (e.g. requirements) to drive product improvement
· Experience and/or a strong interest in AWS and/or cloud computing in general
· Experience building software solutions that leverage AWS services (e.g. S3, DynamoDB, EC2, ECS, SNS/SQS)

position: Systems Engineer / DevOps Engineer (LNPP + AWS + Terraform, m/f/d)
description:
We digitize the logistics industry, a 350+bn market in Europe! As the leading online road freight forwarding company in Germany, we offer business customers a fully digital booking experience for logistics services with one click only and as simple as online shopping.

Our five core values guide us in our interactions with customers, partners, and among each other
We solve the problem first
We are different together
We celebrate success
We deliver on our promises
We empower growth
Tasks


We are looking for you (m/f/d) to further accelerate our strong growth phase in our base in Berlin. Our Tech-Team is responsible for the delivery and maintenance of critical systems and user-facing parts of the platform and thereby plays a central role in the companys success! You will become responsible for a mission-critical part of our platform and transform InstaFreight as a forwarding company to the market leader in the European road-freight traffic. As a Systems / DevOps Engineer you own the entire application infrastructure, served on AWS using Nginx & PHP 7.2 (EC2), Postgres (RDS), Redis (EC), ElasticSearch (ESS) and others.
You prioritize availability and reliability and proactively find + resolve potential incidents
You plan, propose and implement big and small projects from start to finish
You improve and optimize as the requirements change
You drive evolution of systems architecture
You ensure reliability
You test, monitor and add resilience
Collaborate closely with others, splitting tasks or pairing up as necessary, to leverage different skill sets and specialties across the team
Adopt, share and adapt conventions and best-practices - level up individually and as a team over time
Requirements
You are a positive and forward-looking human being - robots are cool and all, but we're a team that likes working together
You are reliable and self-motivated, strive to solve problems effectively with pragmatism
You have several years of experience with Linux-based hosting of web applications
You are familiar with AWS administration (including networking)
Proficiency with Puppet is a must, though we are open to new config management solutions going forward
Prior experience with CI/CD task runners (we use Jenkins)
Proven track record of projects in production
You feel comfortable owning complex systems and being accountable for their operation
Fluent English speaking & writing skills
Willingness to learn & master any technology, language, or development environment that we might need in the future
Experience with common web programming languages and their monitoring
Benefits


Take the driver seat
Take charge - Be accountable for your own field of responsibility from day one onwards.
Have impact - Drive development projects and steer the course of the company.
Make mistakes - Take risks, learn from failures and grow personally with us.
Hit the gas pedal
Learn as you go - Benefit from training, mentoring and feedback while supported by a great learning environment. Additionally our InstaSMART Academy offers exciting monthly insights and learning.
Accelerate - Leave your comfort zone and climb your personal growth ladder step by step.
Outgrow yourself - Unlock your full potential and accomplish things you hardly dare to dream of.
Enjoy the ride
Be part of the team - Join a great group of individuals standing behind a common goal.
Have fun - Take part in our legendary parties, company events or just the regular office craziness.
Write history - Shape the future of an entire industry together with us.
You couldn't find the perfect fit in our open positions? Just talk to our HR Managers and send out your CV!

Ververica is building the next-generation platform for programming data-intensive applications. We are tackling some of the biggest technical challenges in big data and data streaming today. We love open sourcing our code and working together with the open source community that has formed around Apache Flink, one of the biggest projects of the Apache Software Foundation in its category. Ververica was founded in late 2014 by the original creators of the Apache Flink project.

We are looking for passionate software developers that enjoy solving challenging problems and are excited about open source, helping us build world-class data streaming technology.

As a software engineer at Ververica, you will take a dual role: being involved in both the open source Apache Flink project, as well as Ververica' products. You should be comfortable with taking responsibility for designs and features, and be able to work both self-supervised and in cross-functional teams. As a citizen of the Flink open source community, you will be in direct touch with Flink users and participate in the day-to-day open source work. We also encourage engineers to talk publicly about their work at conferences, meetups, and via blog posts.

Requirements
Good knowledge of Java (Scala is a plus)
An aptitude for simple, robust, and elegant designs, including how to design appealing APIs and libraries
Experience in working collaboratively on large code bases is a plus
Benefits

By joining Ververica, you have the opportunity to work with an excellent and tightly-knit engineering team, and have substantial impact on shaping our products and organization. We are an engineering-driven organization, and we invest highly on every individual in our team by giving freedom and decision-making power. Benefits for working at Ververica include:
Competitive salary
Great career opportunities in a world-class team with peers from top-companies, universities and research institutes.
International team environment (10 nationalities so far)
Snacks, coffee and beverages in the office
Relocation assistance if needed
Chinese classes in the office
Please be informed that by applying for the job offer you hereby agree that Ververica would use your personal data in the recruitment process. The legal basis for processing your application data is Article 6 par. 1 lit. b) GDPR. Your rights in respect of data protection can be found in Chapter 3 of GDPR, and you have the right to contact a supervisory authority. Further, you may contact our data protection officer via dataprotection@ververica.com

we are unu

We believe in cities in which all people are able to embrace the full potential of urban life. This is why we are committed to creating the mobility solution, that fully connects people to their city.
unu is an urban mobility brand based in Berlin. Our first product was the unu Scooter Classic, an electric scooter with portable batteries and was launched in 2014. Our products are sold both directly to consumers and business customers, making them accessible to everyone and resulting in fair prices by eluding dealership costs. In 2019, we launched the second generation of our scooter: The unu Scooter was designed inhouse and completely re-developed with our partners in Germany. The new scooter offers space for two people, as well as the largest storage space and one of the fastest acceleration values in the electric scooter segment. With its own app and integrated display, it also offers innovative smart features such as navigation, theft protection and digital key sharing.
After a successful rollout in Germany, Austria, the Netherlands and France, unu is now expanding into further European countries.
With already more than 120 creative challengers striving for simply perfect solutions we are now looking for a strong Senior Embedded Software Engineer - IoT to join the team in unu’s headquarter in Berlin.


THE ROLE

At unu you have the chance to join the bold development of a coming generation of mobility. Dream up ideas, discuss technical possibilities, assess tech alternatives and then quickly make it work. With your contribution, the next unu generation will become more advanced, smarter and personal. We offer you the opportunity to work with an award-winning, expert team in our lab in central Berlin and develop technologies for the next level of mobility.
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
As a Senior Embedded Software Engineer you will join the team building a solution that will bring the urban mobility experience to a whole new level
Optimize and improve the existing IoT applications
Design and develop new functionality for Linux applications (C and C++)
Collaborate with code review for different embedded projects and team members
Collaborate with other members of Hardware and Software engineering teams
Support Quality and Manufacturing team with factory test software
WHAT YOU BRING
First of all, you should be passionate about our values - connection, creative challenger, simple perfection, authenticity, we are david - and our vision to create a mobility solution that fully connects people to their city. That’s what it’s all about! Other than that, we’d really like it if you bring us the following:
6+ years of relevant experience in Embedded Programming
Proven experience with C / C++ and on real time operating systems
Proven experience with IoT backend projects
Proven experience in Linux programming and bash scripting
Experience with databases (SQL and NoSQL)
Some experience with security and cryptography
Knowledge on multitasking programming, Mutexes and Semaphores
Proven experience in git, cmake, gcc, debugging tools and Jira
Solid understanding of fundamental software engineering concepts, programming for reliability and quality assurance
You have a passion for reading technical documents, understanding them and bringing up a solution
Excellent English communication skills
YOUR PERKS
You will get your own company unu Scooter to unlock Berlin’s potential - furthermore we offer:

A highly diverse and vibrant group of people with a strong cultural bond, flat hierarchy, with space for your own ideas in a dynamic, dedicated and motivating environment
Competitive salary and attractive stock options
A creative workspace in Kreuzberg
Healthy snacks, drinks and meals, e.g. daily lunch vouchers
Discounted Urban Sports Club Membership and more activities to come
Are you ready to join our team? Would you like to learn more about unu’s vision, then please send us:
- A short motivational letter, highlighting your relevant portfolio
- Your CV, or a link to your updated profile on Linkedin, Xing, etc.

position: Software Engineer with focus on Scalability
description:
Software Engineer with focus on Scalability

Job Description:

Software Engineer with focus on Scalability (Java/Python/PostgreSQL)


We are an international team of developers, designers, QA, and deployment engineers working on open source web applications to manage Linux servers.
We love to learn, are passionate about our applications, and our prime goal is to create a great experience to our users.
We are looking for talented and passionate engineers who want to work in an open source environment in order to grow our team.

Responsibilities
You will ship code for SUSE Manager (https://www.suse.com/products/suse-manager/) and its upstream project Uyuni (https://www.uyuni-project.org), a web-based Systems Management application used by hundreds of companies across the world.
You will identify bottlenecks and suggest changes to the codebase in order to make sure SUSE Manager can scale to thousands of managed clients.
You will work with consultants creating and documenting best practice configurations that scale up to the customer requirements.
You will design, implement and document High Availability configurations for the product.
You will also work with users to identify problems, turn them into good bug reports, track progress, and provide feedback back to users.

Qualifications & Required Skills
You are passionate about creating excellent software which meets the goals of its users.
You are experienced with Java, its ecosystem, build tools, servlet containers, debugging techniques, performance tuning, etc. (eg. Tomcat, Struts, Hibernate)
Deep experience with databases (Postgresql, Oracle), schema design, and performance tuning.
Proven ability to scale database applications using Java and/or Python frameworks.
You are comfortable with some scripting language. Bonus if it is Python because there is a lot of it in the backend code and client agents.

Wir importieren täglich Milliarden Angebote und bauen so Deutschlands größtes Angebotsinventar auf. Doch was steckt in diesem Inventar? Das Team Inventory Analytics treibt das Thema “Data Lake” bei idealo und analysiert unsere riesigen Datenmengen. Dabei versuchen wir manuelle Geschäftsprozesse, unter anderem mit Hilfe von Machine Learning, zu automatisieren.

Du hast Lust an einem der Top-Themen bei idealo zu arbeiten, stehst für das Team ein und gibst Dich nicht mit dem Ist-Zustand zufrieden? Dann bist Du bei Inventory Analytics goldrichtig!

Stellenanforderungen
Deine Aufgaben
Du verantwortest zusammen im Team die Weiterentwicklung und den Betrieb der idealo Inventory Analytics Platform in AWS.
Du automatisierst das Anlegen von Produkten mit Hilfe von Machine Learning.
Gemeinsam mit dem Team übernimmst du die Verantwortung für euer Produkt und realisierst innovative Lösungen für unsere Kunden.
Du bist nicht nur Teil eines Teams sondern einer Product Area, im Team strebst du danach die Product Area stetig zu verbessern.
Das bringst Du mit
An Deine Arbeit gehst du proaktiv heran, bist immer bereit, neue Technologien zu erlernen, und hast nicht zuletzt ein Händchen für intelligente und einfache Lösungen.
Du hast Erfahrung und Interesse an Spring Boot, Kubernetes, AWS, ML, BigData.
Du hast Erfahrung in mindestens zwei der folgenden Programmiersprachen; Java, Scala, Python, Kotlin.
Du verfügst über ausgezeichnete Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, Wissen zu teilen und mit anderen zusammenzuarbeiten ist für Dich selbstverständlich.
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Kein Stillstand! Von Tech Talks bis hin zu individuellen Trainings - bei uns gibt es unzählige Möglichkeiten für konstruktiven Austausch und Input.
Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen.
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung.
Im Austausch mit über 10 Fachabteilungen aus Product and Technology, arbeitest Du an abwechslungsreichen Themen und ambitionierten Zielen.
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen.
Du arbeitest in unserem neuen Zuhause im Herzen Berlins und kannst Dich auf lichtdurchflutete, moderne Räume und eine begrünte Dachterasse mit genialem Ausblick freuen.

Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 900 Mitarbeiter*innen aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen Dich so, wie Du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.

idealo stellt während der COVID-19-Pandemie weiter ein.

Wir stellen weiterhin Bewerber*innen aus der ganzen Welt ein! Aufgrund der andauernden COVID-19-Pandemie prüfen wir fortlaufend in Absprache mit den Behörden, ob und wie wir Bewerber*innen aus EU- und Nicht-EU-Ländern einstellen können. Wir bitten jedoch um Dein Verständnis, dass wir aktuell nur individuelle Einstellungsentscheidungen in enger Absprache zwischen Bewerber*in und den Behörden treffen können.

C++ Developer - Berlin

80,000 – 120,000 EUR

Our Berlin based client is looking to appoint a C++ Developer to join its successful team.

Do you believe in beauty when it comes to programming? Do you have a vivid interest in elegant algorithms? Are you fluent in C++? If so, we would like to meet you. Here is what we offer in a nutshell:

· A wide array of extremely challenging C++ development tasks

· An international team of brilliant minds

· A working environment that makes this team stay and grow

· Enough time to make sure that every detail of your solution is perfect

· A flat organisation and plenty of room for your ideas

· No scheduled meetings

· Family-friendly working hours, no deadlines, no overtime

· Support for relocation

About the client

Our client is a fast-paced software company in Berlin, Germany, with a focus on developing graphics products that stand out from the crowd. More than 750,000 users world-wide rely on our software for their daily business as it makes creating graphical presentations so much easier, faster and more enjoyable. Among our customers are many renowned consulting companies and large international corporations.

We do not have to make compromises regarding code quality and beauty, because we are profitable and have no outside investors. We are willing to go the extra mile of developing sophisticated algorithms and refining our user interface, and we are proud of our many happy customers. The fact that the company is owned and managed by seasoned computer scientists certainly contributes to a working environment that makes exceptional developers come and stay.

About the software

Our focus is on business slides (as opposed to more artful applications) because they offer great potential for automation of layout tasks that are traditionally performed by PowerPoint users themselves. Challenges are plenty: from a solid understanding of what makes a good layout and which guidelines are followed by humans who do manual layout, to algorithms that produce an acceptable output fast enough for interactive slide design, to a graphical user interface that supports our new, original approach to slide layout in a way that is easy to understand yet unobtrusive, to solid technical solutions for automatic bug reporting and automatic updates, to compatibility with third-party software on the computers of half a million users.

Here are some highlights of what we have done.

Language

Everything we do is C++. Even our customer portal is written in C++. There is some Assembler glue code where it is necessary, and our build scripts are written in Python, but other than it is all about C++. Naturally, we use C++ features like lambdas and rvalue references throughout our code base and have switched to C++17 where our compilers support it.

position: Senior Software Engineer - Booking Team - f/m/x
description:
We are looking for you!

Are you enthusiastic about the future of sustainable mobility? You’d like to contribute to the transformation of public transport, making it digital and more attractive? Do you enjoy working towards company goals in a team that is motivated, diverse, and multinational?
As the market leader in on-demand technology and mobility services, door2door provides public transport companies with the tools needed for them to implement an autonomous and fully integrated MaaS system. Our technology is already being used in major German cities, regional centers, and rural areas. Our products and services enjoy top ratings.
We firmly believe mobility should focus on people, not vehicles, and we take a strong partnership approach with public transport companies. Succeeding together - this is how we live every day.
We are a member of the World Economic Forum and number 8 on LinkedIn’s list of top startup employers.

About your future Team:

Our teams are building APIs and Mobility Intelligence tools to support public transport operators to design efficient on-demand ridepooling operations and integrate them directly into their city's ecosystem via mobile applications and other systems. Powering these tools is our powerful dispatch algorithm, an efficient solver of the classic traveling salesman problem which enables passengers to be pooled in journeys through their city and a data-analysis based approach combined with lots of modern visualization techniques on the client-side.

Your team will be expecting you to contribute with high quality deliverables and actively support door2door’s growth.

Requirements
Interact with developers, designers and product managers
Design, develop and deploy innovative solutions to solve technical problems
Make sure our applications solve the business problems and set high-quality standards
Share your experiences with the team and provide technical guidance when needed
Well experienced and open-minded character with a can-do attitude and curiosity to explore more
Result driven, team oriented, strong communicator
Qualifications
At least 5 years of experience building, architecting and monitoring web-based production systems as a Full Stack Software Developer with a backend focus, preferably working with Ruby, Java, Python, JavaScript and/or AWS
Experience working with agile approaches in a collaborative and multi-cultural team
Passion for learning new technologies and keeping up with market best practices
Ability to work in cross collaboration teams and interact with different stakeholders
Nice to have
In the frontend area, you worked on projects involving data visualization
Benefits

Join a supportive team that pushes you to be your best, making a real difference in the world of Urban Mobility. Driven by our values of Vision, Impact and Collaboration, our unique culture is something you cannot copy/paste!
Become part of our multinational team, join the ride and you will gain:
Learning: Your growth matters! We support your development through our varied learning program offerings
Flexibility & Support: We care about work-life balance with flexible hours, home office, parental support as well as support during life's ups and downs
Work Environment: Multinational, open minded and welcoming atmosphere, plenty of healthy snacks, drinks and coffee to keep you fuelled throughout the day
Location: Warm and unspoiled areas in an old factory building in the heart of Berlin. Our HQ’s roof terrace is the perfect place to end the week with a drink with us, your colleagues
Health and Wellness: Stay fit with our Urban Sports Club Membership
Challenge: Become part of something amazing. With real impact. Now!
Check out more of our Perks & Benefits here
