3+ years professional work experience and experience as a Software Architect ideally in multicultural, virtual teams
ABOUT THE TEAM

We are responsible for the technical design and implementation of all features and functionalities when it comes to any E-commerce Platform. Currently our portfolio includes SAP Store, Partner Store and SAP App Center from a technical perspective. We find fun in our work and offer onboarding and mentoring for your success in this role. SAP App Center, SAP Partner Store, SAP Store …did you know that each purchase will make a lasting impact as we celebrate each transaction by planting a tree?

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.

A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. You will be responsible for the software architecture, design and development of the software systems that make-up the Careem engine. ABOUT THE TECH TEAM

We are an international team in central Berlin with around 40 people in Engineering and we continuously develop our products using agile development practices. We have open company culture with over 20 different nationalities operating in a booming market working on interesting projects using modern tech-stack, efficient and lean workflows. We have high visibility through the whole GFG group and great opportunity to affect GFG group wide decisions. We are looking for a great team player to join our enthusiastic team in Berlin!

We are looking for a System Engineer on a 12 months fixed-term contract to improve and contribute to our AWS stack including Kubernetes, Docker, Micro Services, Web Services, Machine Learning and Queueing Services. Design and implement infrastructure components from proof-of-concept to production
Identify opportunities to improve the overall platform and monitoring
Troubleshoot issues in production environment
Use DevOps methodology and SRE best practices and participate in project planning
Be part of creating DevOps culture
Share your knowledge with others

You will have experience in system administration and design
Good Linux background (i.e. what is load average?)
Full professional English proficiency
Ability to make independent decisions and taking ownership smaller and larger topics
Passion in developing infrastructure-as-code, automated testing, and other SRE best practices
Good understanding of K8s eco-system and K8s internal things (pros, cons)
Ability to write some code (Shell script/Python/Golang)
Technologies we use include:
K8s (EKS), Terraform, AWS sdk (boto3, golang), Codebuild, Gitlab Actions, CircleCi, AWS in general (s3, ec2, rds...)
Some legacy stuff: Mesos, Jenkins, Gitlab, Ansible, saltstack

The ability to make an impact - your ideas and efforts matter!
A dynamic working environment solving complex problems, shaping the face of fashion e-commerce

Do you want to help build a world-class institution from the region, experience the thrill of being part of a high-growth technology company, and improve people's lives?

At Careem, we are driven by the purpose of simplifying the lives of people and building an awesome organisation that inspires. Based in Dubai, we started our journey as a pioneer of the Middle East's ride-hailing economy. Today, Careem is the region's everyday Super App operational in 13 countries and over 100 cities. The Super App provides a host of daily services that people need to move around, to order things and to transfer money in one unified smartphone app. Our goal is to simplify people's daily lives so that they can spend their precious time and mindshare on things that really matter and on realizing their potential.

These large scale, distributed systems handle everything from user requests to payment processing. This means an opportunity to work on virtually any type of computer science and software engineering problem, particularly in the areas of large scale distributed systems, user interfaces and big data. The ideal candidate will have a passionate commitment to improving the lives of people, an insane focus on excellence and customer service, and a strong alignment with our core values: being bold, focused, agile and collaborative.

Proficiency in Java and/or GoLang and server-side technologies.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

Summary & Role Information
The Spotlight team is looking for an experienced and dependable individual, who is passionate about developing a scalable SaaS solution in the SAP Cloud Platform. In this role, you’ll iterate quickly with a small but high energy team to gather data from different source systems. You’ll ensure that we use the most suitable technologies and the right features to allow easy and efficient exploration and analysis of this data.

You should be hungry, ambitious and get energized tying with new people and helping solve their problems with technology. This is your opportunity to contribute to the growth of a new start-up, in a venture capital style incubator, with the backing of one of the most impactful brands in enterprise technology.

About the Spotlight by SAP team

As Germany’s most valuable company and with more than €25 billion in annual sales, SAP manages an enormous diversity of businesses. However, moving the needle inside of SAP’s dominant enterprise business requires adding more than incremental innovation – it requires the development of massively disruptive organizations and products. The SAP.iO Venture Studio is the internal incubator charged with creating these transformative growth businesses for SAP.

Spotlight is one of SAP.iO’s latest ventures. Its focus is to help enterprises improve their business operations and processes in a data-driven way. Based on SAP’s exclusive data assets, domain knowledge and the latest technologies, we show our customers where their problems are, what to focus on and how to improve their operations and process landscape. We strive to build an insanely great business by building an insanely great team.

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.

Comtravo - Making Business Travel Radically Simple

We are a team of travel experts, tech enthusiasts and customer support heroes – with the shared purpose to simplify business travel. Computer networking fundamentals

Familiarity with git

We are looking for a talented Senior Software Engineer (C++/Qt/QML) to join our growing team.

You will join an international team working on the development of Pix4Dsurvey which is a desktop application for professionals, with the mission to bridge the gap between photogrammetry and computer aided design and drafting (CAD) tools. Your main task will be to use your software engineering expertise to design and develop software components and functionalities, and to contribute to good software engineering practices in the team.

You’ve learned from direct experience that the most important characteristic of software is maintainability. As such, you strive to keep your code simple, readable and testable. You are passionate about your craft, you enjoy sharing good practices and learning from others.

Improve and maintain existing C++ components
Participate in the design, implementation and maintenance of core software components
Write clean, safe, testable and reusable code
Engage daily in code reviews and promote good software engineering practices

Contribute to documentation of core components
Actively participate in the team and company’s agile process

MINIMUM QUALIFICATION
Expert in modern C++ programming, focused on code quality, simplicity and ease of maintenance

Strong analytical, assessment and problem-solving skills and a good sense for user experience and usability
Experience with Qt/QML
Excellent communication skills
Good written and verbal English communication skills

Working environment

Pix4D is a unique, fun, and intellectually stimulating company where you can grow and excel in your field. Our environment is authentic and multicultural, a place where we respect and learn from each other in the pursuit of being the best at what we do. Get more information here.

Company

Pix4D is a developer of cutting edge software that converts images taken by hand, drone, or plane into survey-grade accurate and georeferenced 2D mosaics, 3D models and point clouds. Founded in 2011, Pix4D is rapidly expanding from its headquarters in Lausanne, Switzerland, to offices in Denver, San Francisco, Berlin, Shanghai, Tokyo and Madrid.

Pix4D technology enables lightweight civilian drones to become mapping and surveying tools for 3D reconstruction of any changing environment. It forms the base of many cloud-processing solutions and is used by thousands of professionals worldwide on desktop (Windows, OS X, Linux) mobile (iOS and Android) and cloud environments.

position: C++ Software Engineer - 3D Point Cloud & Streaming)
description:
Teraki is a Berlin based tech driven company enabling true mobility. We stand for innovation in the rapidly developing connected car, self-driving and 3D mapping world. Teraki provides the data reduction and data processing solution for Automotive (IoT) applications and enables the launch of new applications by reducing costs. We help our customers on the challenges that are posed by the exploding amounts of data in connected cars for all sensor, video and 3D mapping data.

In this role, you will work on the productization of cutting-edge video streaming software and algorithms, always in compliance with automotive standards and while making sure that we deliver highest quality products. You will be closely working with Research Scientists and Software Engineers.

Your Responsibilities
Design and develop highly performant video processing software for hardware constrained embedded devices but also GPU based systems.
Port, implement and optimize video processing, computer vision and machine learning algorithms developed by our Research Scientists and Codec Developers.
Write high quality, well tested and documented code, ready to run on special purpose computing architectures used in connected car applications.
Propose and develop creative and efficient solutions to challenges in video streaming applications and contribute to expanding our intellectual property portfolio.
Carry out performance benchmarking and analysis to support engineering decisions.
Provide engineering support to research efforts, working closely with Research Scientists (developing novel algorithms) and backend developers.
Who we are looking for
You have a Computer Science or Software Engineering background and at least 3 years of professional experience in a similar position.
You have strong programming skills in C++ (C++14) and good working knowledge in Python.
You have a good working knowledge of CMake and the associated set of tools (CPack, CTest, KWStyle, etc)
You have a passion for and a strong experience in low level programming, know when to use heap and when stack memory and are familiar with performance optimization techniques for efficient video-data processing.
You are familiar with software profiling and are proficient in relevant tools, such as valgrind, perf etc.
You are familiar with 3D point cloud processing / compression.
You have experience with video streaming technology such as RTMP, Multiplexing and GStreamer.
Ideally you have some experience with GPU programming in CUDA/OpenCL or have implemented algorithms on Digital Signal Processors (DSPs).
It is a plus if you have some knowledge about MISRA or ISO compliant C++ development.
It is a plus if you have some knowledge about neural network architectures and their implementation.
“Can do” and above all “want to do” attitude.
Motivated fast learner and problem solver who can work in a team as well as independently.
You are familiar with AGILE tools and working practices (JIRA, etc)
What we offer
A unique opportunity to actively contribute to future mobility challenges.
To increase your know-how in state-of-the-art technologies: Data Analytics, Machine Learning and Embedded Development.
To work closely with world class European and American companies
To work in a dynamic start-up environment in the heart of Berlin, and to share insights with an international team spread across Europe and the US
To work in a small, but highly motivated, multidisciplinary, multicultural team with flat hierarchies.
Free public transport around within Berlin and free German classes
To work in a vibrant start-up environment in the heart of Berlin with the chance to play a big role in the success of Teraki. We do work that matters!

At HelloFresh, our mission is to change the way people eat - forever. From our 2011 founding in Europe's vibrant tech hub Berlin, we've become the global market leader in the meal kit sector and inspire millions of energised home cooks across the globe every week.

We offer our meal kit boxes full of exciting recipes and thoughtfully sourced, fresh ingredients in more than 10 countries, operating from offices in Berlin, New York City, Sydney, Toronto, London and Amsterdam. Our more than 4,000 employees are the heart and soul of our highly international, fast-paced, and dynamic environment where innovation and smart, fast action is encouraged.

Completed studies in systems engineering, automation, logistics, information technology or another suitable field of study
At least 2 years professional experience in IT project management as a Product Owner, Product Manager or other relevant role

Domain experience with automation of warehouse systems and logistics is desirable

A vibrant, international environment
A guaranteed steep learning curve & boost for your career

Benefit from our selection of employee perks (significant reduction on your HelloFresh boxes, discount on the HelloFresh GO vending machines, free German classes, Geek Friday, discounts for our neighboring Fitness Studio & Urban Sports Club, annual budget for training and development initiatives, weekly Yoga Classes, Summer & Winter Party)

As a leading mobile games developer, Jam City is looking to “level up” our talent. We’re on the hunt for innovators who consider themselves dynamic, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.

ABOUT JAM CITY
Jam City is an award-winning mobile entertainment studio providing unique and deeply engaging games that appeal to a broad, global audience.

Led by CEO Chris DeWolfe, former MySpace co-founder and CEO, and COO Josh Yguado, former 20th Century Fox executive, Jam City is the creative powerhouse behind some of the highest-grossing and most enduring mobile games. The company also is the go-to studio for Hollywood, having developed immersive, narrative-rich mobile games around iconic entertainment brands. The company’s popular RPG game Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery was the #1 game in more than 40 countries at its launch in April 2018.

position: Senior SDET[Software Development Engineering and Test]
description:
Shape the future of OLX Autos to become the most trusted partner for car buyers & sellers, and offer them peace of mind on every transaction they make with us! OLX Group is a global product and tech company with 19 brands, +5000 people, 45 countries and one mindset - customer first. Every month 350 million people use our trading platforms. We estimate that 17 million things are exchanged on our apps and platforms every single month.

And this is not enough! OLX Group is part of Prosus, a global internet group and one of the largest technology investors in the world! With this we combine the spirit and agility of a startup with the maturity that comes from being part of a 100-year-old company.

Frontier Car Group has recently joined OLX to form the new global market leader for car sales. We are now OLX Autos by combining the best of both groups' businesses.

What you will be doing :
As a SDET for Olx Autos Dealer Experience Team, you'll get the chance to work with an internationally diverse group of smart people and have the liberty to implement and improvise automation suits with your ideas and processes in your very own team with us.
You'll work in a company that brings together classifieds and offline car-sales, helping to disrupt the way cars are being sold on a global scale. The role is really exciting as it is both functional and automation.

You'll be contributing to feature acceptance scenarios right from planning to go-live. Develop functional understanding and drive the automation lifecycle (develop-review-maintain) for native and web apps.

position: (Senior) Full-Stack Software Engineer who loves Python
description:
Welcome to Advertima.

Our world will soon be powered by Smart Spaces, such as smart cities, smart buildings and smart retail stores. Using a wide range of applications and driven by the most advanced technologies, these physical environments will make our lives more convenient and enjoyable. For such smart ecosystems, it is vitally important to interpret humans and their behavior in a variety of visual dimensions physical appearance, body motion and visual context. The Advertima Vision Technology achieves this challenging goal by providing a real-time data stream for visual human interpretation to power the Smart Spaces of the future.

Our disruptive Computer Vision platform is revolutionizing entire industries and transforming the world in which we live. For instance, the Advertima Smart Signage solution enables retailers to provide an exceptional customer experience with individualized content for the right audience at the right time. Further, the Advertima Autonomous Store offers a consumer-centric retail experience that is not only frictionless but also engaging and enjoyable. These game-changing solutions will be used not only by the grocery sector but also by cinemas, DIY stores and a whole host of retailers.

Ultimately, the Advertima Vision Technology will be the foundation for a multitude of AI-driven applications in the Smart Spaces of the future.

Are you ready to help shape our success story and to change the operating principle of an entire industry? Join our team as (Senior) Full-stack Software Engineer with a passion for Python:

Your role...
Develop new features for our retail-tech products for customer analytics, customer engagement, and autonomous checkout
Improve existing features to maximize performance and reliability
Write clean, testable, efficient, and self-documented code
Actively participate in the analysis and discussion of business requirements with other team members
Discuss technical details of concrete business problems with the team to find the best solution
Be an active member of an interdisciplinary team of developers and researchers
Your profile
BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Software Engineering, a similar field or multiple years of experience working as a software engineer
At least 5+ years of experience with Python
Experience in developing RESTful web services
Experience with Django or Flask
Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases
Experience with Microservices and Docker
Experience with continuous integration, agile software development, and testing
A good communicator who is fluent in English, both spoken and written
Ideally, youll also have
Experience with at least one Javascript framework like Angular, React, Vue, or NodeJS etc.
Experience with the Django REST framework
Experience with HTML, CSS, and Javascript
Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)
What we offer...
International and young team of start-up professionals
Fast-paced, dynamic and innovative working environment
Opportunity to strongly impact the future of a fast-growing company
Organizational model that distributes power across peers
Flexible vacation policy and working hours
Self-development budget
Monthly team brunch
Find out more about what we do and what it's like to work at Advertima through our Linkedin Life page: https://lnkd.in/e6R6UZ8

Ready for the mission?

And we want to find the best fit for our people to make sure that they are happy, challenged and supported in their work.

As one of our first hires, you will have a fantastic opportunity to shape the technical strategy and be a member of the core team.

Hundreds of millions of customers. Billions of queries per year and dollars in revenue. The scale and impact of Amazon Search is huge and we need you to imagine and develop innovative cross-device features to realize the future of product search worldwide.

The Search Navigation team is responsible for worldwide customer facing search features. Our algorithms select and rank navigation options to help customers explore, refine, and traverse search results across all device experiences worldwide. We exploit and enrich behavioral and semantic information to power an intelligent and flawless shopping experience.

On a day-to-day basis, you'll be part of a small, close-knit team of engineers that are agile, data driven, and highly collaborative. You'll help analyze customer behavior, propose ideas and solutions during sprint planning with your team, implement big ideas, and then measure the results. Engineers on our team have proposed ideas that have impacted millions of customers and generated millions of dollars in revenue.




Basic Qualifications

· Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field

· Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis
· Proficiency in at least one modern programming language such as Java, C++

· Experience in low-latency services, optimized for performance, or large-scale data processing systems, or distributed systems
· Experience with Scrum or Agile development
· Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
· Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs

As a leading mobile games developer, Jam City is looking to “level up” our talent. We’re on the hunt for innovators who consider themselves dynamic, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.

We are looking for passionate game developers with Unity experience. We offer you a fun and challenging work environment. We are nimble, fast and result driven. Join and make an impact!
QUALIFICATIONS
Solid programming foundation.
Excellent C# and Unity skills.
Must have worked on games.
Experienced with software development tool chains.
Applicants must currently live in Europe.
NICE TO HAVE
AWS knowledge and Javascript programming are a big plus.
ABOUT JAM CITY
Jam City is an award-winning mobile entertainment studio providing unique and deeply engaging games that appeal to a broad, global audience.

Led by CEO Chris DeWolfe, former MySpace co-founder and CEO, and COO Josh Yguado, former 20th Century Fox executive, Jam City is the creative powerhouse behind some of the highest-grossing and most enduring mobile games. Jam City’s global franchise Cookie Jam has generated more than half a billion dollars, and Panda Pop has more than 120 million downloads to date.

The company also is the go-to studio for Hollywood, having developed immersive, narrative-rich mobile games around iconic entertainment brands. The company’s popular RPG game Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery was the #1 game in more than 40 countries at its launch in April 2018.

Jam City has nine studios located in Los Angeles (HQ), Berlin, Buenos Aires, Bogotá, Burbank, Cedar Falls, San Diego, San Francisco, and Toronto.

byrd offers e-commerce businesses access to a virtual warehouse that connects their online shop seamlessly with multiple warehouses across borders. The fully integrated web application enables merchants to outsource their whole logistics - from storage to shipping - with only a few clicks.
Moreover, they can manage and track their orders - regardless of the number of warehouses they ship from - in one single tool and access reports to optimize their logistics. At byrd, technology meets the logistics expertise of dozens of logistics providers on a global scale. As a consequence, retailers can offer shipping that meets and exceeds their customers expectations.

Tasks


Collaborate within a small but highly-skilled team to fundamentally change the way people think about logistics software.

Design simple solutions to complex problems, with a high degree of freedom, from start to finish.

Develop robust, tested, and scalable code across the stack, which you and your colleagues enjoy working on.

Improve microservices, APIs and our customer dashboards

Lead champion best-practices and encourage knowledge sharing.

Requirements


We require
3+ years of industry experience in web development, including at least 1 year using Python. You are a true champion, fearless and ready to conquer anything which stands in your way.
You can own tasks: working independently to solve problems from planning and modelling, through to developing APIs and user interfaces.
Good knowledge of frontend frameworks such as Angular, React, or Vue.
A test believer. Tests are an everyday occurrence for you, not an afterthought or chore.
Past experience of working in agile teams, using continuous integration and deployment practices.
Humility. We appreciate constructive criticism and are not afraid to employ it.
Strong communication skills. (English required, German an asset)

Some perks we offer

Naturally, you can expect the Standard Berlin Start-Up Perk Package. Flexible working hours, a calm and productive environment, and the possibility to take home office if needed. We will of course provide fresh fruit and snacks and coffee.

Besides these standard goodies we support your personal and professional growth with a free Urban Sports Club membership and various team activities. We want our employees to be healthy, happy, and well rested.

But lets be honest, the most precious perk is that your contribution, effort and opinion will be valued and appreciated. You will work directly with the founders and a team of skilled and professional colleagues and managers. As we are a results driven company we encourage smart, rather than hard work.

We are an equal opportunities employer and value diversity. Therefore, we do not discriminate based on religion, skin colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability.

Änderungen an Geschäftsprozessen eines Unternehmens erfordern in der Regel auch Anpassungen an der IT. Als Bindeglied zwischen Management und Entwicklern halten unsere Software Architekten nicht nur die Architekturvorgaben ein, sondern begleiten das Projekt vom Anforderungsmanagement über die Architekturberatung bis hin zur Konzeption sowie dem Betrieb der Infrastruktur. Hierbei entscheiden sie über den Einsatz der notwendigen Technologien und Tools und entwickeln bereits bestehende Software-Komponenten weiter. Konstruieren Sie mit uns die IT-Infrastruktur unserer internationalen Kunden.

Das erwartet Sie bei Materna


Ob bei der NINA-App des Bundesamtes für Bevölkerungsschutz und Katastrophenhilfe oder dem Einsatz von Chatbots in Justizministerien - die Konzeption von Microservices- sowie Cloud-Architekturen bildet den Grundstein all unserer Projekte. In unserem 5-monatigen Materna Architecture Program vermitteln wir erfahrenen Software Entwicklern und IT-Projektleitern die notwendigen Kernkompetenzen und Qualifizierungen der Software Architektur, um Sie optimal in unsere zukünftigen Projekte für Kunden der Industrie sowie der öffentlichen Hand einzubinden.

Von Beginn an erhalten Sie einen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag und sind fester Bestandteil unseres Teams. Erfahrene Mentoren und Referenten begleiten Sie auf Ihrem Weg zum ISAQB-zertifizierten Software Architekten. Hierbei erlangen Sie Kenntnisse im Projektmanagement sowie API-Design und wenden SpringBoot, Docker und Microframeworks praktisch an. Abgerundet wird Ihre Fortbildung durch qualifizierte Soft-Skill-Schulungen. Nach zwei Monaten vertiefen Sie Ihre erlangten Kompetenzen als Software Architekt in unseren Projekten. Einen detailierten Lernpfad finden Sie hier.

Das bringen Sie mit:
Abgeschlossenes Studium mit Schwerpunkt Informatik o. ä. oder vergleichbare berufliche Ausbildung
Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Software-Entwicklung mit einer objektorientierten Programmiersprache
Gute Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit, Kreativität sowie eine konzeptionelle Denkfähigkeit
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse sowie Reisebereitschaft
Sie sind neugierig geworden? Dann lesen Sie hier, was uns als Arbeitgeber ausmacht und hier, warum unsere Kollegen Materna schätzen.
Jetzt bewerben

Job merken

Wenn es darum geht, zukünftig Millionen Fahrgäste und tausende Züge auch digital auf den Weg zu bringen, braucht es die besten IT-Experten. 8.000 haben wir schon, aber längst nicht genug. Als Projektleiter, Berater, Entwickler oder IT-Architekt ist jetzt die spannendste Zeit einzusteigen und in einem starken Team wegweisende Lösungen und Großprojekte in den Bereichen Mobilität, Infrastruktur und Logistik umzusetzen.

Mit Deiner Arbeit stiftest Du einen echten Kundennutzen: Unser Team entwickelt das Produkt BahnID, den zentralen Single Sign-on für alle digitalen Dienste und Angebote der Deutschen Bahn.

Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir Dich als Site Reliability Engineer / DevOps Engineer (w/m/d) für die DB Systel GmbH. Du kannst entweder an einem unserer Hauptstandorte Berlin, Erfurt oder Frankfurt (Main) arbeiten oder standortflexibel an einem Ort Deiner Wahl. Wir freuen uns auf Dich!

Deine Aufgaben:
In unserem T-Shaped-Team im DevOps-Modus verbesserst Du durch Automatisierung und Analysen bestehende Prozesse
Dein Knowhow bringst Du ein, um intelligente und nachhaltige Ansätze zur Optimierung der Cloud zu implementieren
Technische Anpassungen und die Integration in die IT-Systeme führst Du durch
Du entwickelst Mobile- und Web-Applikationen, Daten- und Servermodelle und Software- bzw. Serverarchitekturen
In Sachen Testautomatisierung agierst Du als zentraler Treiber
Du bringst Struktur in funktionale Fragestellungen und stellst den Transfer zu bestehenden, funktionalen Architekturmodellen sicher
Komplexe fachliche Anforderungen bereitest Du auf und überprüfst diese auf technische Machbarkeit

Dein Profil:
Du hast ein abgeschlossenes IT-Studium oder eine gleichwertige Qualifikation.
Mit Cloudtechnologien kennst Du Dich aus und Du hast Erfahrung in der Erstellung von Infrastrukturen, im Betrieb von CI/CD-Plattformen und in der Implementierung der entsprechenden Pipelines
Infrastructure as Code und Tools wie Cloudformation und Terraform sind keine Fremdwörter für Dich
Du hast Lust, Dich und Deine Fähigkeiten in einem DevOps-Team einzubringen und in einem agilen Umfeld zu agieren, das jedem Einzelnen ermöglicht, seine Ideen einzubringen und aktiv mitzugestalten
Mut und Offenheit für Neues, Spaß an der Erfahrungsweitergabe und ein Interesse an innovativen Technologien runden Dein Profil ab

Benefits:
Du schaffst Großes und bekommst nicht weniger zurück: ein marktübliches Gehaltspaket mit i.d.R. unbefristeten Arbeitsverträgen und Beschäftigungssicherung sowie vielfältige Nebenleistungen und eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge.
Gezielte und individuelle Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten auf Fach-, Projekt- oder Führungsebene geben Dir eine langfristige Perspektive.
Wir unterstützen Dich bei der Suche nach Kitaplätzen oder Ferienbetreuung für Deine Kinder. Außerdem kannst Du Auszeiten für die Pflege von Angehörigen oder Sabbaticals nehmen. Je nach Job ist eine flexible Gestaltung von Arbeitszeit/-ort möglich.

Chancengleichheit und selbstbestimmte Teilhabe Schwerbehinderter und Gleichgestellter sowie eine respektvolle Zusammenarbeit sind innerhalb des DB Konzerns fest verankerte Grundsätze. Deshalb werden schwerbehinderte Bewerber bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt berücksichtigt.

We are searching for a Software Development Manager with passion for large-scale system building and data-intensive applications. If you are motivated by working in fast-paced environment, have full ownership of your work, and build a team of world class engineers this role is for you!

Our cloud data warehouse Amazon Redshift manages all the work needed to set up, operate, and scale a data warehouse, from provisioning capacity and installing software to monitoring and backing up the cluster, to applying patches and upgrades. With Redshift Spectrum, our customers can easily query data from Amazon S3, thereby scaling their warehouse out to Exabytes and allowing them to integrate data in all kinds of file formats from their data lake into their analytics.

As a Software Development Manager at Amazon Redshift, you will:
· Take overall responsibility for growing and leading a database software development team responsible for rethinking the assumptions behind how traditional database services were built and thinking how to build database services best suited for the cloud.
· Lead the design, implementation, testing and deployment of these database services and prioritize the backlog.
· Mentor senior engineers and managers, complete hands-on technical work and provide leadership on complex technical issues, design tradeoffs, and feature and schedule prioritization.
· Shape a culture of innovation and serve your team of engineers so that they can leverage their full potential and grow.
· Work with senior executives to develop business targets and resource requirements, influence our technical and business strategy.
You will be successful in this role, if you bring deep technical and software expertise, and have strong business acumen and judgment. You have the ability to define visionary, ground breaking products and the ability to hire and lead a team. Finally, you should have the desire to have an industry wide impact and ability to work within a fast moving, startup environment in a large company to rapidly deliver services that have a broad business impact.

Joining the Amazon Redshift Spectrum team gives you the opportunity to:
· Work on the latest technology, as we constantly build the latest research concepts into Redshift Spectrum.
· Be part of something big, as you are working on a key pillar of AWSs extensive service portfolio and thousands of Amazon Redshift customers benefit from your contributions.
· Learn from the best, as you are working on challenging engineering tasks in a team of very experienced experts and managers that are close to support you.
· Be part of a great team, as we invest a lot to create an inclusive environment that allows you to perform at your best, while maintaining a fun atmosphere.
This position of the Software Development Manager for Amazon Spectrum represents an unusual opportunity to shape the technology and future of a rapidly evolving industry and business.


Basic Qualifications

· 10+ years in software development, 4+ years in engineering people management positions.
· Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or Engineering.
· Proven ability to drive tasks to completion and take ownership of projects.
· Ability to work in a fast paced and agile development environment
· Good communication skills, analytical abilities, and design skills.

Preferred Qualifications

· Masters or PhD in Computer Science or Engineering.
· A leadership position in a team delivering database kernel, virtualized storage, distributed systems or operating systems.
· Work experience delivering one or more version one products, ideally in a startup setting.
· Experience delivering and operating large-scale, highly available distributed systems.
· Experience with database internals especially query optimization, and query execution

Wir legen großen Wert auf ein kollegiales und von Gemeinschaftsgefühl geprägtes Umfeld. Die familiäre Arbeitsatmosphäre zeichnet sich durch ein besonderes ,,Wir-Gefühl" aus - hierfür gibt es sogar ein Wort: ,,adessi"! Und dafür tun wir auch einiges. Kontinuierlicher Austausch, Teamgeist und ein respektvoller sowie anerkennender Umgang sorgen für ein Arbeitsklima, das verbindet. So belegen wir zum wiederholten Male den 1. Platz beim Wettbewerb ,,Deutschlands Beste Arbeitgeber in der ITK"! Wir eröffnen Entwicklungs- und Führungsmöglichkeiten - unser Versprechen, ein Chancengeber zu sein, nehmen wir ernst. Unser umfangreiches Schulungs- und Weiterbildungsangebot sorgt dafür, dass deine Entwicklung bei uns nicht still steht. Welcome Days - 2 Tage zum Reinkommen und Netzwerken Weiterbildung - über 120 Schulungen und Weiterbildungen Choose your own device - freie Wahl deiner Arbeitswerkzeuge Events - fachlich und mit Spaßfaktor Hemden- und Blusenreinigung - zweimal die Woche frisch aufgebügelt Sportförderung - Zuschuss zum Fitnessstudio und Übernahme der Platzmiete für die Sporthalle Mitarbeiterprämien - eine Vielzahl an Prämien für zusätzliches Engagement Auszeitprogramm - Raum für deine persönliche Lebensplanung KontaktDu bist offen für neue und anspruchsvolle Aufgaben? Dann sende uns deine Bewerbungsunterlagen (inkl. deines CV, deiner Arbeits- und Studienzeugnisse sowie deiner Gehaltsvorstellungen und dem frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermin) vorzugsweise über unser Webformular.

position: Senior Specialist Application Developer Task Force (m/f/d)
description:
In the Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA) region, we ensure that a consistent local approach is adopted in the various countries. To achieve this, we communicate with the relevant corporate divisions and contribute our regional expertise. We work with mature markets just as much as developing markets and either support the established companies there or promote our business in emerging markets.

RESPONSIBILITIES

As an interdisciplinary team, the Digitalization Task Force actively promotes the digital transformation of business processes. We analyze and model existing processes, develop new process models as well as digitization and automation solutions together with the business units and implement them as part of a digital roadmap.
You advise business units on the digital transformation of their processes.
In this context, you design and develop new digitization solutions and applications in close coordination with the departments.
After completion of the implementation you ensure the delivery of maintenance and support.
You actively promote the exchange of knowledge between the business units and involved experts and share your knowledge with the Digitalization Community.
QUALIFICATIONS
successfully completed studies of (business) computer science or a comparable education
first professional experience in the IT sector
practical application knowledge of common programming languages, such as Java, .Net or C(++)
UiPath skills are a plus
team spirit and high self-motivation
good communication skills
BENEFITS
Development discussions and programs so that you can reach your full potential.
Flexible work arrangements so that you can balance your working life and private life.
Onboarding to help you settle in quickly, ensuring you are part of the BASF team from day one.
Health and wellbeing programs to help you achieve better health and work-life balance.
ABOUT US

Do you have any questions about the application process or the position? Ms. Isabelle Bludau (Talent Acquisition) Phone no.: +49 (0)30 2005 59773

Please note that we do not return paper applications including folders. Please submit copies only and no original documents.

BASF Services Europe GmbH can be found in the heart of Berlin and delivers a range of services for the BASF Group across Europe as a "Shared Service Center". We are an international team of 2000 employees from more than 50 nations and we bring together know-how in the areas of finance, controlling, HR, procurement, product safety and digitalization. We place an emphasis on teamwork and commitment and put diversity and inclusion into practice every day.

Learn more about the SSC at http://www.on.basf.com/ServicesEuropeEN

At BASF, the chemistry is right. Because we are counting on innovative solutions, on sustainable actions, and on connected thinking. And on you. Become a part of our formula for success and develop the future with us - in a global team that embraces diversity and equal opportunities irrespective of gender, age, origin, sexual orientation, disability or belief.

The world of esports is experiencing explosive growth and, with that growth comes a wealth of opportunities. In a billion-dollar industry, where data is king, we at Bayes Esports have claimed our place as the newest leader in the market.
With our cutting-edge technology-driven products, we solve real issues that esport organizers, teams and media companies are facing everyday backed-up by our very own machine learning algorithms. Partnerships with some of the biggest names in the esports and betting industries put Bayes Esports in a unique position that allows us to make a real impact in this vibrant and exciting space.
We are passionate gamers at heart—an agile team of esports enthusiasts building a truly innovative next-generation data distribution platform. Join us in the heart of Berlin, where startup culture meets metropolitan lifestyle, and work with top talent from all over the world.

**About your future team: **

The Betting Team at Bayes is hard at work on something big and we need all of the passion and brainpower we can get. Whether you’re the type that’s got your ear to the ground of the Esports scene, a seasoned sports bettor or simply industry-curious— as long as you’ve got drive and a desire to grow alongside us— there’s a place for you in the group. We’re a tight-knit, enthusiastic and inquisitive bunch working together to build comprehensive betting solutions for a variety of clients. What’ll the next big thing in Esports betting be? Us and whatever we do.
We are looking for a Senior Python Backend Developer who knows what’s going on and who is a great addition to our highly skilled development team. We are looking for people who are looking for a challenge, ready to take ownership and want to achieve something great.

**Responsibilities: **

* Being part in the development of a new data processing service
Building tools to support internal and external administration
Working closely with your colleagues to ensure timelines are met
Making design decisions for the development process
Getting familiar with existing projects for occasional maintenance work
Deploying and continuously improving the running services on AWS and Kubernetes

**Requirements: **

* BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Software Engineering, a similar field or multiple years of experience working as a software engineer
5+ years of professional experience with python
Experience in designing and implementing REST APIs
Strong problem solving skills
Keen on fast prototyping with short time-to-market
Adaptive to changing environments
Fluent in English

**Pluses: **

* Experience with betting
Experience with AWS, Docker, RabbitMQ, Redis, Kubernetes, Document Databases
Interested in esports and gaming

**We offer you: **

* Flexible working hours
10% of your work time to spend on esports and/or gambling topics of your choice (alone or as a team)
Internal training sessions in your field of profession and beyond
Weekly educational gaming sessions with the Betting Team
Two gaming rooms stocked with 6 PCs each to play and crush enemies with your colleagues
Bayes bar with free snacks and after work beers
Free massage sessions
Free coffee, water & soft drinks to stay focused and hydrated
Lots of game enthusiasts with whom you can talk and share game experiences
Subsidized public transportation ticket
Participation in our Virtual Share Program

We are open to remote for qualified candidates!

We look forward to receiving your application (cover letter, CV and references) as well as your salary requirements and earliest possible starting date.

Job Type: Permanent

Salary: 65,000.00€ - 80,000.00€ per year

Benefits:
Flexible schedule
Free drinks
Work from home
Schedule:
No weekends
Experience:
Python: 5 years (Required)

Partnerschaftlichkeit, Qualität und User Centricity sind feste Bestandteile unserer DNA. Wir sind Thalia Digital Retail Solutions - ein Studio für digitale Produkte in Berlin Kreuzberg. Unsere interdisziplinären Teams designen und entwickeln mobile Apps mit mehr als 3 Mio. Nutzern für Kunden wie Douglas - Europas führenden Beauty Anbieter. Wir arbeiten kollaborativ und vertrauensbasiert, teilen am liebsten unsere Fähigkeiten und erweitern damit unser Wissen. Unsere Kultur und Arbeit möchten wir gemeinsam gestalten, bist du dabei?

Für unseren Standort in Berlin Kreuzberg suchen wir ab sofort einen

Senior Software Engineer (m/w/d)

Welche Aufgaben erwarten dich:
Du betreibst die eigenverantwortliche Weiterentwicklung des Backend Systems der
nativen Endkunden-App mit Spaß an Software-Engineering und Clean Code in einem
agilen Produktteam
Du berätst neue Kunden, entwirfst anhand Ihrer Anforderung eine Software Architektur
und erstellst qualitativ hochwertige Anwendungen für unsere Partner im B2B-Geschäft
Du betreust in der Rolle des Full-Stack-Entwicklers die ganze Kette vom
Architekturentwurf, Datenbankzugriff, Serviceaufruf bis hin zum Monitoring in weiteren
Kundenprojekten
Du sicherst die Qualität durch Code Reviews, Unit-/Integrations-/End-To-End-Tests
sowie die Auslieferung über Jenkins und Git
Du misst anhand von Kennzahlen die Produktivität, Performance und Qualität eurer
Software, um sie stetig zu verbessern
Du entwickelst zusammen mit dem Product Owner und dem Team die beste Lösung für
unsere Kunden

Was bringst du mit:
Ein abgeschlossenes Informatikstudium oder eine vergleichbare
Qualifikation sowie mehrere Jahre Erfahrung in der Software Programmierung
Kenntnisse in aktuellen Frameworks und Konzepten (z.B. Lint, REST API,
Microservices), Entwicklungswerkzeugen (Git, NPM, Jenkins) und Expertise
in JavaScript, Typescript & Node.js. (Erfahrung in der Java-Backend-Entwicklung ist
hilfreich)
Grundlegendes Verständnis für die Anforderung von mobilen APPs (Response Size,
Request Count) und Frontend-Technologien (HTML5, JavaScript, Responsive
Webdesign)
Kenntnisse im Betrieb und Umgang mit Cloud-Diensten (Azure, AWS, etc.)
Erfahrungen mit Datenbanksystemen (MySQL, NoSQL)
Du bringst ein agiles- und Nutzer-zentriertes Mindset mit und hast Interesse ein Produkt
zu entwickeln und nicht nur Tickets abzuarbeiten
DDD, TDD, BDD – die Abkürzungen sind dir bekannt oder du hast Interesse hier
praktische Erfahrung zu sammeln.
Konzeptionelle Stärke, analytisches Denken und Kommunikationsfähigkeit, sowie
eigenverantwortliches und kundenorientiertes Arbeiten
Gute Deutsch und Englischkenntnisse

Diese Benefits bieten wir dir:
Partnerschaftliche Zusammenarbeit auf Augenhöhe mit unseren Kunden
Flexibilität durch Vertrauensarbeitszeit und Home Office
Die Möglichkeit, dich und deine Ideen mit einzubringen und unsere Produkte und unsere Zusammenarbeit mitzugestalten
Regelmäßige Teamevents oder gemeinsames Kaffee -oder Biertrinken
Ein neues Macbook und unbegrenztes Budget für Fachbücher
Coaching, Support und ein Fortbildungsbudget für deine persönliche und fachliche Weiterbildung
Eine kompetitive Vergütung, 30 Urlaubstage und eine unbefristete Festanstellung
Umzugsunterstützung und betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Vielfältige Corporate Benefits, u.a. Thalia und Douglas Shopping Benefits
Offene Büroräume im Bergmannkiez und Vergünstigungen bei Restaurants in unmittelbarer Nähe des Büros

Du möchtest Thalia noch besser kennenlernen? Dann schau dir den TechBlog an unter https://tech.thalia.de.

Haben wir dein Interesse geweckt?
Dann sende deine Bewerbung unter Angabe deines Gehalts-
rahmens und deines frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins
per E-Mail an unseren Recruiting Partner Kooku: bewerbung@kooku.de!
Deine Ansprechpartnerin: Aylin Sarica

Nimm Anlauf und spring in die brandung! Erfrische uns mit deinen kreativen Ideen und technischen Skills und treib unsere inhabergeführte Digitalagentur für smarte Online Kommunikation und E-Commerce Lösungen stromaufwärts.

Shopware Developer (w/m/d) für unser Backend Team in Berlin gesucht. Du willst mit deinem E-Commerce Know-How glänzen und agile Projekte mit deinen Kunden wie Hertha BSC, VfL Wolfsburg und Schalke 04 realisieren? Du bist PHP Developer und Shopware Spezialist? Dann bist du bei uns richtig!

Dein Spielfeld:
Entwicklung anspruchsvoller und individueller digitaler Anwendungen für B2C und B2B Shops
Erstellung von technischen Konzepten und Software-Architekturen
Entwicklung von Schnittstellen zwischen B2C/B2B Online-Shops und bestehenden Warenwirtschaftssystemen auf Kundenseite
Direkte Kommunikation mit den technischen Dienstleistern für die Warenwirtschaftssysteme
Performance-Optimierung von Import-Schnittstellen
Deine Skills:
Ein (Wirtschafts-) Informatikstudium oder eine gleichwertige Ausbildung
Berufserfahrung im Bereich objektorientierter Programmierung mit PHP 5/7 sowie in der Umsetzung von Shopware Projekten
Keine Angst vor der Konsole in Unix/Linux und dem Apache Webserver
Wissensdurst gepaart mit einem hohen Anspruch an deine eigene Arbeit
Erfahrungen mit SQL sowie im Profiling und der Performance-Optimierung von Shopware-Installationen
Deine Benefits:
Du bist Mitglied eines großen Entwicklerteams mit starkem Wissensaustausch
Wir sponsern deine Weiterbildung – Barcamps, Workshops, Konferenzen und Zertifizierungen gehen auf uns
Wahl zwischen Mac und Windows Hardware für deinen Workspace in Kreuzberg
Flexible Arbeitszeiten, Home Office und individuelle Teilzeitmodelle
Vielzahl an Team- und Community-Events sowie After-Work Spaß an der Switch und Tischtennisplatte
Deine Team:

An unseren Standorten in Köln und Berlin arbeiten mehr als 170 Mitarbeiter an innovativen Projekten für Kunden wie 1. FC Köln, Ferrero, Steiff, McFit, HDI und WWF. Unsere agilen Workflows ermöglichen dir effektive Teamarbeit in allen Bereichen - Projektmanagement, Kreation und Entwicklung. Mach dir ein erstes Bild von unserem Arbeitsalltag und von deinen neuen Kollegen.

Art der Stelle: Vollzeit

Leistungen:
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Flexible Arbeitszeiten
Homeoffice

Wir sind die Entwickler von Papyrus Autor dem Schreibprogramm für moderne Autoren. Wir vereinen technologisches und literarisches Know-How und kreieren die beste Software für Schriftsteller, die es gibt.

Gestalte mit uns die Zukunft des Schreibens. Wir freuen uns auf Dich und Deine einzigartigen Fähigkeiten.

Aufgaben


Mit Deinen Programmierskills beeinflusst Du, wie Menschen Bücher schreiben Deine Lösungen landen direkt bei Autoren und Schriftstellern.

Bei uns nutzt Du Deine Erfahrung in einem klassischen, langfristigen Softwareprojekt. In Deiner Arbeit wendest Du moderne, objektorientierte Entwicklungsmethoden an, kannst Dich aber auch in komplexe prozedurale Programmierung hineindenken.

Was Dich erwartet
C++ Programmierung für eine einzigartige, von unseren Anwendern geliebte Software.
Entwicklung von neuen Softwaremodulen und -technologien mit C++ und Qt.
Modernisierung des prozeduralen C-Kernels unserer Textverarbeitung / Office-Suite.
Design und Umsetzung innovativer Software im Team. Bei uns arbeiten alle zusammen, Fragen können sofort geklärt werden. Jeder, der mitredet, versteht auch etwas von Software.
Mitentwicklung unserer mobilen Version mit Qt.
Qualifikation
Du kannst im Team arbeiten, bist stressresistent und verantwortungsbewusst. Du liebst es, etwas zu kreieren.
Du bringst sehr gute Kenntnisse in C/C++ mit.
Du hast Spaß an Oldschool C/C++-Code und Freude an Entwicklung von modernem C++.
Gotos im Code lassen Dich höchstens ein bisschen verzweifeln.
Du hast einen Uni-Abschluss und/oder berufliche Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung. Du bist Autodidakt ohne Abschluss? Überzeuge uns von Deinem Talent.
Benefits


Papyrus Autor ist unser Traumprojekt. Mach es zu Deinem eigenen und kreiere etwas, das ohne Dich nicht existiert hätte.

Flache Hierarchien: Keine Bürokratie, keine Politik. Wir fokussieren uns auf großartige Software.

Wachse mit uns: Entwickle Dich in eine Schlüsselposition in einem stabilen, international wachsenden Unternehmen.

Schnelle Maschinen: Arbeite mit einem Setup, das Du liebst. Hardwarewünsche sind kein Problem.

Füllhorn inklusive: Große Auswahl an Snacks, Früchten und Getränken, allzeit bereit.

Körper und Geist: Gefördertes Fitnessangebot mit 130 Top-Locations in Berlin. Sorry für die Snacks.

Mobile Freiheit: Wir sitzen im Herzen der Stadt. Navigiere Berlin mit unserem extrem günstigen BVG-Ticket.

Hast Du Dich erkannt? Bewirb Dich bei uns mit Deinem Lebenslauf und einer Arbeitsprobe, z.B. einem Auszug aus einem früheren Projekt. Wir freuen uns auf Dich!

position: Senior DevOps Engineer/Senior Site Reliability Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
Based in Berlin and Chicago, we at Fit Analytics are a team of data scientists, fashionistas, physicists, business analysts, designers, and hackers, working together to tackle a single problem: making it easy for online shoppers to find the right clothes size. We help some of the world’s largest clothing brands solve sizing issues, boost conversions and slash returns.

OUR VISION is a world with zero returns in apparel (and footwear) e-commerce resulting from a truly personalized, worry-free shopping experience.
OUR MISSION is to use the power of machine learning to help fashion shoppers buy with confidence and eliminate the need for returns.

Fit Analytics — the world’s leading sizing solution for apparel & footwear — is looking for a motivated full-time Senior DevOps Engineer/Senior Site Reliability Engineer (m/f/d). You will work with our development teams to ensure that we provide a reliable service with the highest possible quality. If you're ready to use your skills to shape the future of the online fashion industry and you are not afraid of billions of requests a day, we want to hear from you!
What The Role As Senior DevOps Engineer/Senior Site Reliability Engineer (m/f/d) Involves
Managing and enhancing our cloud production and staging environments
Implementing and advocating for using CI/CD delivery best practices across the engineering teams
Collaborating with passionate technologists across multiple disciplines to ensure security, resilience and performance requirements
Mentoring Junior DevOps Engineers and Developers
Improving our monitoring system and alert reporting
Having a direct impact on how tens of millions of people buy clothes online
What We're Looking for in You
Extensive experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) products or Amazon Web Services (AWS) products is a must
2+ years hands-on experience with Kubernetes and Docker
Good knowledge of infrastructure automation with Terraform
Good knowledge of network infrastructure design
In-depth understanding of web technologies
Experience with git
Good programming skills in at least one high level language, preferably in Golang or Node.js
Fluent English and excellent communication skills
What We Offer You
Hands-on experience with a product that is revolutionizing the apparel & footwear market
The opportunity to become a key part of Fit Analytics’ growth story
A spot in our smart, creative and highly motivated international team
Daily breakfast and lunch plus regular team events
What We Do at Fit Analytics

The Fit Analytics' platform combines the world's largest database of garment and fit information with hundreds of billions of purchase records and consumer preferences. Our products Fit Finder, Fit Connect, Fit Intelligence and Fit Source help clothing and apparel companies instantly access the power of machine learning to deliver a perfect fit for customers. By applying the power of machine learning to this unique data set, we've created a range of innovative solutions to help drive improvements throughout the apparel lifecycle from manufacturing to marketing. Leading apparel brands and retailers across six continents trust our platform to solve sizing at scale and deliver meaningful bottom-line impact. Our clients include the likes of Zara, Asos, Hugo Boss, JD Sports, Bershka, The North Face, Tommy Hilfiger, Uniqlo, Calvin Klein and many more!

Why We’re Different

We're not sitting around wondering what the product is and burning other people's money while expecting everyone to work ridiculous hours for little reward. We're profitable, organized, and already providing a unique solution that delivers huge value to our partners while helping millions of people a month shop better online.


By clicking the “APPLY FOR THIS JOB” button you expressly make the following representations and warranties and give your consents as described below:
Your personal data contained in your application will be collected by Fit Analytics GmbH (“Controller”), which is located at Voigtstrasse 3, 10247 Berlin, Germany and can be contacted per email at jobs@fitanalytics.com.
Fit Analytics collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Fit Analytics’ recruitment related activities. Consequently, Fit Analytics may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants including for example setting up and conducting interviews and tests, evaluating and assessing the results thereto and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment processes including the final recruitment.
Your personal data will be shared with Lever, Inc., a cloud services provider located in the United States of America and engaged by the Controller to help manage its recruitment and hiring process on behalf of the Controller. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States, your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it through this site.
Your personal data will be retained by the Controller as long as the Controller determines it is necessary to evaluate your application for employment. If no legal retention period exists, the data will be deleted as soon as storage is no longer required or the legitimate interest in storage of this data has lapsed. You may give consent that we keep your application for 6 months for future opportunities.

Our core technology is Choice Modelling, a method from behavioural science used to understand and predict human decision making. Our services are used globally in diverse areas including: preparing governments for a driverless vehicle future, exploring the viability of space tourism, showing the economic value of bio-diversity and improving quality of life through patient-oriented healthcare.

This is a unique opportunity for a skilled front-end Javascript developer to work on both core software development as well as short run behavioural science projects requiring custom interactivity.

You’ll work in a young, dynamic growing company for international clients in the US, UK and Australia. Your technical skills will help push forward the frontiers of academic research using advanced scientific methods.

Our ideal candidate

You have 4+ years experience in developing front-end systems using Javascript in one or more of its flavours: vanilla JS, jQuery, Backbone, Handlebars, RactiveJs, Vue, etc. You understand the dynamic between front-end usability, design and speed against and back-end robustness and security.

What you’ll do

be lead developer on new front-end functionality in our core software
manage software testing, release and communication
work with backend developers
work on academic and commercial projects to develop interactive components for online research
work with with internal and external clients to develop new product solutions
review and improve system architecture and security

Our Stack

Linux, Perl, Apache, SQL Backend
Bootstrap, LESS
Ractive JS, JQuery

Your qualifications

A good spoken and written command of the English language
Already based in Berlin with work rights in the European Union
4+ years of experience in Javascript development
Strong HTML/CSS skills coding for Responsive layouts
A minimum of 2 years experience in a commercial environment
Mid-range computer network skills
Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science or Engineering qualifications

And for bonus points

Graphic Design expertise

Benefits – What we offer

A young, focused, international working atmosphere in an office of 20 people
An opportunity for personal growth toward a senior position within the company
To work directly with leading economists, researchers and scientists from all over the world
Flexible working hours, 32-40 hours per week
An opportunity to contribute to the development of social, health and environmental research
Centrally based office in Berlin-Schöneberg

Are you interested?

Send your CV to developer_hiring@surveyengine.com. Suitable candidates will be invited to a skills evaluation prior to an interview. for more information, visit http://surveyengine.com

Our recruitment process complies with the GDPR regulations. The data collected is used only for purposes of identifying and evaluating candidates for potential employment, as well as for future roles that may become available. Click here for more information.

Asaphus Vision develops head tracking, eye tracking and face recognition software for the automotive industry. Our team consists of experts in machine and deep learning, and embedded software development. Our office is in the heart of Berlin.

Tasks


•Designing and developing our C++ based software in an agile environment.

•Testing and debugging C++ code on Windows machines, on Linux and on embedded Systems.

•Using and extending our continuous development and integrating pipelines for robust software testing and deployment.

Requirements


•Master's degree in Computer Science or Mathematics.

•Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.

•Strong programming skills in C++.

•Practical experience in software development.

•Practical experience with software design and development concepts.

•Excellent communication skills in English.

•German residency or existing working permit for Germany is essential.

Benefits


•Flexible working hours.

•Exciting and responsible tasks.

•Open corporate culture, flat hierarchies in a young and international team.

•Modern office at S-Bhf Tiergarten (Charlottenburg).

Interested? Then send us your CV including salary expectations and possible starting date via JOIN

About us

Thryve is an AI-centric Fraunhofer Spin-Off developing a software development kit (SDK) for wearable- and smartwatch-based health monitoring. Analysing raw sensor signals and health data, our multi-disciplinary team creates a comprehensive set of health indicators available from everyday devices. This enables both research and health care providers to offer suit-tailored health assistance in specializations ranging from cardiology to depression, from baby monitoring to geriatrics and makes our software improve the lives of millions of people. Recently, we leveraged our technology in an effort to help monitor the spread of COVID-19 by launching an App in collaboration with the German Robert Koch Institute.

Tasks


We are looking for a Backend Developer to drive the integration of our backend and data science systems. You share our vision of day-to-day devices providing individual health assistance and have an explorative technological mindset. You ensure that our solutions provide excellent mobile data access, secure backend administration and rapid mass data processing. Together with the mobile engineering and data science teams, you decide on new and changed modules as well as their interaction and implementation. You take full ownership of software and appreciate the freedom to choose the best stack of tools and methodologies for any given task.

Requirements


Your profile
You have at least 3 years work experience in a development position and are eager to learn from a strong team and mentor
You are up for a challenge and extremely versatile when it comes to applying your skillset
You have a holistic understanding of modern software systems and ideally been exposed to a variety of tech stacks
You have a solid background in Java or Kotlin as well as AWS or ideally even T-Cloud
You have a few years of experience with the full development life cycle in highly professional service environments
You have a profound knowledge of the software landscape, architectures and trends, with outstanding knowledge in Java
You thrive in an open, agile and clean-code environment
You have the passion to discover, evaluate and implement new technical solutions that make our vision a reality
You have good communication skills in English, with German being a plus
Benefits


Why work with us

We are a software company creating solutions for the single most important sphere individual health. If you are fascinated by the ever-evolving capabilities of wearable devices and like the idea of pushing software to its limit to improve health assessment and assistance, this is an exciting opportunity. We offer the opportunity to build something big, work in an open-minded atmosphere, with a cutting-edge tech stack and earn a competitive salary with equity opportunities. Join us and create the health stack of the future!

Do not hesitate to apply if the above sounds like the perfect career step for you!

Shopify is now permanently remote and working towards a future that is digital by design. While Berlin is our hub, this role is open to candidates in European time zones. Learn more about what this can mean for you.

Shopify is the world’s fastest growing commerce platform, with no plans to slow down.

Our European team (with the offices in Berlin and Vilnius) is looking for a Backend Developer excited to build, grow and scale our greenfield product with us. We need the help of a dedicated, curious and versatile developer with a passion for performance, and simplicity. Does this sound like you?

As a part of our backend development team, you'll not only work on improving the company’s products, but also on increasing the calibre over time. This is a long term vision founded on a number of practices — from encouraging individual ownership and deep learning, to congratulating team members when they’ve done a great job. Does this sound like you?
Experience with MVC frameworks (Laravel, Symfony, Rails, Django ...).

At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. We strongly encourage applications from people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, racialized people, and/or people with intersectional identities. Our mission is to ensure start-up support for an industry that will redefine mobility in the future. That is why we are looking for people who know their minds – Lateral thinkers; Visionaries; Catalysts.

To support our team in Berlin as soon as possible, we are looking for conceptually skilled, enthusiastic, and willing to learn:

Full-Stack Developer (Java) (M/F/X)


The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing high-quality applications. They will be part of a multidisciplinary team that designs, implements, and maintains quality, scalable solutions. Are you in tune with the times, and are you burning to drive forward innovative technology that will change the world? Then apply!

Your responsibilities
Develop quality software and web applications
Analyze and maintain existing software applications
Design, write, test, deploy and maintain highly scalable, testable solution
Work with infrastructure as code (AWS Cloud Formation Templates)
Take on additional tasks within the multifunctional team according to experience level and seniority
Qualifications and Experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science
Development experience with programming languages/frameworks (essential: Java, Spring Boot; desirable: Angular)
Understanding of Microservice architecture (essential) / experience (desirable)
Experience with REST and SOAP API standard (essential)
AWS Cloud / DevOps experience (desirable)
As an employer that has been recognized numerous times by Faircompany, Hubject is committed to sustainability and equality. Our corporate structure consists of flat hierarchies and internal opportunities for promotion.

What we can offer you
An innovative, cutting-edge business model in the emerging eMobility market;
Creative, international working environment at the EUREF Campus in Schöneberg in Berlin – Europe’s hotspot for green technology and eMobility ;
Numerous employee benefits such as home offices, daily allowances, team events, and sports;
Dynamic, highly motivated and skilled team;
Attractive salary and a travel expenses allowance for the Berliner Verkehrsbetriebe (BVG).
Do you want to drive the mobility of the future with us? Then send your full application (cover letter, salary expectations, start date, tabular CV, and references) to career@hubject.com.

More about us


Electric vehicle drivers must be able to charge their cars at every charging station regardless of the operator. Hubject makes it simple by enabling the world’s largest cross-operator EV charging network with more than 120.000 charging points and over 300 B2B partners across 26 countries and. Following the need for a seamless charging experience, Hubject also operates the only market-ready and tested Plug&Charge solution for autonomous, seamless, and secure charging based on the most secure ISO 15118 standard, enabling technological enhancements like Plug&Charge, bi-directional and inductive charging. Hubject Consulting acts as a boutique advisory and trusted market maker for digital mobility, offering tailor-made services and solutions to leading global energy, mobility, and software industries. The Berlin-based software company is a joint venture; its shareholders include the BMW Group, Bosch, Daimler, EnBW, Enel X, innogy, Siemens, and the Volkswagen Group. Hubject’s headquarter is located in Berlin, with additional offices in Los Angeles and Shanghai.

Experience with OpenVR SDK
Benefits
Join a creative team of forward-thinking technologists and help shape company culture from an early stage

Exciting projects using innovative technologies
Competitive salary

Als DevOps Engineer * arbeitest Du mit anderen DevOps Engineers, einem Product Owner und einem Technical Coordinator daran, unsere Entwicklerteams bei der Migration der Shop Plattform in die AWS Cloud zu unterstützen. Deine Unterstützung erfolgt zum Beispiel durch das Aufsetzen und Durchführen von Workshops und die Entwicklung allgemein nützlicher Tools und PlugIns, von denen die Entwicklungsteams profitieren. Du bist regelmäßig einzeln oder mit deinen DevOps Kollegen in anderen Entwicklungsteams aktiv. Dabei löst Du aktuelle Problemstellungen zusammen mit den Teams. Du kannst aber auch aktiv Einfluss auf unsere strategische Ausrichtung der Shop Migration in die AWS Cloud nehmen.

Du setzt Dich aktiv und direkt mit unseren Stakeholdern auseinander in Deutsch oder Englisch und findest zusammen mit ihnen passende Lösungen für myToys. Du bist fester Bestandteil unserer Reviews, Plannings und Retrospektiven. Zum Aufgabenspektrum gehört auch die Betreuung von weiteren internationalen Entwicklungsteams in Madrid und Moskau; die Betreuung erfolgt von Berlin aus, regelmäßige Reisen sind nicht Teil des Profils.

Des Weiteren unterstützt Du den Betrieb der onPremise Shopkomponenten, die noch auf die Migration in die Cloud warten.

Das Team der DevOps Engineers entwickelt sich fortlaufend agil weiter und nutzt dabei sowohl Kanban als auch Scrum; wir hoffen dabei auf deine tatkräftige Mitarbeit.

Unsere Anforderungen:
Fundierte Kenntnisse im Umgang mit AWS VPC, EC2, S3 und IAM - Elastic Beanstalk erwünscht
Fundierte Terraform / Cloud Formation Kenntnisse (Terraform bevorzugt)
Professionelle Erfahrung mit Kubernetes setzen wir voraus
Mehrjährige Erfahrung im Umgang mit Linux Distributionen
Erste Erfahrungen im Coaching von Entwicklungsteams
Erfahrungen im Umgang mit agilen Methoden wie Kanban oder Scrum
Erfahrungen mit Programmier- und Skriptsprachen
Hohes Maß an Selbstständigkeit und Verantwortungsbewusstsein
Dein Englisch übersteht auch Konfliktsituationen
Du verfügst über analytisches Denkvermögen und eine strukturierte Arbeitsweise
Wir bieten:
Eine anspruchsvolle und interessante Stelle mit viel Eigenverantwortung und persönlichem Weiterentwicklungspotenzial
Flexible Arbeitszeiten für eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten und eine optimale Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf
Ein tolles Arbeitsumfeld in einem der größten E-Commerce-Unternehmen Deutschlands
Eine offene Unternehmenskultur, in der Dein Talent und Deine Persönlichkeit einen Platz findet
Ein angenehmes Arbeitsklima mit einem hochmotivierten und kompetenten Team
Täglich die Möglichkeit, die eigenen Stärken auszuspielen und sich fachlich weiterzuentwickeln
Neugierig geworden?
Dann lerne uns kennen. Besuche dafür unsere Karriereseite und bewirb Dich direkt online. Wir freuen uns auf Dich!
Dein Kontakt: Thomas Kanow

* Wir erklären ausdrücklich, dass bei uns jede Person, unabhängig des Geschlechts, der Nationalität oder der ethnischen Herkunft, der Religion oder der Weltanschauung, einer Behinderung, des Alters sowie der sexuellen Identität, willkommen ist.

position: Senior AWS Cloud/ DevOps Engineer*in (w/m/d) für unsere Privatkredit Unit im Berliner Fintech
description:
Bist du Entwickler*in und hast dein Steckenpferd Operations entdeckt? Hast du Spaß am Entwickeln und Betreiben von modernen und einfachen Lösungen? Perfekt. Wir kümmern uns um das Privatkredit-Angebot der Europace Plattform, vom Frontend über APIs bis zum Backend, natürlich inklusive Betrieb. Unsere 36 Kollegen starke, selbstorganisierte und vollfunktionale Unit freut sich auf dich!

Wie sehen deine Aufgaben bei uns aus?


Du entwickelst unsere Service Infrastruktur weiter: Du unterstützt uns beim Betrieb unserer bestehenden virtualisierten Linux-Server und der darauf laufenden Infrastruktur. Dabei legst du ein besonderes Augenmerk auf die Aktualität, Sicherheit und Verfügbarkeit unserer Datenbanken sowie zuverlässige Backups. Container-Orchestrierung gehört für dich dabei zum Alltag.

Du bringst uns in die Cloud: Du bringst deine umfangreiche und praktische Erfahrung mit Cloud-Providern wie AWS oder Google Cloud ein. Treibe das Thema und überlege mit uns, wann, wie und in welchem Umfang wir mit unseren Services in die Cloud gehen. Neben der reinen Umsetzung hast du dabei auch ein Bewusstsein für Datenschutz, Datensicherheit und das große Ganze.

Du optimierst die operationalen Aspekte unserer Services: Du schreckst nicht vor der Weiterentwicklung unserer Spring Boot basierten Microservices zurück und entwickelst Patterns und Best Practices, um diese optimal in unsere Infrastruktur zu integrieren und den stabilen Betrieb zu gewährleisten.

Was erwarten wir von dir?


Faulheit ;): Du willst nicht mehrmals das Gleiche tun und liebst Automatisierung.

Best and Worst Practices: Du hast schon einiges erlebt und bringst deine Expertise und Erfahrung als Entwickler auch beim Lösen und Automatisieren von operationalen Themen mit ins Team.

Einfachheit: Du strebst nach einfachen und übersichtlichen Lösungen. Dabei helfen dir deine bereits gesammelten beruflichen Erfahrungen und dein Interesse an Open Source.

Offenheit: Du machst Dinge nicht einfach nur anders, weil du es immer so gemacht hast. Stattdessen versuchst du die Hintergründe zu verstehen und nutzt dieses Wissen, um zu einer pragmatischen Lösung zu kommen.

Überblick: Dir fällt es leicht einen Schritt zurück zu machen und zu hinterfragen, ob Dinge zielführend sind, ohne das Ziel aus den Augen zu verlieren.

Kommunikationsstarker Teamplayer*in: Du bist mit Herz und Seele Teamplayer*in. Du formulierst klar und verständlich, bist zudem offen und durchsetzungsstark.

Interesse: Dein Interesse und deine schnelle Auffassungsgabe helfen dir dabei, rasch neue Themen zu adaptieren. Außerdem engagierst du dich, bringst dich ein und bist motiviert uns voranzubringen.

Was dich bei uns erwartet?


Selbstorganisation: Bei uns gibt es kein Micro-Management und keine klassischen Hierarchien. Du hast Raum zum Gestalten und Wirken.

Cross-Functional: Business Analysten, Developer, UX-Designer und Key Account Manager arbeiten an der Anwendung bei uns auf Augenhöhe.

Teamplay: Echtes Miteinander im Team mit freundlichen Kollegen, sowie gegenseitiger Respekt & Wertschätzung und ein hohes Maß an sozialer Kompetenz erwarten dich.

Fehlerkultur: Wir gehen offen mit unseren Fehlern um, beispielsweise mittels blameless Post-Mortems, die teilweise auch öffentlich nachzulesen sind.

Flexibilität: Flexibles Arbeiten im Office oder Remote - du hast die Wahl. Ist die Betreuung deines Kindes nicht möglich, kannst du neben Home-Office gerne auch unser Kids-Office nutzen.

Innovation Time: Du hast viele Möglichkeiten deine Innovationskraft zu nutzen und dich weiterzuentwickeln. Neben dem Einbringen in das Produkt kannst du auch eigene Projekte, Wissenstage, Exploration Days, Meetups, Konferenzen und vieles mehr nutzen.

Tech-Stack: Wir sind flexibel in der Auswahl unserer Tools und Techniken.
