position: Senior Developer*in & Architect*in (w/m/d) - für Berliner FinTech
description:
Win-win mit Finn.

Kennst du jemanden, der eine Baufinanzierung gemacht hat und hinterher sagte Boah, hat das Spaß gemacht, das würde ich jetzt gerne nochmal machen”? Wir auch nicht. Aber Finn soll das ändern. Finn – die Verbraucherintegration von Europace in den Finanzierungsprozess – ist ein Startup innerhalb des Unternehmens.

Wir glauben daran, dass der Finanzierungsprozess digital wird. Und wir wollen diese Digitalisierung für und mit dem Verbraucher neu denken: Finanzieren mit Leichtigkeit – transparent und informiert auf Augenhöhe mit dem Berater.

Dabei setzen wir auf nutzerzentrierte, hypothesengetriebene Entwicklung und die smarte Nutzung von Daten durch künstliche Intelligenz. Weder Berater noch Verbraucher sollen ihre Zeit mit trivialen, nicht wertschöpfenden Tätigkeiten verbringen. Durch den verantwortungsvollen Einsatz von Daten und Technologie kann sich der Berater auf die Beratungsleistung fokussieren und der Verbraucher auf die Frage, welche Entscheidung die beste für ihn ist um sich seinen Wunsch zu erfüllen.

Und wer ist eigentlich Europace?

Europace – Hidden Champion und FinTech: Die Europace AG ist ein Tochterunternehmen der Hypoport Gruppe. Wir sind seit über zehn Jahren erfolgreich und haben den Finanzierungsmarkt revolutioniert. Wir sind Deutschlands größter Finanzmarktplatz für Immobilienfinanzierungen, Bausparprodukte und Privatkredite. Mit unserem Transaktionsvolumen von über 4 Mrd. Euro im Monat und einem Wachstum, das deutlich über dem Markt liegt, schreiben wir gerne mit dir unsere Erfolgsstory fort.

Wobei genau sollst du uns unterstützen?


Wir gestalten und bewegen Märkte und befinden uns auf einer stetigen Mission für den Verbraucher. Teil dieser Mission ist die Entwicklung von Finn, einer Webanwendung an der Seite des Verbrauchers bei seiner Finanzierung.

Schritt für Schritt erkunden wir Neuland für den Verbraucher. Als Teil unseres interdisziplinären Scrum Teams sollst du
mit uns als Teamplayer nach dem Lean Startup Ansatz arbeiten
den technischen Produkterfolg verantworten
User Storys fokussiert und nutzerzentriert umsetzen
Durchführung von Code Reviews
die Feasibility von Konzepten beurteilen
Experimente zum Testen von Hypothesen operationalisieren
Innovation technisch ermöglichen
für den Product Manager und Product Owner Schnittstelle zum Dev Team sein
Produktideen mitentwickeln, Lösungen und Experimente mitgestalten
Gewährleisten dass Technologien effizient und sicher verwendet werden
Die Architektur und Infrastruktur von Finn verantworten
technischer Ansprechpartner für Finn sein
Wie arbeiten wir?
Wir wollen neues Land im Bereich der Finanzierung entdecken. Und das beginnt für uns ganz klar beim Verbraucher.
Der Wertbeitrag für den Verbraucher steht bei uns an erster Stelle.
Wir sagen zu ganz vielen Dingen Nein. Auch wenn wir sie selbst cool finden. Nur so kommen wir voran.
Wir haben den Mut Features zu releasen, die bewusst nicht alle Edge Cases und Eventualitäten berücksichtigen.
Wenn die Wert Stiftung für eine genügend große Nutzergruppe gegeben ist, ist das sicher genug für uns, um mit dem nächsten kleinen Baustein live zu gehen und dann weiter zu lernen.
Dabei legen wir großen Wert auf die Qualität von Code und der User Experience: begrenzter Umfang ja, schlechte Qualität nein.
Wir implementieren nur Dinge, von denen wir wissen, dass sie Wert für die Nutzer stiften. Nichts darüber hinaus. Wir gehen datenbasiert, step-by-step vor und erkunden die Ausgestaltung des Produkts.
Wir sind davon überzeugt, dass das Produkt das ausstrahlt was wir sind und was uns wichtig ist. Der Verbraucher soll mit Leichtigkeit finanzieren, und auch wir sehen die Dinge mit Leichtigkeit und einer verantwortungsvollen Fehlerkultur.
Wir übernehmen gemeinsam Verantwortung und sind Teamplayer: Eine*r für alle, alle für eine*n.
Was sollst du mitbringen?


Unsere Arbeitsweise entspricht Deinem Mindset und du hast eine zugewandte, lösungsorientierte Haltung. Außerdem vereinst du Mut, Pragmatismus und Qualitätsanspruch. Iteratives, nutzerzentriertes Vorgehen und Produkte mit einer herausragenden User Experience sind für dich der Standard.

Außerdem verfügst du über folgende fachliche Kompetenzen:
Langjährige Erfahrung als CTO für ein Softwareprodukt: Organisation und Verantwortung der Infrastruktur und Architektur sowie der technischen Produktentwicklung
Langjährige Erfahrung in der Hypothesen-getriebenen Softwareentwicklung (Lean Startup, Value Proposition Design, Prototyping, etc.)
Langjährige Erfahrung in Web-Technologien (HTML, CSS, JS) und Applikationsentwicklung mit React
Erfahrung mit der Entwicklung des gesamten Tech Stacks mit TypeScript und nach den SOLID Prinzipien
Praktische Erfahrung im Umgang mit AWS Cloud Development Kit, AWS Lambda, AWS S3, AWS DynamoDB
Was erwartet dich bei uns?
Freiraum: Raum zum Gestalten und Wirken. Technisch, fachlich oder auch organisatorisch
Cross-Funktionale Teamarbeit: Engineers, Domain Experts und Data Scientists erarbeiten gemeinsam Lösungen.
Flexibilität: Arbeitszeit, Ort, Urlaub sind im Team flexibel.
Selbstorganisation: Wir organisieren uns holakratisch und bringen Denken und Handeln zusammen.
Persönliche Entwicklung: Ist in unserem Umfeld eine Voraussetzung die wir entsprechend unterstützen und kein Benefit.
Respekt: Gegenseitiger Respekt und Wertschätzung und ein hohes Maß an sozialer Kompetenz.
Familienfreundlichkeit: Ist die Betreuung deines Kindes nicht möglich, kannst du neben Home-Office gerne auch unser Kids-Office und Bällebad nutzen.
20 % Zeit: für fachliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung.
Unterstützung: durch Kollegen und einen Mentor.
Und jetzt?


Auf Welcome@Europace, dem Europace Mitarbeiter-Blog und PnO Blog erfährst du noch mehr über uns. position: Senior Software Development Engineer / Machine Learning - Amazon Music
description:
As a Sr. Software Development Engineer you will collaborate with scientists on developing and evaluating machine learning models using large datasets such as audio features, meta-data, search queries or customers listening behavior to improve the customer experience through better recommendations, search results, or song sequencing. You will own scaling up successful prototypes and implementing a reliable automated production workflow for the model. You will collaborate with software development engineers to integrate the model with the customer experience.
Imagine being a part of an agile team where your ideas have the potential to reach millions. Picture working on cutting-edge consumer-facing products, where every single team member is a critical voice in the decision-making process. Envision being able to leverage the resources of a Fortune-500 company within the atmosphere of a start-up.

Welcome to Amazon Music, where ideas are born, and come to life as Amazon Music Unlimited, Prime Music, and the digital music store. Amazon Music offerings are available in multiple countries, and our applications support our mission of delivering music to customers in a way that enhances their day-to-day lives. We can be found on platforms such as the Amazon Echo, Kindle Fire, iOS, and Android as well as on a mixture of home and auto streaming platforms



Basic Qualifications

· 8+ years professional experience in software development
· Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis
· Knowledge of, at least, one modern programming language such as C++, Java, Scala or Python
· Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related field

Preferred Qualifications

· Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
· Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project
· Experience building workflows involving large dataset and/or machine learning models in production using distributed computing and big data processing concepts and technologies.
· Experience building distributed systems and/or micro services like ECS, Kubernetes, Apache Spark, EMR
· Experience with machine learning frameworks like MxNet, TensorFlow, etc.
· Master's Degree in Computer Science
Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Interested in building a new product? Join our team of deep divers.

At Trisor we have identified a great opportunity.
Safe deposit boxes have been a niche product for centuries. With growing distrust in the financial system, banks and political systems, we see a great potential in keeping physical assets protected. DIGITAL. SECURE. DISCRET. INDEPENDENT.

As part of the WeQ group, you will join one of our new ventures in the early growing phase and have a big impact on technical decisions and product development. You will engineer the scalable backend to manage our vaults and deposit boxes in facilities all over the world, connect the payment and billing systems and provide secure endpoints for the frontend.

Join our lab of "deep divers" a small multidisciplinary agile team of accomplished engineers with a focus on smart algorithms, scalable infrastructure and process automation. Help us build amazing products with cutting-edge technology!

What we expect from you in this role
From design to operation, you develop our scalable microservices
Implement algorithms, features and APIs using Java and GraphQL
You secure our infrastructure, endpoints and data like a digital vault
Code our infrastructure using Terraform and optimize our pipelines for CI/CD
Work in an agile environment and contribute your ideas to continuously improve our products, processes, and tools
Team up with talented developers, learn as much as you can, apply your expertise to build great products - and have fun while doing so!
What you should have accomplished so far
3+ years of working experience as a Java developer
The self-conception of owning and shipping your code
Expert in microservices, relational databases, and in-memory storage
Good knowledge in GraphQL, build pipelines, infrastructure as code and containerization
A strong sense of ownership and experience of working in a fast-paced company developing its innovative product

Our technology stack


Java, PostgreSQL, GraphQL, Docker, Terraform, AWS, CI/CD, Datadog and more to come

Perks awaiting you
Join an international and thriving team of innovation-drivers spanning all continents and grow alongside the brightest minds in the industry.
Our cool office is in hip Berlin neighborhood with access to lots of amenities. We provide top-notch workstations with the latest hardware, software, and OS of your choice.
We offer comprehensive health insurance at home or during your business travel, keep you hydrated and nourished with a selection of drinks and snacks.
We support your growth with intensive on-boarding, hands-on mentoring from our CTO and internal knowledge-sharing initiatives.
Enjoy 24/7 access to e-learning tools to improve your business, creative and tech skills.
We're all about community and collaboration! Mingle with your peers at our breakfasts, lunches, summer BBQs, Karaoke, Movie Nights and many more events.
Everyone is welcome to apply! We strive to achieve equality and diversity in the workplace, as a means of working together and achieving success. Our recruitment process solely based on merit, qualification and business needs. It does not discriminate against gender, race or religion.

Who We Are


Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

Practice Area Profile

BCG GAMMA combines innovative skills in computer science, artificial intelligence, statistics, and machine learning with deep industry expertise. The BCG GAMMA team is comprised of world-class data scientists and business consultants who specialize in the use of advanced analytics to get breakthrough business results. Our teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, building fact-bases, designing innovative algorithms, creating scale through designing tools and apps, and training colleagues and clients in new solutions. Here at BCG GAMMA, you’ll have the chance to work with clients in every BCG region and every industry area. We are also a core member of a rapidly growing analytics enterprise at BCG - a constellation of teams focused on driving practical results for BCG clients by applying leading edge analytics approaches, data, and technology.

What You'll Do

POSITION SUMMARY:


As a Lead Analytics Software Engineer, you will be responsible for advancing software solutions and analytics to support BCG Gamma’s analytics platform and clients. Your strong analytical skills and ability to develop innovative problem solving solutions will support mission critical decision analytics for our clients. Additional responsibilities will include developing feature enhancements to our platform, developing industry-leading analytics software solutions and methodologies and provide talks and papers in industry leading conferences on behalf of BCG Gamma. We are looking for talented individuals with a serious commitment to software development, data science, large data analytics and transforming organizations into analytics led innovative companies. As a new division in process of creating an innovative platform, we have many opportunities available throughout our GAMMA team.

RESPONSIBILITIES:


• Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software

• Develop abstract analytic models to solve complex problems for decision analysis

• Maintain an active role in every part of the software development life cycle

• Help mentor and guide junior developers

• Guide non-technical teams and consultants in understanding analytics at scale, infrastructure as code and best practices for robust software development

• Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design

• Design data structures and visualization of results to provide users actionable intelligence and situational awareness of supporting data

• Interact directly with clients on new features for future product releases

• Provide thought leadership to software design and solutions

What You'll Bring (Experience & Qualifications)

REQUIREMENTS:


• Masters Degree or PhD in Computer Research Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or related field

• 8+ years of experience in a software development environment, previous consulting experience and/or strong leadership positions

• Experience with Hashicorp Vault, Terraform & Consul

• Exposure to analytics applications or experience building analytics tools

• Familiarity with data science methods and scaling data science methods

• Proficiency with infrastructure as code principles

• Familiarity with the storage, manipulation and management of relational, non-relational and streaming data structures

• Analytic reasoning and complex problem solving involving mathematical programming and big data problems

• Understanding of parallel computing

TECHNOLOGIES:


• Languages programming: Python, GO, C++, Java, Scala, JavaScript, TypeScript

• DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, Terraform, unix-based command line

• Full stack development: GraphQL, React

• Data: SQL, Spark, Hadoop

• Data Science and machine learning (Pandas, Scikit learn)

• Deep learning (Tensorflow, Keras etc.)

• Cloud: AWS/Azure/Google

WORK ENVIRONMENT:


• Fast-paced, intellectually intense, service-oriented environment

• Position is located in Gamma European hubs (Paris, London, Germany, Nordics etc.)

• Fluency in local language and English are required

• Expect up time spent traveling

Familiarity with test frameworks and being used to testing while coding
A keen eye on security in your implementations
Proactivity in sharing knowledge with your team and contributing to solutions in a team setting
A strong sense of long term ownership of the work you do and believe in doing things the right way for the right reasons
Excellent communication skills in English is a must-have!
Why finleap connect?
A dynamic, fast-paced environment where you'll be working with a diverse workforce of over 150 connectors from over 35 different countries
We work hard, but we have fun along the way. You'll be joining a friendly and supportive Data Services team
Think we can do better? We're all ears! A creative and progressive work environment is guaranteed - we're in the business of disruption!
You'll be joining a major player in Berlin's famous start-up scene... and we're only just getting started!


Interested? Let's reshape the future of finance together!

#LI-NP1

At Issuu, we empower content creators through cutting edge tools, technology and services. We exist to help creators of longform, highly visual content build audiences and businesses. We're looking for a Fullstack Developer to join our ride.
We are the right company for you, if you
want to work on a product that matters to a lot of people – we receive hundreds of visits per second and host over 50M+ documents,
consider yourself one of the best at what you do and you're looking for equally talented colleagues,
are self-driven and would never just want to take the next ticket,
are curious and never stopped learning and exploring new languages, technologies and solutions,
seek a culture where all voices matter when it comes to shaping the future of the product,
want to work with colleagues who have a ‘here to help’ attitude, and absolutely want to help you succeed.
We believe you can help us succeed by
delivering results that create value for the end users, while we ensure a high-performance, high-availability, robust product that scale with our traffic (10.000++ requests/second ) and data-heavy platforms (100++ terabytes),
working across disciplines, and take a holistic, end-2-end approach to software development,
being at the forefront of development practices, Agile, Continuous Delivery, Software as Service, Cloud-based, Docker, React,
working equally well creating back-end and front-end solutions that can run in production at the scale of our traffic,
solving problems from just about every area of computer science, including search, information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, big data and so on.
We are looking for someone who has
a Master’s degree in CS or equivalent,
has worked on 2+ large scale commercial projects taken from inception to production,
experience with dynamically typed systems (e.g. Kotlin, Javascript; Python is a must),
experience with scalable microservice architecture,
the ability to work on any system, from code running in the browser to big data analytics dealing with terabytes of data,
a passion for frontend engineering (e.g. TypeScript, React, Sass, Design Systems),
excellent communication skills in English.
Other things you should know are
at the moment we're working on Issuu’s Story Cloud both on web and mobile apps, machine learning for better understanding of our content, internal analytics and our famous reading experience to mention a few examples,
we currently use languages like: Kotlin, Python, TypeScript, Javascript and OCaml, and we’re extremely open to using new languages and/or technologies,
our architecture is microservice-oriented using AMQP,
we deploy multiple times a day on AWS and use Docker Swarm, MySQL, Redis, Node, etc.,we strive to be agile (who doesn’t?), but we're not religious about Scrum, Kanban or any other methodology.
Would you like to join?
Can you say yes to most of these qualifications? We're looking for the right person to join our team in Berlin full-time and if it's you, don't hesitate to apply!

Our Berlin office is located in the nice Prenzlauer Berg area, surrounded by tech companies, nice cafes and parks. You will be part of a team of different disciplines including engineers, product and UX & Design. Occasionally, you will be asked to travel to our Copenhagen office, to work together with the rest of the Engineering and Product teams.

Dig deeper
Most of our content creators are on a mission to change their world in some way. They are passionate and driven and we consider ourselves the same. Check some of them out:

The avantgarde Italian kids fashion magazine: https://issuu.com/kidswearmagazine
The Danish outdoor garage start-up magazine: https://issuu.com/outsite.org
The Polish/Irish photographer: https://issuu.com/thefix-analogue-magazine
The American Meteorite Exchange Inc. Magazine: https://issuu.com/meteorite-times


We encourage everyone to apply regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital, veteran or disability status.

MHP: DRIVEN BY EXCELLENCE


Junior Software Engineer (f/m/d)


Kennziffer: MHP-D-1576072919-E-3
Einstiegsart: Absolventen / Young Professionals
Einsatzort:
Berlin, Essen, Frankfurt, Ludwigsburg, München, Nürnberg, Wolfsburg
Gesellschaft:
MHP – A Porsche Company

Aufgaben

Wir beraten unsere Kunden End-to-End – driven by Excellence von der Strategie bis zur Implementierung und Managed Services. Wo ist hierbei Ihr Platz bei MHP? Sie beherrschen beim Thema Sprachen nicht nur Englisch fließend, sondern auch Java, Angular oder C++? Clean Code ist Ihnen eine Herzensangelegenheit? Willkommen in unseren Technology & Data-Teams. Diese spannenden Aufgaben warten dort auf Sie:

Aufgaben:
Gemeinsam mit Ihrem Team führen Sie spannende und herausfordernde Projekte durch und gestalten zusammen mit unseren Kunden die Zukunft im Automotive und Manufacturing
Mit Ihrer Expertise und Ihrem Engagement entwickeln Sie gemeinsam im MHP Team innovative Konzepte im Bereich Web-, Standalone-, mobiler Applikationen und Individual-Softwarelösungen
Engagiert unterstützen Sie bei der technischen Umsetzung (z.B. im Bereich Connected Vehicle)
Leidenschaftlich arbeiten Sie in agilen DevOps Teams mit vielseitigen Aufgaben im gesamten Software-Lifecycle – von der ersten Konzeption bis zur Verantwortung für die Systemverfügbarkeit, als Site Reliability Engineer
Sie wirken bei der Konzeption und Implementierung in den Bereichen Front-End und Back-End Entwicklung mit

Qualifikationen

Wir nehmen an, dass Sie Ihr Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder einem IT-nahen Studiengang mit sehr guten Ergebnissen abgeschlossen haben
Wir wünschen uns ausgeprägtes Interesse an aktuellen Technologietrends & Entwicklungsmethoden sowie Spaß an der Programmierung
Wir wünschen uns erste Erfahrungen in einigen der folgenden Technologien bzw. Konzepten: Java, .NET, ABAP, UI5, HANA, SQL Scripting, Web Technologien, Hibernate, Spring, Angular, Reaktive Programmierung, REST oder Java Script/Type Script, PTC Windchill, Sharepoint, R, Python
Wir erwarten ein souveränes Auftreten beim Kunden vor Ort und schätzen unternehmerisches Denken und Handeln
Wir erwarten ein verhandlungssicheres Deutsch und Englisch, mit dem Sie sich problemlos in unserem internationalen Team mitteilen können
Wir schätzen die Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Kunden, Partnern und MHP’lern vor Ort und legen Wert auf Flexibilität und Reisebereitschaft
Start: perspektivisch Ende 2020/ Anfang 2021

Unternehmensprofil

MHP ist eine weltweit agierende und führende Management- und IT-Beratung.
Wir entwickeln wegweisende Mobility- und Manufacturing-Lösungen für internationale Konzerne, gestandene Mittelständler und disruptive Start-ups. Als Premium-Business- und Technologiepartner gestalten wir bereits heute die digitale Zukunft von morgen. Unser Beratungsansatz ist einzigartig: Wir verbinden ganzheitliche IT- und Technology-Expertise mit tiefgreifendem Management-Know-how. Damit ist MHP der ideale Partner für einen erfolgreichen Digital-Turn. Wir liefern als Digitalisierungsexperte entscheidende Analysen und innovative Strategien, um Veränderungsprozesse in nachhaltigen Mehrwert zu verwandeln.

Aktuell beraten über 2.500 Mitarbeiter weltweit 300 Kunden aus Mobility und Manufacturing. Unser Herz schlägt mit 8 Standorten in Deutschland und durch eigene Offices in Großbritannien, China, Rumänien, den USA sowie der Schweiz agieren wir mit insgesamt 13 Standorten global.
Doch egal wo auf der Welt gilt: MHP: DRIVEN BY EXCELLENCE.

Exklusive Einblicke hinter die Kulissen

Consulting ist ein äußerst vielfältiges Berufsfeld. Kein Tag gleicht dem anderen. Keine Woche vergeht ohne neue Herausforderungen. Das klingt nicht nur spannend, sondern ist auch so. Zum Glück teilen wir und unsere Mitarbeiter unsere Erlebnisse im Web und auf Social Media. So können Sie ganz entspannt daran teilhaben. Schauen Sie doch einfach mal in unsere Online-Portale. Dort erhalten Sie Eindrücke von aktuellen Events, Experteninterviews, Videos, Fachartikel und Foto-Galerien. Los geht’s - Nur einen Klick entfernt:

Amazon Web Services (AWS) Professional Services is looking for software development engineers to work in a new team that builds production-ready applications for AWS enterprise customers. Customers increasingly trust Amazon to not only provide cloud services that allow them to deprecate their on-premises IT infrastructure but to also architect and implement their new, cloud-native software. Customers are keen to retire their old-guard business applications that have grown over decades and become unmaintainable. They are keen to leverage machine learning and artificial intelligence to get more value from their data and better interact with their customers and employees.

As a Customer Engineer in AWS Professional Services, you work in a fast-paced team together with the most talented software development engineers to design, develop, test, and deploy well architected cloud-native software. You are an experienced coder and easily find re-usable solutions that are reliable, secure, high-performing, and scalable. You understand how to avoid complexity through simple solutions and good abstractions (Invent and Simplify). You respectfully challenge requirements and do not compromise clean, re-usable solutions to make meaningless deadlines or to tick off irrelevant requirements lists (Have Backbone; Disagree and Commit). You have strong judgment and good instincts (Are Right, A Lot) to know when investing 10 more hours upfront can save your team 1000 hours down the line and when it cannot. When you see a problem, you never say thats not my job (Ownership) but you fix it so that it stays fixed (Insist on the Highest Standards). You are never done learning and always seek to improve yourself (Learn and Be Curious).


Basic Qualifications

· Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical discipline
· Object-oriented design and coding skills
· Experience with agile software development
· Solid software development background including design patterns, data structures, test driven development



Preferred Qualifications

· Masters degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical discipline
· 3 5 (or more) years of experience as a software developer
· Experience with serverless and cloud technologies
· Experience with distributed (multi-tiered) systems
· Experience building secure and highly scalable applications
· Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
· Ability to break down complex concepts into easily understood frameworks and models
· Excellence in technical communication with peers and non-technical stakeholders
· Knowledge of professional software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and deployment

Your profile:
Degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related field.

Strong grasp of algorithms and data structures.

Proficient Linux user.

Solid English communication skills.

Requirements:
Understanding the architecture of web-driven applications.

Experience interfacing with RESTful APIs.

Understanding of the network stack, especially transport and application layer protocols.

Proficiency manipulating the DOM and handling the components lifecycle.

Building responsive user interfaces.

Experience developing for mobile browsers.

Solid knowledge of Javascript ES6, HTML and Sass.

Nice-to-have:
Understanding of JavaScript optimizations under the V8 engine.

Experience developing Web applications using React, Redux and Webpack.

Knowledge of TypeScript and/or ReasonML.

Experience with WebAssembly.

Full-stack development experience.

Big plus if you worked with Enzyme or Selenium.

What’s in it for you:
Challenging tasks which involve a mix of advanced research and high-quality engineering.

Well-designed management of department, with clear goals focused on tangible results.

Technological education / professional development system.

Competitive salary.

position: HANA Cloud Service (Senior) Developer (f/m/d) - HANA Basis & Store
description:
Requisition ID: 256007
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Location: Berlin or Walldorf, Germany
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Professional
Employment Type: Part time or Regular Full Time

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

SUMMARY:
SAP HANA Core Database Team is looking for experienced (Senior) Developers (f/m/d) to work on HANA Cloud service development projects.

HANA Cloud, first released in March 2020, is the latest and greatest version of HANA as a service offered in Cloud. After 10 years of successful story with HANA in-memory database, we recently re-innovated HANA to offer the best experience in Cloud, named as HANA Cloud. HANA Cloud is being serviced based on Kubernetes and Docker on Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure, currently.
We are looking for talented Cloud service developers (f/m/d) who will start this new journey with us.

THE ROLE:
You will first learn and understand SAP HANA in-memory database internal and key features.
In your project team you will transform selected key features into Cloud micro-services, using the latest Cloud and container technology such as Kubernetes and Docker. The project team will take care of developing, designing, implementing and testing new ideas, customer adoption, operations and end-to-end responsibility.

We are looking for candidates who are committed to a technology career path.

REQUIRED SKILLS:
• Strong analytical skills, ability to structure complex problems, and to do conceptual work
• Experience in cloud platforms, cloud infrastructure and cloud technologies
• Experience in one or more of the following: Go, Java, Python, C++
• Familiar with relational database management systems and experience in SQL
• Very good communication and presentation skills in both German and English
• Ability to work in an international team and be proactive
• Knowledge about and interest in the mindset of DevOps principles
Please make sure your set of application documents contains a cover letter and CV, copies of the obtained degrees and references.

ABOUT THE TEAM:
The SAP HANA Basis & Store team creates the heart of the SAP HANA database engine, SAP’s ground-breaking in-memory, multi-core database platform, which provides a powerful foundation for SAP products in the cloud and on premise.
Being part of the SAP HANA team means constantly driving innovation and working on complex technical challenges every day.
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now!

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.

A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Additional Locations: Walldorf

#SAPHANAcareers

What we're looking for

Passbase's growth has created an opportunity for an ambitious Senior Software Engineer. If you value autonomy and the responsibility that comes with it; if you are keen on learning, experimenting, and learning from failure; if you do not accept low effort and strive to continually improve yourself and your team; if you have a voice and want to use it; if you aspire to help others with your work, then Passbase is for you. We want your expertise to expand on our success and bring Passbase to the next level.

Being a Senior Software Engineer at Passbase means that:

You get concrete end goals with the context, autonomy, and responsibility to achieve. Full autonomy is difficult to navigate, so we offer support for those who strive for it.
You are a master of your trade. We believe that a Senior Engineer should understand how computers and software work; realize that there is no one language or solution for everything; and analyze to make decisions about what is needed to achieve a proper solution.
You maintain high standards. It is easy to be seduced by a fast and dirty solution and we believe it takes character to stand up and remind everyone of our high standards.
You pay it forward. You use your experience and values to help the people around you grow and reach their potential.
You are a believer in our mission to build the identity layer of the internet.
You follow the golden rule. You treat others as equal partners and you want to be treated as an equal partner.
You are humble. We all make mistakes. It is important to accept this from ourselves and others and grow together.

Qualifications
Strong understanding of computer science, software, hardware, data structures and algorithms
5+ years of experience working with Go or other general purpose programming languages
Proven experience with modern microservices and cloud-based architectures
Familiarity with big data and database systems
Passion for high performant services, high availability, reliability, and consistency
The skills to be autonomous: critical thinking and design, confidence and compassion, focus on solutions, knowledge and vision sharing, cooperation and the ability to make decisions with incomplete information
Benefits
A chance to work on one of the most exciting problems of the 21st century
A diverse international team backed by renowned investors
Regular team events
Flexible schedule & work from home opportunities
About Us
We work hard and celebrate our success. Our challenges are vast and creativity is crucial. That means that we divide problems not tasks and emphasize autonomy in the approach. We strive towards a common goal and are all responsible for getting there. From accounting to design, we help each other achieve the best possible results by radical transparency and constant learning. We believe each one of us is a leader at this company and treat our peers accordingly.

If this feels like an environment you could see yourself in, we encourage you to apply and look forward to finding out more about you!
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

position: Senior Software Development Engineer - AWS Billing
description:
Are you interested in building the next generation, cloud-based commerce system for AWS thats used by millions of customers worldwide? Are you excited by the idea of building real-time stream processing systems that operate at Petabyte scale? Do you want to make an impact at a $10-billion-a-year business? Then we need to talk!

Computing AWS bills, at its core, is a challenging, distributed systems problem that requires calculations performed over trillions of usage records, millions of accounts, and hundreds of thousands of different rates. Furthermore, our applications must meet strict requirements for accuracy and once-and-only-once processing.

As a software developer, you have the opportunity to develop a federated billing system that supports new pricing models using cutting edge technologies like Kinesis, DynamoDB, S3, Lambda, and more. Additionally, you will build meaningful software that helps AWS to bring our largest customers over to the Cloud. And finally, as an Amazon engineer, you get to own the full lifecycle of your systems, work on challenging problems at "Amazon Scale", and collaborate with high-performance technical teammates and having fun doing it.

If all of this sounds exciting to you, then please come join us and help shape the future of the Cloud.

Basic Qualifications

· Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree based on 3 years of work experience for every 1 year of education
· 7+ years professional experience in software development
· Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design
· Computer Science fundamentals in data structures
· Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis

Preferred Qualifications

· Strong Java coding skills; you will be able to discuss in depth both the design and your significant contributions to one or more projects using the Java language
· Experience with distributed system performance analysis and optimization
· Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences
· Experience with distributed (multi-tiered) systems, algorithms, and relational databases
· Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions
· Deal well with ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly
Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

position: Software Development Engineer Backend AWS Console Platform
description:
The AWS Console Platform team looks for an experienced engineer, who is passionate about web technologies and building services.

We are the team that runs the platform which serves the user interfaces for all of AWS.
Our mission is to make it as easy as possible for product teams in AWS to serve and deploy their UIs. Our team supported 1.957 service or feature launches in 2018. To allow AWS services to deliver, we dive deep on automation and web technologies.

Your responsibilities will include:
· Innovate and simplify the process of creating user interfaces for all Amazon Web Services.
· Design, implement, and operate new web services on serverless technology.
· Solve problems that span multiple layers of the application.
· Closely collaborate with engineering teams around the globe.
· Automate all the things.
· Research web technology trends.
· Help the team grow professionally.


As an engineer on our team, you'll have the freedom to set the future direction of this platform.

We'd love to see how your solutions will help both AWS customers and AWS service teams build user interfaces even more efficiently.

If you have a passion for how web applications should be built, care about making other developers lives better and want to work with excellent engineers to solve interesting technology problems, you'll fit right in.

Our team is located in the heart of Berlin, Germany.


Basic Qualifications

· 4+ years' experience as a software developer
· Proficiency in at least one programming language, e.g. JavaScript, Java, Python, or Ruby

Preferred Qualifications

· Experience developing customer-facing web services or applications
· Experience operating a service
· Experience communicating technical concepts to a non-technical audience
· Experience working on large projects
· Interest in web browsers and frontend development

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success and we make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, gender, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief.

ABOUT US
Hi. We're Ada. Our app and enterprise solutions are improving human health across the globe. So far, we've helped 10 million people look after themselves, and our partnerships across healthcare continue to convert medical knowledge and clinical accuracy into better health outcomes. Would you consider joining our diverse and inclusive team to improve health outcomes globally? Your work could help millions of people, including yourself: Studies show that having a higher sense of purpose is linked to a longer, healthier life.

ABOUT THE ROLE
We're looking for a Web Developer to join our Marketing Department's Website Team to create and maintain our landing pages for mobile and desktop, with a strong focus on web performance and accessibility.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Build user interfaces and prototypes from wireframes and design templates

Ensure our marketing websites are developed following accessibility best practices

Good experience dealing with front-end code consuming data from APIs
Experience working on editorial-driven websites
Experience working on e-commerce sites or with payment platforms is a plus
Building projects mobile-first and progressively enhancing are web development essentials for you
Ability to write simple, expressive, extensible code you prefer deleting code than writing code and to quickly ship software that works
Fluent in English, spoken and written

BENEFITS
Work with a high level of autonomy in global, cross-functional teams with smart, purpose-driven peers
Perks include complimentary onsite German language classes, discounted Urban Sports Club memberships, quarterly team bonding activities, regular social events, and healthy office refreshments
CONTACT
We are looking forward to receiving your application. For further information please contact our Senior Talent Acquisition Manager Ahmet Kivrak at any time at ahmet.kivrak@ada.com.

Onetool is the centralized place for companies to subscribe to the software they need to operate their business. One membership, one billing, and one centralized login and admin dashboard. We want to enable small- and medium-sized companies to outcompete large corporate giants by giving them access to the absolute best software out there. Be part of the mission to empower these startups and businesses of up to 1,000 employees!

You will integrate webservices to our system

You have basic experience with relational databases (i.e. MySQL)

Excellent written and verbal English skills are required, German skills are a plus
What we offer
Real responsibility at a super young startup. Be among the very first employees
Challenging internship in a dynamic, fast paced and collaborative environment
Steep learning curve as you learn directly from our experienced co-founders and gain them as mentors
The opportunity to get hired after the internship as one of the first employees
Real startup garage feeling where everybody in the team counts!

Wenn es darum geht, zukünftig Millionen Fahrgäste und tausende Züge auch digital auf den Weg zu bringen, braucht es die besten IT-Experten. 8.000 haben wir schon, aber längst nicht genug. Als Projektleiter, Berater, Entwickler oder IT-Architekt ist jetzt die spannendste Zeit einzusteigen und in einem starken Team wegweisende Lösungen und Großprojekte in den Bereichen Mobilität, Infrastruktur und Logistik umzusetzen.

Gemeinsam mit Deinem Team bist Du für die Entwicklung von Mobilitätslösungen von morgen verantwortlich. Dabei leistest Du einen entscheidenden Erfolgsbeitrag mit der Gestaltung einer innovativen User Experience für unsere Kunden und arbeitest an spannenden Produkten wie zum Beispiel Bonvoyo - Dem Mobilitätsbudget der Deutschen Bahn.
Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir Dich als Full Stack Web Developer für die Deutsche Bahn Connect GmbH an den Standorten Halle (Saale) und Berlin.

Deine Aufgaben:

Als Web Developer liegt die Weiterentwicklung und Pflege verschiedener Web-Frontends und -Infrastrukturen in Deinen Händen
Hierfür arbeitest Du produktbezogen und im engen Austausch mit Entwicklerteams, dem Produktmanagement bzw. -Design sowie dem Vertriebsteam zusammen
In dieser Schnittstellenfunktion sorgst dafür, die Anforderungen Deiner (internen) Stakeholder auf einen Nenner zu bringen und fachübergreifende Synergien zu schaffen
Ohne sauberen Code, ohne Dich? Die Sicherstellung der Code Qualität gewährleistest Du u.a. durch XP-Practices
Dir obliegt die Erstellung von Demos und Proof of Concepts zur Evaluierung neuer Technologien

Dein Profil:

Du verfügst über einen (Fach-) Hochschulabschluss in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Als Web Developer bist Du seit mind. 2 Jahren im agilen Umfeld (Scrum / Kanban) unterwegs und besitzt fundierte Erfahrung mit Contentmanagementsystemen (z.B. Pimcore, Typo) sowie Responsive Design
Kenntnisse in der Backend-Anbindung auf Basis von REST APIs, in skalierenden Testframeworks und der Arbeit mit Docker-Containern bringst Du ebenfalls mit
Du bist fit in Vue.JS, CSS3, HTML5, Symfony 4+, Pimcore 6, PHP7 und idealerweise Git
Wünschenswert sind auch Erfahrungen mit Continuous Integration / Deployment sowie dem Continuous Automated Testing
Neben Deinem technischen Know-how zeichnest Du Dich durch Dein abstraktes und analytisches Denkvermögen sowie eine lösungsorientierte und strukturierte Vorgehensweise aus
Es stellt für Dich kein Problem dar, an ca. 2 Tagen in der Woche an unserem weiteren Standort in Halle (Saale) (fußläufig zum Hauptbahnhof) tätig zu sein

Benefits:
Du schaffst Großes und bekommst nicht weniger zurück: ein marktübliches Gehaltspaket mit i.d.R. unbefristeten Arbeitsverträgen und Beschäftigungssicherung sowie vielfältige Nebenleistungen und eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge.
Gezielte und individuelle Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten auf Fach-, Projekt- oder Führungsebene geben Dir eine langfristige Perspektive.
Wir unterstützen Dich bei der Suche nach Kitaplätzen oder Ferienbetreuung für Deine Kinder. Außerdem kannst Du Auszeiten für die Pflege von Angehörigen oder Sabbaticals nehmen. Je nach Job ist eine flexible Gestaltung von Arbeitszeit/-ort möglich.

Chancengleichheit und selbstbestimmte Teilhabe Schwerbehinderter und Gleichgestellter sowie eine respektvolle Zusammenarbeit sind innerhalb des DB Konzerns fest verankerte Grundsätze. Deshalb werden schwerbehinderte Bewerber bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt berücksichtigt.

Hundreds of millions of customers. Billions of queries per year and dollars in revenue. The scale and impact of Amazon search is HUGE and we need smart and creative engineers to imagine and develop innovative cross-device features to realize the future of product search worldwide.

The Search Customer Experience team is responsible for worldwide customer facing search features on desktops, tablets, and mobile devices. Everything from the moment a customer clicks into the search box to when they view search results. We use data mining and usability data to develop new features and we test them through hundreds of A/B experiments a year as well as data mining and usability studies. This immense amount of data allows us to leverage machine learning to build smarter and more personalized experiences for our customers across a wide variety of categories, from instant video and Kindle books to apparel and electronics.

On a day-to-day basis, you'll be part of a small, close-knit team of engineers that are agile, data driven, and highly collaborative. You'll help analyze customer behavior, propose ideas and solutions during sprint planning with your team, implement big ideas, and then measure the results. Engineers on our team have proposed ideas that have impacted millions of customers and generated millions of dollars in revenue.

Our team is responsible for architecting and building the platform that renders search result pages. We optimize for speed and developer productivtiy: 100s of engineers work on the platform and every millisecond counts. The platform we build directly impacts what features can or can't be built for customers. The team focuses on both the rendering and service layers of the architecture, trying to figure out the best way to organize and return data from upstream dependencies and how to render that data as quickly as possible. The work we do involves tackling a number of large-scale architectural problems while collaborating with senior engineers across the organization.

You should be a well-rounded software engineer, with expertise in building large-scale web applications and/or low-latency services, optimized for performance. You should love challenges and working on large-scale, customer facing projects.


Basic Qualifications

· Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field
· 4+ years professional experience in software development
· Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design
· Computer Science fundamentals in data structures
· Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis
· Proficiency in, at least, one modern programming language such as C, C++, Java, Javascript

Preferred Qualifications

· Candidates must be innovative, creative, flexible and self-motivated, with the ability to design and write high-performance, reliable, and maintainable code
· Successful candidates will have a strong background in an object-oriented language such as Java and experience building large scale web applications
· Strong desire to improve our customer's search experience a must
· Experience with Scrum or Agile development a plus
· Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
· Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project
· Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs

position: Senior Software Engineer (Java / Python / Scala) für Digitale Schiene Deutschland" (w/m/d)
description:
Du willst an einem historisch einmaligen Vorhaben mitwirken und Deutschlands Bahnbetrieb in die digitale Zukunft begleiten? Hier kannst Du es als Senior Software Engineer wirst Du zum Treiber für innovative Lösungen und erhältst eine einzigartige Chance: Du gestaltest Dein Thema von der Konzeption bis zur Umsetzung und baust zeitgleich einen der zukunftsweisendsten Bereiche in der Geschichte des Schienenverkehrs auf. Jetzt ist die spannendste Zeit einzusteigen!

Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir Dich für das Konzernprogramm Digitale Schiene Deutschland im Bereich Digitaler Bahnbetrieb bei der DB Netz AG in Berlin.

Deine Aufgaben:

Du entwickelst den Prototypen eines echtzeitfähiges Verkehrssteuerungssystems, das existierende Optimierer basierend auf künstlicher Intelligenz und/oder mathematischer Optimierung integriert
Als Teil eines interdisziplinären Teams aus Softwareentwicklern, Mathematikern, KI-Spezialisten und Bahnexperten verbesserst Du kontinuierlich das Produkt, die APIs und den Entwicklungsprozess
Du implementierst reaktive Back-End-Systeme in Scala und/oder Java mit automatisiertem Deployment auf Kubernetes (OpenShift)
Für Front-Ends integrierst Du existierende Python-Bibliotheken zu einem interaktiven Nutzerinterface
Du übernimmst Verantwortung für das Produkt und entwickelst es in einem agilen Entwicklungsprozess schnell und lösungsorientiert weiter

Dein Profil:

Dein Studium in Informatik oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung hast Du erfolgreich abgeschlossen
Du hast mindestens 4 Jahre Erfahrung in der professionellen Software-Entwicklung in Java bzw. Scala und idealerweise auch in Python
Du hast Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von verteilten Systemen bzw. Microservices unter Benutzung von Orchestrierungstools wie Kubernetes und Messaging-Middleware wie Kafka, NATS oder RabbitMQ
Die Ideen hinter ereignisgesteuerten Architekturen, CQRS und Event-Sourcing hast Du verstanden, idealerweise auch schon damit gearbeitet
Wenn Du darüber hinaus über exzellente Englischkenntnisse verfügst, bist Du bei uns genau richtig!

Nutze jetzt Deine Chance und gehe als Pionier neue Wege! Bei uns bekommst Du die Möglichkeit, in einem Team aus Top-Experten mit führenden Playern der Industrie zu kooperieren und einen der technologisch spannendsten Bereiche zu prägen. Dabei arbeitest Du in der Atmosphäre eines Startups und genießt dennoch alle Vorzüge eines Großkonzerns.

Benefits:
Du schaffst Großes und bekommst nicht weniger zurück: ein marktübliches Gehaltspaket mit i.d.R. unbefristeten Arbeitsverträgen und Beschäftigungssicherung sowie vielfältige Nebenleistungen und eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge.
Faszinierende Projekte und Aufgaben bei einem der vielfältigsten Arbeitgeber des Landes fordern Dein Können und warten auf Deine Handschrift.
Wir bieten Vergünstigungen im öffentlichen Nahverkehr wie z.B. ein Job-Ticket für den täglichen Arbeitsweg.

Chancengleichheit und selbstbestimmte Teilhabe Schwerbehinderter und Gleichgestellter sowie eine respektvolle Zusammenarbeit sind innerhalb des DB Konzerns fest verankerte Grundsätze. Deshalb werden schwerbehinderte Bewerber bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt berücksichtigt.

With us you can shape the future of the catering industry. We develop complex web applications for companies in the catering trade, from cash register systems to web shops. We want to realize our exciting and trend-setting ideas for the gastronomy with you.

Tasks

PHP-Expert
Golang very welcome,
very experienced SQL (MySQL, Amazon Aurora)

relaxed familiar team

free choice of workplace and attractive office in Berlin Schöneberg

At ResearchGate, we connect the world of science and make research open to all.

Accelerating science is what drives us –we've built a platform that gives the world's scientists the tools and services they need to connect, collaborate, and advance their research. Over 17 million members from 193 countries use ResearchGate to share, discover, and discuss research.

Our investors include Bill Gates, Benchmark Capital, Founders Fund, Tenaya Capital, Goldman Sachs, Wellcome Trust and Four Rivers Group.

We are a global company, with clients, users and colleagues from all corners of the world. Our team of 175 people is located at the heart of Berlin, one of the most exciting cities in the world –a place where everyone feels welcome.

Working with us offers you the chance to use your knowledge and technical expertise to change science for the better, and you'll be doing it as part of a dynamic team that hails from all over the globe.

The position

Are you passionate about online advertising technologies and want to make a difference?

Do you want to use your skills and experience to do something great?

As an Architect for Ads at ResearchGate, you will work in a team of specialists whose goal is to leverage the traffic on our platform and offer integrated advertising campaigns solutions to our customers, while enriching the online experience of the researchers by presenting them with content targeted to their specific interests. Put your creative problem-solving and technical skills into action and make a positive impact on science and society.

Responsibilities

Your responsibilities in this role would include:
• Assume ownership and responsibility for your technical area and continuously improve it by anticipating the industry trends
• Own build vs. buy decisions when it comes to ad technology
• Cooperate and coordinate with other Technical Leaders, Product Managers, Ad Ops, go-to-market teams (Direct Sales, Mid-Market, Programmatic) and relevant stakeholders to define, develop and execute a clear technical strategy to set ResearchGate up for the future and achieve collective objectives within agreed upon timeline
• Support evaluating feasibility of validated product solutions
• Manage relationships with third-party providers together with your Engineering Manager and Product Lead
• Provide technical leadership, influence, partner with and help develop fellow Technical Leaders in the online advertising area to architect, design and build robust solutions that withstands scale and availability while reducing operational overhead
• Increase speed of development for ad products through advising on the right approaches to build solutions
• Support with coaching of technical ICs (Ad Ops, Software Engineers) to ensure that knowledge and expertise is best in class
• Support in the hiring of new talents with ad tech industry experience
• Work with highly skilled cross-functional software development teams in an agile development process

Requirements

To be successful in the role of Architect for Ads at ResearchGate you should bring:
• 5+ years of experience designing, building, integrating and monitoring technical solutions for online advertising (ad server, DMP, programmatic, analytics, CMP, emails)
• Strong experience in software engineering and software architecture
• Deep knowledge of Google Ad Manager
• Experience in a company where advertising is a main revenue stream
• Advanced targeting concepts, such as retargeting and look-a-like audiences
• Strong analytical skills, including the ability to define problems, collect & analyze data and generate valuable insights
• - Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills
• Very good command of spoken and written English

Nice-to-haves

• Experience with content marketing
• Working knowledge of our web technologies JavaScript (React), PHP and CSS, GraphQL
• Know-how of NoSQL databases (MongoDB, HBase), relational databases and query authoring (SQL)
• Design and operation of robust distributed systems using technologies like Kafka, Hadoop, Hive, and Flink
• Experience in designing and implementing data pipelines and ML applications
• Experience with agile product-development processes

Your profile

• You excel at communicating objectives as well as complex technical concepts
• You are a natural at consensus building and rapid decision making in technology assessments
• You work proactively to structure and organize your projects
• You enjoy working with great people in an open-office environment
• You understand our mission and want to help us achieve it
Environment

You'll be working in a fast-paced environment where code is written, tested and shipped continuously. Our engineering team is passionate about building maintainable, scalable web applications that are constantly optimized to meet the needs of our users –17+ million researchers worldwide.

Our hiring process is uncomplicated. You'll be interviewed by the people you'll be working with, so you can quickly find out if the role suits you best and start making an impact.

We’re changing science and catalyzing discovery, every day. Get to know more about our mission and what ResearchGate members are achieving by checking out our blog at https://www.researchgate.net/blog.

Creative Developer (m/f/x)

Position: fest oder frei
Beginn: sofort

Als Creative Developer (m/w/x) arbeitest du eng mit dem UX- und Visual Design-Team zusammen. Du entwickelst Best-in-Class-Frontends für Marken-Websites und webbasierte Software-Anwendungen sowie Protoypen für Design Fictions und Anwendungen für Generative Gestaltungsprojekte.

Als Creative Developer bist du nicht auf eine Backend- oder Frontend-Technologie festgelegt. Auch wenn dein Schwerpunkt im Web Development liegt, bist du offen für neue Technologien und bereit, dich mit neuen Aufgaben vertraut zu machen. Du hast die Möglichkeit – und die Aufgabe – das Tech Stack für think moto aktiv weiterzuentwickeln. Unser Stack besteht derzeit aus: Frontend: HTML/CSS/Javascript/PHP; Backend: WordPress, kirby, Webflow; VR/AR: Unity; Conversational: Cognigy.AI, DialogFlow; Generatives Design: Processing und Javascript). Wir haben eine interne Initiative zu Design mit KI gestartet und beabsichtigen RunwayML, TensorFlow, ml5JS zu verwenden.

Was wir erwarten:
Frontend-Entwicklung von anspruchsvollen Layouts und UX-Mustern für dynamische Websites, Microsites und webbasierte Anwendungen
Entwicklung von interaktiven Prototypen und Proof-of-Concepts
Kreative Kodierung für generative, datengesteuerte Entwurfsprojekte
Unterstützung der Designer bei unterschiedlichen Projekten wie Chatbot oder Virtual Reality
Aktives Entwickeln des think moto-Tech-Stacks
Du bist ein aktives Teammitglied in integrierten Design-Sprints
Du arbeitest in Projekten mit internationalen Teamkollegen und Kunden auf Deutsch und Englisch
Was du mitbringst:


Du verfügst über fundierte Kenntnisse und praktische Erfahrung mit HTML, CSS, PHP, JavaScript
Du hast mindestens 4 Jahre Programmiererfahrung
Bachelor oder Master in Informatik, Medientechnologie oder ähnlichen Studien
Erfahrung in der professionellen Anwendung von WordPress, Kirby und/oder anderen leichten CMS
Erfahrung im Umgang mit Frameworks: ReactJS, AngularJS... (Du kennst deinen Stack besser als wir, also erzähl uns davon!)
Engagement für die kontinuierliche Optimierung unserer Teamprozesse und unseres Technologiestacks
Du schätzt gute UX und Benutzerfreundlichkeit und weißt, worauf es bei der Implementierung von reaktionsfähigen Layouts ankommt
Du hast eine hohe Affinität zum Design und den Wunsch nach einer engen Zusammenarbeit mit Designern
Eigenverantwortung und Qualitätsbewusstsein
Du bringst bereits in der Konzeptionsphase des Projekts eigene Ideen und Vorschläge aktiv ein.
Zuverlässigkeit, Kommunikations- und Organisationsfähigkeiten
Was dich erwartet:


Eine wichtige Rolle in einem kleinen, aber sehr ausgewählten Team von talentierten und inspirierenden Persönlichkeiten
Sinnvolle Arbeit, die aktiv die Grenzen dessen verschiebt, was Design und Technologie in einer sich schnell verändernden Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft leisten können
Eine respektvolle und wertschätzende Teamkultur, die das persönliche Wachstum des Einzelnen fördert
Ein ausgezeichnetes und anspruchsvolles Kundenportfolio mit einer perfekten Mischung aus Blue Chips, mittelständischen Unternehmen und Start-ups und einem sorgfältig ausgewählten Partnernetzwerk
Wir teilen unser Wissen innerhalb des Teams und bieten zahlreiche interne und externe Schulungsmöglichkeiten; Treffen und Seminare in der think moto Academy
Eine respektvolle und wertschätzende Teamkultur, die eine steile persönliche Lernkurve nährt
Ein modernes Büro im Zentrum von Berlin mit gesunden Snacks, Obst und Getränken
Regelmäßige Teamveranstaltungen (Teamfrühstück, Cine Moto (in einem echten Kino), Inside Moto, Workshop im Wald...)
Wettbewerbsfähiges Gehalt und betriebliche Altersversorgung
Klingt nach dir? Dann schick uns bitte deine vollständige Bewerbung in Deutsch oder Englisch mit Lebenslauf, einem Portfolio deiner besten Arbeiten, dem frühestmöglichen Starttermin sowie deiner Gehaltsvorstellung an bewerbung@thinkmoto.de (E-Mail: bewerbung@thinkmoto.de ).

Über uns

LIQID ist eine digitale Vermögensverwaltung, die privaten Geldanlegern Zugang zu Anlagestrategien und Konditionen bietet, die bisher allein Hochvermögenden offenstanden. Unsere globalen Anlagestrategien werden von HQ Trust, dem Multi Family Office der Familie Harald Quandt, entwickelt. LIQID wird von einem international erfahrenen Management-Team geführt. Zu den Investoren gehören die in London ansässige Investmentgesellschaft Toscafund Asset Management, Project A Ventures, eine führende Berliner Risikokapitalgesellschaft, HQ Trust und Dieter von Holtzbrinck Ventures.
Private Banking im 21. Jahrhundert bedeutet: Überlegenes Know-how kombiniert mit effizienten Prozessen für die optimale Rendite. Private Banking im 21. Jahrhundert bedeutet: LIQID.


Deine Herausforderung


We are looking for an Software Engineering Manager/ Lead (m/f/d) to drive our engineering vision, tech strategy and to lead and develop our engineering teams at LIQID (Frontend, Backend and DevOps). In collaboration with our Product Team and other stakeholders you will be accountable for increasing alignment and delivering products and projects from an engineering perspective. You will own process, budget and timeframe topics to ensure success for the company. Wealth management experience or relevant fintech experience is preferred but not required for the right candidate – however, being an analytical communicator with high standards and empathy to empower others is.

What to expect:
You’ll oversee your team’s quality of work and empower them as their coach and mentor, providing strong leadership, inspiration and thoughtful guidance
You’ll be responsible for hiring and training new engineering team members
You develop an understanding of our business in order to drive technical innovation
You’ll be available to answer questions and resolve issues that come from the engineering team and other stakeholders
You’ll oversee R&D initiatives to identify new opportunities for LIQID
You’ll be responsible for managing and collaborating with contractors and other vendors
You’ll be able to create and deliver presentations on LIQID’s engineering strategy to both internal and external stakeholders

Unsere Erwartungen
You have 6+ years of experience in engineering and some management experience
You have the leadership skills necessary to manage and develop a successfully functioning engineering team
You have an analytical mind and business acumen
You are able to evaluate and solve complex problems
You can display the project management skills to keep projects on track and the engineering team delivering
You can analyze and choose the correct option when it comes to build or buy
You have expert knowledge of Javascript and several years of professional experience with Node.js, experience with GraphQL is a plus

Du bist interessiert? Dann kontaktiere uns!

Please submit your CV and/or portfolio directly by clicking the “Apply now”-Button. For all HR related questions before and during the application process feel free to contact our People Team (careers@liqid.de).

Wir bieten
An innovative company with award winning services that is growing fast and offers a lot of opportunity for having an impact and growing professionally
An internationally experienced leadership team, supported by experienced investors and a high class advisory board
A culture of excellence paired with a cooperative mindset and an attitude of finding new and innovative solutions
State of the art equipment
An intercultural team with diverse mindsets and background
Free drinks, subsidized lunch, frequent team events as well as a very competitive salary

Interested in building a new product?


Safe deposit boxes have been a niche product for centuries. With growing distrust in the financial system, banks and political systems, we see a great potential in keeping physical assets protected. DIGITAL. SECURE. DISCRET. INDEPENDENT.

As part of the WeQ group, you will join one of our new ventures in the early growing phase and have a big impact on technical decisions and product development. You will engineer the infrastructure to manage our vaults and deposit boxes in facilities all over the world. The focus will be on building a cloud solution as safe as the vaults.

Join our lab of deep divers, a small multidisciplinary agile team of accomplished engineers with a focus on smart algorithms, secure infrastructure and process automation - all combined with latest technologies and no restrictions like banks have.

What we expect from you
You set up and secure our infrastructure, entry-points and data storage like a digital vault
Constantly improve, update and optimize servers, databases & queues
Be accountable for best practices in terms of security, resiliency, monitoring and alerting
Mentoring developers and support them to set up their needed pipelines and systems
Work in an agile environment and contribute your ideas to continuously improve our products, processes, and tools
Team up with talented developers, learn as much as you can, apply your expertise to build great products - and have fun while doing so!
What we are looking for:


3+ years experience as a DevOps Engineer
7+ years experience in IT related fields
Expert experience with cloud networks, microservice architecture and highly available systems
Strong preference of security related topics from development life cycles to network intrusion
Good experience implementing centralized monitoring, logging, and alerting
Experience of threat modelling and risk assessment techniques
Experience with security-related certifications is a plus
A strong sense of ownership and working in a fast-paced company developing its innovative product
Our technology stack


AWS, Terraform, Kubernetes, Docker, Kafka, PostgreSQL, Java, GraphQL, ReactJS and more to choose

Perks awaiting you
Join an international and thriving team of innovation-drivers spanning all continents and grow alongside the brightest minds in the industry.
Our cool office is in a hip Berlin neighborhood with access to lots of amenities. We provide top-notch workstations with the latest hardware, software, and OS of your choice.
We ensure that your move to Berlin goes as smoothly as possible by offering relocation and visa support to help you settle comfortably into your new city.
We offer comprehensive health insurance at home or during your business travels, and keep you hydrated and nourished with a selection of drinks, fruits and snacks.
We support your growth with intensive on-boarding, quarterly reviews, hands-on mentoring from your manager and internal knowledge-sharing initiatives.
Enjoy 24/7 access to e-learning tools to improve your business, creative and tech skills.
We're all about community and collaboration! Mingle with your peers at our breakfasts, lunches, summer BBQs, Pub Quizzes, Cocktail Nights and many more events.
Everyone is welcome to apply! We strive to achieve equality and diversity in the workplace, as a means of working together and achieving success. Our recruitment process solely based on merit, qualification and business needs. It does not discriminate against gender, race or religion.

Für unseren Standort in Berlin sind wir auf der Suche nach einem

(Senior) System / DevOps Engineer (m/w/d)

„DevOps is not a goal, but a never-ending process of continual improvement“ Jez Humble

Als System Engineer bei Neofonie unterstützt Du mit deinem fundierten Fachwissen im Betrieb von modernen IT-Installationen die Entwicklerteams bei der Neuentwicklung und Weiterentwicklung unserer Kundenplattformen. Mit Deinem Team verbesserst Du kontinuierlich den gesamten Software Lifecycle und erstellst Prozessautomatisierungen. Der Einsatz der DevOps Tools variiert dabei von Kunde zu Kunde und ermöglicht uns eine transparente Zusammenarbeit, schnellere Releases und kürzere Problemlösungszeiten.

Deine Aufgaben

Du bist zuständig für die Definition und Realisierung nicht-funktionaler Anforderungen
Du berätst und unterstützt unsere Entwicklungsteams beim Entwurf und der Umsetzung des Gesamtsystems (System-Architektur)
Du automatisierst in vielen Ausprägungen (Continous Delivery/Deployment)
Du führst in Zusammenarbeit mit QA Performance,- Last und Stabilitätstest durch und analysierst diese
Du bist verantwortlich für die Abnahme, Freigabe, Vorbereitung und Installation von Releases
Du implementierst notwendige Komponenten für den Betrieb (z.B. Überwachungsskripte)
Im Projektkontext arbeitest Du als System Engineer (DevOps)
Du kannst unsere Kunden hinsichtlich Container-Technologien beraten

Dein Profil

Du hast viele Jahre Berufserfahrung als System Engineer in einem DevOps Umfeld
Du kennst Dich im Cloud Umfeld (AWS oder Google Cloud) aus und hast Erfahrungen mit Docker und Kubernetes
Du hast solide Programmierkenntnisse in den einschlägigen Shell- und Skriptsprachen (z.B. Bash, Perl, Python)
Auch Load Balancer (z.B. HAProxy) und Caching-Mechanismen (z.B. Varnish, Squid, mod_cache) hast Du schon verwendet
Du kennst Dich mit Release- und Build-Prozessen, sowie Incident- und Problem-Management aus
Du hast Erfahrung bei der Installation und Konfiguration von Nagios, Apache httpd, Tomcat und MySQL (oder vergleichbaren Technologien)
Du sprichst fließend Deutsch und Englisch

Unser Angebot

Unbefristete Festanstellung mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum und Abwechslung
Vielseitige und anspruchsvolle IT Projekte für namhafte Kunden
Weiterentwicklung eigener Stärken und Karriereperspektiven
Moderne IT-Infrastruktur und breites Spektrum an Technologien
Sehr gutes Arbeitsklima mit kompetenten und sympathischen Kollegen
Gesunde Work-Life-Balance durch flexible Arbeitszeiten, einem Überstundenkonto und einem 1:1 Freizeitausgleich (Reisezeit ist Arbeitszeit und wird Dir entsprechend gutgeschrieben)
Ein modernes Büro in zentraler Lage am Berliner Hauptbahnhof
Add-Ons: Eltern-Kind-Büro, Mitgliedschaft Urban Sports Club, Dachterrasse, Kicker, Newbie-Brunch sowie Vergünstigungen, kostenfreie Getränke (Kaffee, Tee, Wasser, Softdrinks), Sport-, Team- und Firmenevents, etc.
Die Berliner Digitalagentur Neofonie entwickelt individuelle Lösungen in den Bereichen Mobile, Commerce, Content Management und Künstliche Intelligenz. Neofonie bietet Beratung, Design und Entwicklung aus einer Hand. Zu den Kunden zählen u.a. Jägermeister, HUK-COBURG, Bechtle, Gruner+Jahr und Wort&Bild Verlag. Laut Internetagentur-Ranking zählt Neofonie zu den fünfzig größten Fullservice-Agenturen bundesweit und zu den Top 20 für E-Commerce und Top 20 für mobile Lösungen. Neofonie wurde 1998 mit der Entwicklung der ersten deutschen Suchmaschine, Fireball, als Spin-Off der TU Berlin gegründet.

Wenn Du Interesse hast unser Team zu bereichern, freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung (es reicht auch, wenn Du uns zunächst nur Deinen CV oder Dein Xing/LinkedIn Profil mit Deinen Gehaltsvorstellungen zusendest).

Wir freuen uns auf Deine Kontaktaufnahme!

position: Python Web Developer / ERP-Softwareentwickler Odoo (m/w/d) Datenschutzerklärung für das Bewerbungsverfahren
description:
Python Web Developer / ERP-Softwareentwickler Odoo (m/w/d)

felix1.de hat sich zum Ziel gesetzt, das Thema Steuern für seine Mandanten so einfach wie möglich zu machen. Hochmotiviert arbeitet das felix1.de-Team stetig an neuen Steuerberatungsangeboten und innovativen Online-Anwendungen, die sowohl moderne Unternehmer als auch Privatpersonen überzeugen.

Als Tochtergesellschaft der ETL-Gruppe, welche in Deutschland mit über 870 Kanzleien Marktführer im ­Bereich Steuerberatung ist, greift felix1.de auf über 45 Jahre Erfahrung und eine professionelle Infrastruktur zurück. Dazu gehören ein eigenes Rechenzentrum in Saarbrücken, regelmäßige Weiterbildungsveranstaltungen, Branchenspezialisierungen und vieles mehr.

Für unsere Steuerberatungskanzlei in Berlin suchen wir einen

Python Web Developer / ERP-Softwareentwickler Odoo (m/w/d)

Weiterentwicklung unseres Kundenbetreuungs-Systems (Odoo) vom Konzept bis hin zur konkreten Entwicklung im Frontend und Backend (Full Stack)
Erstellung neuer Odoo-Module
Schaffung von Schnittstellen zu Drittsystemen wie bspw. Salesforce und Drupal
Eigenverantwortliche Projektplanung und Projektcontrolling in Bezug auf Umfang, Zeit und Budget

Ausgebildeter IT-Spezialist (m/w/d), gern mit erfolgreich abgeschlossenem Studium im Bereich Informatik oder einem anderen technischen Bereich
Fundierte Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung basierend auf der Programmiersprache Python
Eigeninitiative und selbstständiges Arbeiten nach den Prinzipien der agilen Softwareentwicklung (bspw. Scrum)
Erfahrung bei der Entwicklung in Teams
Gern Erfahrung mit weiteren Programmiersprachen
Unser Angebot
Anspruchsvolle und verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben sowie tolle Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten

Flexible Arbeitszeitregelungen
