position: Fullstack Java Developer (w/m/d) Baufinanzierungs-Unit im Berliner Fintech
description:
Hast du Spaß am Entwickeln von modernen und einfachen Lösungen? Packst du auch gerne mit an, wenn es komplizierter wird? Perfekt! Wir kümmern uns um das Baufinanzierungsangebot von Morgen bei Europace.

Wer sind wir?

Ein ein kleines, vollfunktionales Team innerhalb der über 100 Leute umfassenden Baufinanzierungsunit. Wir sind einerseits ein Teil der erfolgreichen Europace-Produktfamilie und andererseits in einem cloud-basierten Greenfield-Setup unterwegs. Mit der Unterstützung von KI werden wir den Marktstandard für die schnellste und einfachste Baufinanzierung entwickeln.

Wir freuen uns auf dich - come as you are!

Wie sehen deine Aufgaben bei uns aus?

Du entwickelst: Neue Features entwickelst du in einer nutzerzentrierten Vorgehensweise und behälst den Überblick über das Gesamtsystem.

Du integrierst: Europace als Plattform lebt von der Integration neuer Funktionalitäten über Services. Du bringst deine Erfahrung in der Anbindung von APIs ein und denkst in Standard-APIs.

Du betreibst: Nach der Implementierung hört dein Job nicht auf. Du hast schon bei der Entwicklung den Betrieb im Blick und stellst diesen auch weiterhin sicher.

Du bringst dich ein: Du bist Sparrings-Partner auch in sehr frühen Phasen der Produktentwicklung und schon bei der Konzeption neuer Funktionalitäten mit dabei.

Du bringst uns weiter: Du trägst dazu bei, dass wir als Team immer besser werden. Wir entwickeln nicht nur Code, sondern auch uns selbst.

Was erwarten wir von dir?

Einfachheit: Du strebst nach einfachen und übersichtlichen Lösungen. Dabei helfen dir deine berufliche Erfahrung und dein Interesse an Open Source.

Überblick: Dir fällt es leicht, einen Schritt zurück zu machen und zu hinterfragen, ob Dinge zielführend sind, ohne das Ziel aus den Augen zu verlieren.

Kommunikationsstarker Teamplayer: Du bist mit Herz und Seele Teamplayer. Du formulierst klar und verständlich, bist zudem offen und gehst auch auf andere Teams zu, um gemeinsam die bestmögliche Lösung zu erreichen.

Interesse und Lernbereitschaft: Dein Interesse hilft dir mit deiner schnellen Auffassungsgabe rasch neue Themen zu adaptieren. Außerdem engagierst du dich, bringst dich ein und bist motiviert uns voranzubringen.

Kenntnisse: Du bringst mehrere Jahre Erfahrung in Java und Spring (Boot) mit. Kenntnisse in AWS, CDK, Typescript und Angular sind von Vorteil.

Du hast Spaß daran, in einem Team nach agilen Methoden zu arbeiten. Unser Team wendet ScrumBan an.

Was dich bei uns erwartet?

Selbstorganisation: Bei uns gibt es kein Micro-Management und keine klassischen Hierarchien. Du hast Raum zum Gestalten und Wirken. Mit der Holakratie haben wir eine Innovative Arbeitskultur und eine offene sowie wertschätzende Kultur geschaffen. Wir setzen Vertrauen in dich und deine Entscheidungen.

Cross-Functional: Product Owner, Business Analysten, Developer, Data Scientists, UX, Designer und Key Account Manager arbeiten an der Anwendung bei uns auf Augenhöhe.

Teamplay: Echtes Miteinander im Team mit freundlichen Kolleginnen, sowie gegenseitiger Respekt & Wertschätzung und ein hohes Maß an sozialer Kompetenz erwarten dich. Dir wird eine Mentorin zur Seite gestellt, um dir einen optimalen Start zu ermöglichen.

Fehlerkultur: Wir gehen offen mit unseren Fehlern um und nutzen sie als Chance um zu lernen.

Flexibilität: Flexibles Arbeiten im Office oder Remote - du hast die Wahl. Ist die Betreuung deines Kindes nicht möglich, kannst du neben Home-Office gerne auch unser Kids-Office nutzen.

Innovation Time: Du hast viele Möglichkeiten deine Innovationskraft zu nutzen und dich weiterzuentwickeln. Neben dem Einbringen in das Produkt, kannst du auch eigene Projekte, Wissenstage, Exploration Days, Meetups, Konferenzen und vieles mehr nutzen.

Ach ja, wer sind wir?

Wir verbinden Wünsche mit Banken. Die Europace AG ist ein Tochterunternehmen der Hypoport Gruppe. Wir kombinieren 20 Jahre Erfahrung am Markt mit 20 Mrd. EUR Transaktionsvolumen im Q1 2020 (!) und gehen mit Start-up Feeling und Investments in die nächste Version von Europace. Bist du dabei?

FinTech: Wir sind Deutschlands größter Finanzmarktplatz für Immobilienfinanzierungen, Bausparprodukte und Privatkredite. Wir gestalten und bewegen Märkte und befinden uns auf einer stetigen Mission für den Verbraucher.

B2B2C: Wir sind B2B und denken B2C. Wir bringen Banken und Berater zusammen, um für den Verbraucher den einfachsten Zugang zu den besten Finanzierungen zu schaffen.

Mehr Informationen dazu, wie wir hier arbeiten bekommst du auch auf unserem EUROPACE-Blog und PnO-Blog.

Wir verwenden die weibliche Form von geschlechterspezifischen Bezeichnungen und meinen damit jeweils alle Geschlechter.
Und jetzt?

Wenn wir dein Interesse geweckt haben, dann freuen wir uns auf deine Beweggründe und auf deine Bewerbung. Bitte mit Gehaltsvorstellung und möglichem Starttermin. Auch wenn du nicht alle unsere Anforderungen bereits komplett erfüllst, würden wir uns über deine Bewerbung freuen.

Bei Fragen wende dich gern an Romina:

Romina Sievert
People & Organisation Partner
Tel. +49 151-58045543

Hypoport SE
Heidestraße 8
10557 Berlin

position: C++ Software Engineer with experience in Connectivity (all genders)
description:
MBition, MercedesBenz is bringing the automotive industry into the future. How?

We are building a new generation of infotainment platform that is reusable and hardware agnostic, as well as its implementation into our actual car lines. We are building the very interface that future drivers will engage with when they sit in their car, plan their journey or choose what music to listen to.

We would like to extend our current team with enthusiastic, friendly and driven individuals to help build this state of the art software that pushes our innovation further.

We are doing this in Berlin, the Silicon Valley of Europe, as a 100% subsidiary of Daimler that has been perfecting the art of moving people, products and services from point A to point B, for more than 120 years.

With an international team of 200 Employees, we are looking to integrate people who value quality, creativity and teamwork as much as we do. Together we create passionate technology on exciting topics that include: navigation, infotainment systems, location-based services, user experience and user interaction. And we need YOU to help us, in shaping the future!

About the role

As a Software Developer in the Connectivity Team, you will contribute in constructing connectivity middleware for our in-vehicle infotainment platform providing internet connectivity through various gateway devices for platform services and connected applications.

In an agile team, you will develop features as well as design, document, implement, integrate and test your code. Development will typically have C++ focus and make use of modern tools, technologies, engineering practices and methodologies.

Experience:
Excellent embedded Linux Programming (C++) skills
Experience in embedded systems
Experience in networking and wireless sub-systems
Knowledge in IPC, async communication, threading
Know-how in version control and CI/CD
Familiar with design patterns and testing
Nice to have:
Experience with open-source-software, scripting and CMake is a strong plus
Experience in vehicle diagnostics (UDS, DoIP)
Experience with SOME/IP
Experience with AUTOSAR
Experience with Yocto
Experience with QNX
Hardware relegated knowledge
Personal skills:

We are developing the future for good food in the workplace. Our start-up team has extensive experience in the food-tech industry and company building. We are building a culture of growth, learning and fun and looking for great candidates to fuel our Smunch Team!

Your Role:

Work together with all the stakeholders to disrupt a traditional market using the latest trends in technology to make a highly automated process from food request to delivery.

Build robust, user-driven applications to simplify processes and increase customer participation rate and overall happiness through UX.

Set, understand and monitor the necessary data points to always be a fully data-driven company.

If you are willing to embark on this mission with us, read on!

Your core tasks:

Develop frontend applications to support our product vision and roadmap using React and React-native
Help to shape and support the technology vision by using top-notch architectural concepts and software development concepts.
Be responsible for the success of the features on the tech level based on Product requirements
Ensure scalability of the platform on a frontend level
Be creative while solving the challenges you will be presented using simplicity and a lean approach
Support a flat and communication-based team organization by providing feedback
Ensure platform competitiveness by ensuring we always have the best and correct tools for the job.
Suggest ideas and quick wins for our Product

Your Profile:

Minimum 3+ years with Frontend Development (experience with Nodejs and React are a plus)
Pleasure on nailing the details
Pragmatic approach on Engineering
Experience integrating 3rd party providers
Solid software development principles (DRY, TDD, SoC)
Passion for all kind of technology
Interest on Software Architecture
Business mindset combined with logical thinking
Good communication skills

At Smunch, we ensure that your general wellbeing and happiness comes first. That’s why we offer:

Training and career prospects in a fast-growing startup
A chance to step into the exciting food-tech sector – and yes, it goes without saying that healthy and delicious food will be provided – including a healthily stacked fridge full of drinks!
A dynamic, international and experienced team of professionals
The opportunity to grow and develop your professional strengths
Exciting work environment
Flexible working hours
Regular team events – we love to celebrate and toast our successes, come big or small!
Something for the mind, body and soul: Neck messages in the office, meditations sessions as well as yoga classes
Exclusive discounted Smunch Lunch Program
Laptop of choice Mac or Windows
BVG Subsidy and job ticket

With more perks coming soon!

We are looking forward to hearing from you!

At Upvest, we are creating a financial system in which every asset can be traded anytime, by everyone. Our end-to-end solution for asset tokenization provides the most secure issuance, distribution, and custody of security tokens. We serve leading fintechs in Europe and enable them to sell assets that were previously inaccessible to the masses. Our bold long-term view is backed by Europe's largest tech VCs Notion Capital, Partech and Holtzbrinck Ventures. Following our recent Series A, we now expand our team. Today, we count 20 talented people from 10 different countries. We are based in Berlin, Germany.

As DevOps Engineer, you dont need to have any prior experience with blockchain technology, just an interest in learning about it - we can help you learn what you need to know once you start. Were an English-speaking team, so no German knowledge will be required.

Tasks

Think Fearlessly, Act Fast: We embrace the accelerated pace and ambiguity of building a business on the frontier. We take risks and look forwards.

Low Egos, High Expectations: Although we take our work seriously, we dont take ourselves too seriously. We have hunger and humility in equal measure.

Who we are

At Lana Labs we build the next generation technology that aims to change the way companies do process analysis. We are passionate about building high quality software, always challenging ourselves to keep on learning and find solutions for new problems.

Our Process Mining engine is built on a modern stack of technologies that allow us to write high quality code fast and deliver answers to complex data mining problems to the user in real time.

We believe that working together, having fun together and supporting each other is essential to achieve our goal - to realize the worlds improvement potential by enabling people, machines & organizations to get better every day.

We embrace a programming language agnostic view on problem solving, we encourage you to make use of your existing knowledge and to experiment with new technologies. On the backend we are mainly using Elixir, Rust and Scala.

We are building the very interface that future drivers will engage with when they sit in their car, plan their journey or choose what music to listen to.

position: Reporting and Application Developer (m/w/d) Werkstudent in Teilzeit
description:
Über die Sitel Group

Die Sitel Group ist einer der weltweit führenden Kundenservice Dienstleister und Experte im Customer Experience (CX) Management. Es werden exklusive Marken aus verschiedensten Branchen betreut – von Consumer Electronics, Telekommunikation und digitalen Medien über Onlinebezahlservices sowie Banken und Versicherungen bis hin zur Automobilindustrie, zum Heizungsbau oder zur Medizin.

Das Herz des Unternehmens sind die über 75.000 Mitarbeiter*innen aus 22 verschiedenen Nationen. Als erste Anlaufstelle für Kundenanfragen stellt unser leidenschaftliches Team die Basis für zufriedene Kunden dar. Deshalb sind die Anerkennung und Wertschätzung der Mitarbeiter*innen fest in der Unternehmenskultur verankert. Zudem spielt Diversity eine wichtige Rolle bei Sitel. Das vielfältige Wissen, die Erfahrungen und die Kreativität jedes Einzelnen bilden eine wichtige Basis für den Unternehmenserfolg.

1985 in USA gegründet, arbeitet die Sitel Group heute weltweit für über 400 Geschäfts- und Privatkunden. Die Sitel Group beschäftigt in Deutschland rund 4.000 Mitarbeiter an sieben Standorten: Berlin, Dessau, Düsseldorf (Hauptsitz), Krefeld, Magdeburg, Potsdam und Wittenberg.

Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir eine/einen Reporting and Application Developer (m/w/d) als Werkstudent am Standort Berlin oder auch im Homeoffice.

Wir bieten unseren Mitarbeitern:
Unbefristete Arbeitsverträge, denn wir wollen, dass Du viele Jahre mit uns die Zukunft von Sitel gestaltest!
Attraktive Bonusmodelle sowie Schichtzulagen
Eine umfangreiche und vergütete Einarbeitung, um bei der Arbeit voll durchstarten zu können!
Interne Weiterbildungen und attraktive Aufstiegschancen in Richtung Fachlicher Experte, Team Manager, Trainer uvm.
Eine offene Unternehmenskultur mit viel Spaß bei der Arbeit und monatlichen Mitarbeiter-Events
Wir unterstützen dich im Bereich Gesundheitsmanagement, betriebliche Sozialleistungen sowie betriebspädagogische Beratungsleistungen
Deine neue Aufgabe:
QSL Programmierung (MS SQL)
Datenprogrammierung
Webbasierte Programmierung
Das bringst Du mit:
Gutes mathematisches Verständnis
Wirtschaftliche Zusammenhänge sind für Dich nicht fremd und werden bei deiner Arbeit berücksichtigt
Gute MS Office Kenntnisse und sehr gute Excel Kenntnisse
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Sehr gute GitLab, JavaScript, PowerShell Kenntnisse sind zwingend erforderlich
Gute Kenntnisse im .Net (VB/C#), HTML/CSS, MS SQL
Weitere Informationen unter www.sitel.com/de sowie auf dem Sitel Blog, auf Twitter und auf LinkedIn.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Researching, designing, implementing and maintain our new product’s backend (in Java ecosystem).
Understanding and documenting the existing product (in Ruby on Rails).
Find ways for a reliable infrastructure/product, implement and ensure them.
See yourself as a user and recommend improvements for the existing product.
Be part of developing the whole company culture and mindset.
YOUR PROFILE
Software development is not a science for you where many years of university are required for – you see it as a craftsmanship which you have to practice over and over again.
You see a product not as parts – you see it as one thing and want to take ownership for it.

OUR OFFER
Tech stack
Java ecosystem
Kubernetes on AWS
GitLab (repository, CI/CD, images, packages, issue tracking)
Postgresql
Be part of an international, professional and growing team.
Be able to really contribute to the architectural and product decision process.
And everything else you expect from a Tech Startup located in Berlin Kreuzberg: regular team events, office kicker as well as free drinks and fruits. : -)
ABOUT US

We are wundertax. We make taxes easy and stress-free.

We’re a fintech company providing online solutions for consumers to submit their income tax declarations.

Besides the main tool steuererklaerung.de wundertax also runs tailor made tax platforms for professions like soldiers, policemen, firefighter, expats in Germany, apprenticees, students etc.

Consumers can get a lot of money back with tax declarations, but it’s complicated, time-consuming and no one really understands them.

We are on a mission to change that: With specialized tax tools and modern UX, we are currently rethinking the whole tax industry.

About Us

In today's software-centric economy, speed is everything. Before Sauce, testing took too long, it was tedious, expensive to maintain and placed focus only on monotonous infrastructure issues. With Sauce, developers are free to innovate and accelerate their software development cycles, improve quality, deploy with confidence and reduce costs. Our automated testing cloud allows our customers the ability to deliver a flawless digital experience to their customers by ensuring the web and mobile applications people use every day work on any browser or device. We call that automated testing, but you'll probably just call it awesome!

The Role:

As a member of the Open Source Program Office at Sauce Labs, you will have the opportunity to contribute and lead Open Source projects that are critical to the mission of Sauce Labs. You will be part of the team that represents the company in developer and testing communities, speak and evangelize our mission and contributions to Open Source. The team also manages and oversees the usage and creation of Open Source software within the company and ensures that everyone uses and distributes Open Source software in a responsible way.

Responsibilities
Lead the development of the Appium project at Sauce Labs and help improve our cross-platform mobile testing initiatives.
Be a key person in the Appium project and community to help it grow and evolve.
Participate as a project representative in the ceremonies of the OpenJS Foundation.
Speak about the Open Source work done at Sauce at various conferences around the world.
Produce high quality, maintainable code with excellent test coverage and documentation.
Our Ideal Candidate Has:
Proficiency in modern JavaScript (Node.js)
Understanding of web automation standards like WebDriver and mobile automation technologies such as XCUITest and Espresso
Experiences in leading or collaborating in larger Open Source projects
You are a great community ambassador and can drive hard technical conversations towards a good solution
You enjoy speaking at conferences and share your experiences through blog posts, webinars, workshops, etc.
Good understanding of modern software delivery tools and methodologies (GitOps, CI/CD, Kanban)
Strong sense of ownership
Perks & Benefits:
Catered lunches + a fully stocked kitchen with snacks and refreshments
Commuter allowance and sport activities/fitness benefits to keep you moving
Free German language courses for our non-native speakers
Relocation support to guide you through the visa process
We Pet.All the Dogs() — we are very pet-friendly!
Flexible work schedule
Security responsibilities at Sauce: At Sauce, we will commit to supporting the health and safety of employees and properties, partnering with internal stakeholders to learn and act on ever-evolving security protocols and procedures. You'll be expected to fully comply with all policies and procedures related to security at the department and org wide level and exercise a 'security first' approach to how we design, build & run our products and services.

Sauce Labs is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity/expression/status, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status.

Thanks for taking a look at the job description for Mobile Developer! We are looking for an ambitious individual to join our product team for Bliq Ride.

What is Bliq?

People and goods move inefficiently today because actionable information is missing. At Bliq, we leverage data from 24M connected vehicles and Computer Vision on the Edge to build the world’s most advanced street-level sensor network. Our mission is to become the leading provider of street level data.

Join our open-minded, diverse and international team. We value teamwork, entrepreneurial spirit and technology!

What will i be doing?

Implement cutting-edge features according to customer requirements and product roadmap.
Develop, deploy and maintain Android and iOS Apps.
Drive key technological decisions around frameworks, system architecture and requirements.

What sort of person are we looking for?

You have experience in Android and iOS development.
You preferably have experience in Flutter.
You have profound knowledge of English and optionally German.
You have excellent verbal communication skills.
You have a self-motivated attitude and attention to detail.
You have a degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience that’s demonstrable (e.g. through open-source contributions etc.)

What do we offer in return?

As a member of the Bliq team, you’ll have access to:
Working with a team of motivated entrepreneurial colleagues, helping you achieve the best you can.
A culture that celebrates success, reliability and building a great community.
An open minded and fun work environment.
A competitive, above industry standards compensation package.
Possibility to quickly take over responsibility for own projects.
Truly unique work environment in Berlin’s leading space for mobility companies, The Drivery.
Flexible working hours.
Home office option.
A bunch of other great benefits, like a free gym membership, free drinks and snacks, fun team events, biweekly free lunches, and more…

TIS (Treasury Intelligence Solutions GmbH), founded in Walldorf, Germany in 2010, is a global leader in managing corporate payments. The Financial Times named TIS as one of “Europe’s Fastest Growing Companies” for 2019. Offered as Software-as-a-Service (SaaS), the TIS solution is comprehensive, highly-scalable, cloud platform for company-wide payments and cash management. For businesses, TIS creates a community of trust and empowers customers to make better decisions with 100% real-time cashflow visibility. Key benefits are lower costs, risk prevention, a higher degree of transparency and fast worldwide roll-outs. For banks and partners, TIS generates growth and revenue opportunities through continuous innovation for better payment experience.

The TIS solution has been successfully used for many years in both large and medium-sized companies, including Adecco Group, Hugo Boss, Fresenius, Fugro, Lanxess, OSRAM and QIAGEN. More than 25% of DAX companies are already TIS customers. The high level of security and deep integration of the platform with existing ERP systems is certified by ISO-27001, SAP, SOC 1, SOC 2, and TISAX. Your World of Payments. One Login.

Our Software Engineering Immersive course is a life-changing educational experience where our students learn the skills and mindsets to take on new careers as web developers. We are looking for a lead instructor with strong JavaScript experience to play a key role on our growing instructional team.

Join our team for 6 months or 1 year and earn more by teaching your craft.

Why teach our Software Engineering Immersive?

If you are looking to make a life-changing impact by sharing your love for software development with the next generation of developers, we'd love for you to consider joining our team. We deliver more than just skills training, and are looking for teachers who share our vision for a community of lifelong learners pursuing work that they love. As a full-time teacher for our flagship full-time web development program, you will join us on one of our many campuses to:
Work closely with one or more co-instructors to guide students through a rigorous, transformational journey towards apprenticeship in software development.
Become a better leader, and mentor as you learn from veteran instructors and our world-class instructional coaches.
Inspire and support students as they identify their passions and drive their own continued learning beyond the curriculum.
Adapt our global curriculum and use it to guide your teaching, building your own lesson plans as needed and contributing back your lessons learned over time.
Facilitate a safe, supportive, and energetic community that welcomes the various needs and learning styles of your students.
What do we teach?

We adapt both our global curriculum and local approach to the technical trends and hiring environment of the times and cities we work in, but today our primary educational approach centers around JavaScript. In general, our curriculum is scaffolded to follow the historical evolution of software engineering. We start by teaching the fundamentals of programming and web design through JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. About 25% of our course (normally unit 2 of 4) focuses on Rails MVC or similar framework, using that context to introduce databases, security, and other foundational knowledge. The rest of the course (units 3 and 4) focuses back on JavaScript. We cover API development in Node, then tackle one or more front-end MV* frameworks (Backbone, Angular, Ember, React). We also cover all sorts of other things that junior web developers need to know, like source control, team collaboration, and developer workflow.

We give students the chance to spend focused time building at least 4 major projects, in addition to other smaller projects and labs. About 20% of overall class time is spent on dedicated project work.

Skills and Qualifications
You are the person that your colleagues naturally gravitate to when they are trying to figure something out.
You are eager to shape the skills, minds, and careers of the newest generation of web developers.
You have at least 3+ years of experience working on a software development team.
Familiarity with Computer Science topics, such as: Recursion, Sorting, Search, Linked Lists, Stacks and queues, Sets, Trees, Search Tries, Graphs, Hash tables, and Design patterns
You speak English fluently
You have working experience in both front-end and back-end development, and are fluent in
HTML and CSS
Full-stack JavaScript (strong JavaScript highly preferred)
At least one JS MV* framework (Angular, Backbone, or React preferred)
SQL databases (we generally use PosgreSQL)
NoSQL (we generally cover MongoDB and Redis)
At least one additional object-oriented language (Ruby or Python preferred)
Responsibilities and Duties
Teach Monday-Friday, all day, for the 12 week duration of the program
Instructors will need to commit a few hours per week preparing lessons and materials, leveraging existing GA curriculum content.
Work closely with co-instructors or teaching assistants to provide students with meaningful and prompt feedback on their progress.
Work alongside GA staff and teaching team to best meet the needs and learning styles of your students.
Guide students through development of a stellar final project that will showcase their abilities to hiring managers.
Facilitate a dynamic, collaborative, and positive classroom community.
Inspire students to persevere through the challenges of learning a new skill set

As a Senior Backend Developer (m/f/d) you are entrusted with responsibility for the achievement of the goals of our customers. You are responsible for the design and backend development of innovative websites and software applications which often revolve around B2B and B2C Web shops for demanding customers.

Your duties

As a Senior Backend Developer (m/f/d), you work with an agile team to build applications for our customers. One of your main functions is to design and develop the data structure and business logic of a B2B portal or Web shops. You work closely with the Frontend developers to meet or exceed the expectations of our customers. To make this possible, you develop logic and service layers and extend or create backend APIs. This consist of databases, connections as well as integrations of external systems. This is how we optimize and improve customer experience.

Another part of your daily work is to discuss new features with the scrum team and the customer. There your role is to council everyone on the best back-end approach while getting a better understanding of the product yourself through the input of other disciplines. You actively develop features with the full depth of your skillset, and you test code before you start a deployment.

Specifically, this means:
Needs analysis, conception, development, implementation and maintenance of the backend
Development and integration of business logic and features
Bug fixing and maintenance code
Test procedures and continuation of documentation
Supporting other developers and working with them as an agile team
Constant optimization of platform architecture and ERP solutions
Documentation of new concepts and programs in understandable, user-friendly TSD
Programming of project-related software and correction of program errors
Automating routine tasks
Good understanding of the analysis of business processes and procedures
Ability to help in structuring teams and bringing an agile spirit into the team
Mentoring of Junior Developers
Your profile

As an experienced Senior Backend Developer (m/f/d), you bring the following into our team:
You know how to work with ticket managing tools like Jira, documenting in Confluence and version control systems like git.
A good logical structure of your code with inline comments so that the code is clear and transferable to other developers
Strong knowledge in object-oriented programming languages like Apex, Java or PHP
Analytic capability of thinking
Excellent interpersonal communication skills and a well-developed meeting etiquette
You are organized, structured, a team player and you are able to organize a team
You enjoy working in agile teams and you are able to build up new teams without “being the boss”
You strive to keep your knowledge up to date and use best practices
Excellent time management skills and the ability to respond effectively to changing needs of different customers (knowledge of JIRA)
You also have organizational skills, friends in creative development and openness to new things
Ideally, you also have the following skills:
Experience with Salesforce and Salesforce DX
Knowledge about databases like MySQL or CouchDB
Knowledge about Backbone.js and Vue.js, HTML5 and CSS3
Experience with CI and Copado
What we offer

As a Senior Backend Developer (m/f/d), you obviously want a flexible workplace in which you can do your job without unnecessary restrictions or oversight. You can set your own work hours, because we believe in trust over supervision. Whenever you work at the office, you will find a high-quality office setup where you can work with the technology setup you selected for yourself. You can help yourself to unlimited ice-cream, soft drinks and coffee. At lunch you can wander to local cafes or stay in the office to enjoy the catered lunch.

Because we have flat hierarchies and a quick decision-making process, you have the opportunity to really have an impact while enjoying the flexibility to work from your home-office anytime your work allows it. To get your work done you can rely on the engaged and flexible team around you, who are always there to jump in and lend a hand.

Please note...

This job is in Berlin, Germany. You need a valid working permit for the European Union and be able to work on-site in order to be considered. Unfortunately, we can’t assist you in getting a working permit or in finding accommodation for the time being.

Über Atos

Atos ist ein weltweit führender Anbieter für die digitale Transformation mit 110.000 Mitarbeitern in 73 Ländern und einem Jahresumsatz von 12 Milliarden Euro. Als europäischer Marktführer für Cloud, Cybersecurity und High Performance Computing bietet die Atos Gruppe ganzheitliche Lösungen für Orchestrated Hybrid Cloud, Big Data, Business-Anwendungen und Digital Workplace. Der Konzern ist der weltweite Informationstechnologie-Partner der Olympischen und Paralympischen Spiele und firmiert unter den Marken Atos, Atos|Syntel und Unify. Atos ist eine SE (Societas Europaea) und an der Pariser Börse als eine der 40 führenden französischen Aktiengesellschaften (CAC40) notiert.

Das Ziel von Atos ist es, die Zukunft der Informationstechnologie mitzugestalten. Fachwissen und Services von Atos fördern Wissensentwicklung, Bildung sowie Forschung in einer multikulturellen Welt und tragen zu wissenschaftlicher und technologischer Exzellenz bei. Weltweit ermöglicht die Atos Gruppe ihren Kunden und Mitarbeitern sowie der Gesellschaft insgesamt, in einem sicheren Informationsraum nachhaltig zu leben, zu arbeiten und sich zu entwickeln.

Weitere Informationen finden Sie unter www.atos.net

Our team:

In unseren agilen Teams entwickeln wir Softwarelösungen für HiDrive, den größten deutschen Cloud Speicher. Für mehrere Millionen Kunden bieten wir eine hochverfügbare Plattform an, um Fotos, Videos, Dateien und Firmendaten sicher zu speichern. HiDrive ist darüber hinaus auch als Whitelabel-Lösung die technisches Basis für andere große bekannte Cloud Speicher Lösungen.
Die Hochverfügbarkeit des Services und die extrem großen Datenmengen (ca. 23PB) stellen uns immer wieder vor anspruchsvolle, technische Herausforderungen.

STRATO wurde 1997 gegründet und beschäftigt heute 550 Mitarbeiter an zwei Standorten in Deutschland. Die wichtigsten Märkte sind Deutschland, die Niederlande, Spanien und die Türkei.

Das Hosting-Unternehmen begleitet seine Kunden auf dem Weg in die Digitalisierung. Die Produktpalette reicht von Domains, Websites, Webshops und Online-Speicher über Office-Pakete und Online-Marketing-Tools bis hin zu individuellen High-End-Lösungen und Managed-Hosting. STRATO hostet vier Millionen Domains für Kunden weltweit und betreibt über 60.000 Server in zwei TÜV-zertifizierten Rechenzentren in Deutschland.

Mit seiner umfassenden Initiative „#faireinfacht“ gestaltet STRATO Webhosting-Dienste fairer und einfacher. STRATO bietet seinen Kunden kurze Laufzeiten, eine einfache und schnelle Online-Kündigung sowie eine 30 Tage Geld-zurück-Garantie – für sämtliche Produkte, auch für Domains. Zusätzlich setzt STRATO auf eine transparente Preisdarstellung mit glatten Preisen und ohne Kleingedrucktem.

STRATO gehört seit dem 1. April 2017 zur United Internet-Gruppe.

COMPANY


simpleshow startete 2008 als Medienagentur und hat sich zum internationalen Marktführer für die professionelle Produktion von Erklärvideos etabliert. Anhand einer ausgefeilten Storytelling-Methodik helfen die Erklärexperten von simpleshow die immer komplizierter werdende Welt für jeden verständlich zu machen.

Seit 2 Jahren gehen wir aber noch einen Schritt weiter. Denn unser junges Entwicklerteam hat die Webanwendung mysimpleshow.com entwickelt, die es Nutzern ermöglicht auf Basis von Text ein Erklärvideo quasi vollautomatisiert zu erstellen und zu individualisieren. Das Tool mysimpleshow wird weltweit von Unternehmen und Privatnutzern zur Erstellung von Videos genutzt. Um dem Nutzer bei der Erstellung von Videos möglichst viel Arbeit abzunehmen, integrieren wir regelmäßig neue AI-Services von AWS bzw. nutzen Eigenentwicklungen, die zusammen mit einem Berliner Partnerunternehmen konzeptioniert und entwickelt werden. Für die Nutzerfreundlichkeit werden regelmäßig Usability und User-Akzeptanz Studien durchgeführt und ein modernes Designkonzept verwendet.

Du bist ein begeisterter und erfahrener Frontend-Entwickler

Zu deinen Aufgaben gehört sowohl das Entwickeln neuer Features für mysimpleshow, als auch regelmäßiges Refactoring und den Transformationsprozess von AngularJS zu Angular weiter voranzutreiben
Du kennst dich hervorragend aus in Angular
Du am besten schon mit AngularJS gearbeitet
Du verstehst Redux und hast schon mit NgRx gearbeitet
Du beherrschst git
Du gehst analytisch vor und schreibst sauberen und performanten Code
Du legst Wert auf eine gut strukturierte Anwendungsarchitektur
Du hast Spaß daran, neue Produkte von Anfang an mit zu entwickeln und bestehende Produkte zu optimieren und zu erweitern
Du hast ein Auge für Design sowie ein Gespür für Usability und willst uns dabei helfen, dass unsere Nutzer mit noch weniger Klicks professionelle Erklärvideos produzieren können
Du verstehst und sprichst gut Englisch und Deutsch

Our mission is to help app developers maximize user engagement and in-app revenues by providing the world’s most scalable and efficient app retargeting platform. The team

Why Xapix?
Xapix is about driving data accessibility. Our mission is to orchestrate data that connects businesses allowing people to pursue a smart and sustainable future, faster. This means speeding up developers and turning functional experts into citizen developers.

Whats our engineering development challenge?
Companies have a wealth of data trapped behind legacy APIs. These often have overly complex, inconsistent, or hard to parse data structures, which need to be queried using outdated standards. Its our job to fix that data transformation is key. Meanwhile, real-time events streams are making IoT information accessible and scalable across millions of actors. Our solution is currently used by companies in the automotive and manufacturing space, but that is just the beginning.

Join us in our office in the heart of Berlin!

What youll do:
Work as part of a cross-functional team on solving problems our customers are facing around data integration
Develop, co.design and deploy interactive, dynamic UX solutions
Take a lead on key frontend engineering tasks around our core platform
Help make Xapix a scalable enterprise software and open source components of it
Help improve how we build and operate as a team

Very familiar with building & maintaining complex SPAs
Passionate about beauty and simplicity
Pragmatic with an eye for detail and good UX
Enthusiastic about modern frontend technologies
Write secure, tested and maintainable code
Dont mind a complex tech stack comprised of Vue, RoR, Clojure, Kafka, Flink, Kubernetes
Proactive communicator with proficiency in English
Enjoy working in a small agile team
Bonus: Expertise in Ruby on Rails

Driven by Insights
Guard Rails instead of Rules
Actionable results count
Meaningful relationships for meaningful work
We know our limits - but always push them

Tackle a massive data challenge;
Join an early-stage startup and grow a team around you
Help us grow into a $1bn company

An Dich, DevOps im Jahre 2020,

Du begeisterst dich dafür, agile Projekte durch CI/CD zu ermöglichen und automatisierst die nötigen Schritte? Aktuell suchen wir für unsere Technik nach einem/r DevOps Engineere/in mit einem Schwerpunkt auf linuxbasierten Systemen für unser Büro im Herzen von Berlin, um gemeinsam individuelle, skalierbare und hoch-performante Lösungen für unsere Kunden zu realisieren.

Das erwartet dich

• Als DevOps Engineer (m/w/d) hast Du die Möglichkeit, Aperto im digitalen Zeitalter mitzugestalten und neu zu denken

• Du arbeitest nicht nur eng mit unserem Entwicklerteam im agilen Umfeld zusammen, sondern verantwortest auch in interdisziplinären Teams unsere digitalen CI/CD Anwendungen und entwickelst sie mit erhaltenem Feedback ständig weiter

• Unsere Methoden basieren auf dem Ansatz der „Lean Service Creation“ – dieser verbindet Design Thinking, iterative Arbeit an Prototypen und die agile Produktentwicklung nach Scrum

• Interessante Projekte (u.a. mit Kunden, die zu den Top 10 DAX-Konzernen gehören)

• Eine Crew, die sich jetzt schon auf Dich freut!

Das bringst Du mit

• Ein abgeschlossenes Studium, idealerweise im Bereich Informatik oder gleichwertigen Erfahrung

• Gute bis sehr gute Kenntnisse mit den gängigen Entwicklungstools wie Git, Jenkins und beherrschst eine Scriptsprache wie Python oder Ruby

• Gute bis sehr gute Kenntnisse von mindestens einem Konfigurationsmanagementframework wie Ansible, Puppet oder Chef

• Du hast Erfahrungen mit Monitoring, Logging und Skalierung

• Docker, Kubernetes, Cloud Services und Technologien wie Hashicorp Vault sind Dir geläufig und Du kannst sie anwenden

• Sehr gute Kenntnisse von Linux Betriebssystemen und idealerweise Kenntnisse des Betriebssystems MacOS X

• Gute bis sehr gute Kenntnisse in CI/CD Technologien, Automatsisierung, Arbeitsweisen und Methodiken von DevOps

• Kommunikationsstärke, Teamfähigkeit, Eigenständigkeit und Urteilsvermögen: Du bist in der Lage, technische und konzeptionelle Lösungen nachzuvollziehen und mit Hilfe Deiner Teammitglieder die beste Lösung für das Produkt zu finden

Dies ist keine Checkliste, von der alle Punkte erfüllt werden müssen. Sollten nur ein paar Punkte auf dich zutreffen, du aber bereit bist dich in die anderen einzuarbeiten, tritt mit uns in Kontakt.

Das bieten wir dir

• Einen Arbeitsplatz im Herzen von Berlin in einem historischen Fabrikgebäude

• Ein spannendes Arbeitsumfeld mit hoch motivierten Kollegen

• Interdisziplinäre Teams und dadurch Fokus auf Teamentwicklung statt Ressourcenkampf

• Zugang zu wegweisenden Technologien als Teil von IBM Interactive Experience (IBM iX)

• State-of-the-Art Tooling: wir probieren immer, die Tools einzusetzen, die am besten für den Job geeignet sind. Darum arbeiten wir mit: Slack, GitHub Enterprise, Docker, Vault, Puppet

• Kontinuierliche, häufige Weiterbildungsangebote und verschiedene interne Austauschformate, damit Du am digitalen Puls der Zeit bleibst

• Eine tolle Atmosphäre, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle und eine offene Unternehmenskultur

• Raum für eigene Gestaltungsideen

As a DevOps Engineer, you will be working alongside other developers to design tools that assist in the development of applications, but also allow development teams to deploy and run their applications in production. Our main tools are: Amazon Web Services, Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Prometheus, GitHub.

We're looking for someone that is enthusiastic about new technologies, who's excited about collaborating with other engineers, who enjoys taking ownership of their work, who wants to help us think about and design new infrastructure solutions, who wants to introduce new technology ideas, and who is eager to learn and self-improve.

In this role you will:
Ensure availability of Production and Development systems
Manage CI/CD systems and help developers with continuous testing process
Research, analyze, implement and maintain new technology solutions for infrastructure
Closely work with the development teams to improve rollout and deployment of new product features and installations to facilitate our fast paced and exponential growth
Follow the IaC paradigm and therefore automate, automate and automate…
What you'll bring along:
Hands-on scripting with shell and strong knowledge of either Python or Ruby or Golang
You believe in the enablement of autonomous teams by shared processes and modular shared infrastructure as code
Strong Cloud operations background preferred and proficiency with AWS
Good knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes
Experience with monitoring highly available systems
Experience with automation tools (Ansible, Terraform, Packer, or similar)
Experience with CI/CD tools like Jenkins or GitLab CI
English is mandatory as you'll be part of a truly global organization
It's a plus if you have experience with:
Monitoring and logging systems like Graylog / Elasticsearch / Prometheus
Networking & Security standards
PostgreSQL and Redis
Apache Kafka
Experience with Atlassian tools
Benefits:
Be part of one of world’s most exciting startups, on a mission to take over the world.
We have a close, welcoming and international community. We get together regularly for brunches, cocktail nights, football, office parties.
Education budget for attending conferences and advancing your career. We encourage you to speak at conferences and give talks!

Software is eating the world is a famous quote by Marc Andreessen. Kaptio is at the forefront of this development in the travel software industry: We offer a cloud-based travel reservation platform to our clients all over the world, which lets them provide an amazing experience to their travel customers. We aim to be the best in the industry, and in the last five years we have signed new, larger clients every single year and grew our team from 15 to 80 people.

As we are expanding and delivering our product to more and more customers, we are looking for a senior developer for our Core API team. We have a modern, API-based system architecture with different back-end systems in Python covering various aspects of our business. On the front-end side we use Angular with TypeScript for tailor-made applications on top of those APIs.

Tasks
Implement new features in our Django and Pyramid API back-ends.
Grow an understanding of the travel industry and the business cases that we solve. Use that as guidance for writing your code.
Be allowed and encouraged to challenge requested functionality and suggest alternatives instead.
Collaborate with our customer-facing consultants to plan enhancements to our product.
Help monitor our product and contribute to increase robustness, uptime and reliability.
Spot opportunities and suggest ideas for improving our tech stack and its components.
Commit and deploy code to our Heroku systems.
Advocate for and employ best practices in coding and development
Requirements
A full-stack developer, ideally with Python and TypeScript experience.
Ability to learn new technologies quickly. This is almost more important to us than having experience in exactly this or that framework.
Communication skills: to be able to talk to our consulting and customer support team in non-technical language.
Ability and excitement to dive into our product in the area of travel software and develop an understanding of how our product solves use-cases in this industry.
Good knowledge of English.
Heaps of common sense. The work environment and our development processes at Kaptio are not strictly defined, and we need someone with good common sense in situations where the best approach is not clearly defined.
Willingness to travel to the beautiful city of Heidelberg - our API team mostly sits there - or other Kaptio locations two or three times a year (Reykjavik, Iceland or Fulda, Germany)
Nice to have experience:
Django and/or Pyramid
SQLAlchemy
PostgreSQL
Heroku
Angular 2+
But really, these are only nice to have. If you are a strong developer in general, we dont care that much if you have worked with these exact technologies or not.

You get to work together with smart, driven people in a company that's growing quickly.

A friendly atmosphere with people working together and helping each other all over the company.

flexibility to take care of your family/children when required.
flexibility with regards to lowering/increasing your personal workload (e.g. having a contract that is

At 12traits we believe the path to a better future lies in unlocking the true potential of humankind. We do this through harmonizing human behavior data with psychological trait sets, leveraging a multitude of scientifically valid data perspectives that allow us to understand human beings more deeply and sustainably than ever before: ushering in a new era of personalized experiences, starting in gaming, optimized for human potential and health.

Elevating the human experience is at the core of everything we do. That core is realized through our human-touching machine learning algorithms, our unparalleled understanding of a user within any given environment, and our ability to personalize experiences in real time through integrations with various platforms and tools.

As a software engineer, you’ll work closely with data science, frontend, as well as UX design and research to create large-scale real-time data ingestion systems and triggering actions and personalized adaptations to actualize the potential derived from combining some of the richest behavioral data sets available with cognitive data. You'll not only get to push your own boundaries, but the boundaries of artificial intelligence.


WHAT YOU WILL OWN AND DRIVE
Build APIs and different integrations to ingest vast amounts of unstructured behavioral as well as contextual data to fuel our machine learning algorithm (exemplary data sources: Unity, Unreal, PlayFab, Google Adwords, Twitter, Reddit)
Build a highly scalable system that allows for real-time data processing
Build a development roadmap for ensuing product generations
Incorporate the latest findings from machine learning and psychological research into a working system


WHAT YOU NEED TO BRING TO THE TABLE
4+ years of practical backend development or data engineering experience
Proven track record of leveraging modern infrastructure and tools (e.g. Kubernetes, Docker, AWS) and large-scale data processing technologies (e.g. SQL, Hadoop, Spark)
Exceptional command of Go and/or Python
Strong background in building APIs, integrating with BI and data-processing systems
Demonstrated DevOps experience
A solid understanding of data analysis / data science
A portfolio of activities / a side project that showcases your intellectual curiosity


WHAT MAKES YOU STAND OUT
Demonstrated ability to build, lead, and scale engineering teams as well as product development in a fast-paced, startup environment
Solid experience with Java, C++, or C# considered a plus
Familiarity with (mobile) gaming frameworks such as Unity, Unreal Engine, Marmalade SDK, GameMaker Studio, SpriteKit, CryEngine
Familiarity with and interest in psychometric data


HOW WE WILL SUPPORT YOU
The opportunity to shape a ground-breaking and important idea from the early days
A high level of ambition combined with a clear vision
Highly motivated and experienced team with the relevant domain expertise and networks
A competitive compensation package with a significant equity share
Support for training and personal development
The opportunity to work in an international team in the US and Europe

position: Associate Developer/ Developer (f/m/d) - Cloud Native Projects
description:
Requisition ID: 261389
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Location: Potsdam
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Professional
Employment Type: Part time or Regular Full Time

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

Summary:
We are looking for a talented developer familiar with modern programming languages such as Java, JavaScript/TypeScript, or Go. If you are interested to use the latest concepts of cloud development such as microservices, Kubernetes, service mesh, and others to solve enterprise requirements, this is your chance to make an impact on a big scale at SAP.
The Role:
As a (Associate) Developer (f/m/d) for cloud native projects, you design and develop solutions for SAP's most important technical challenges across its product portfolio. Within a team, you build prototypes to evaluate the fit of new concepts and technologies for requirements across SAP's portfolio. Based on the findings, you contribute code that helps solving those for productive applications at SAP's customers. You get to employ state-of-the-art technology to solve requirements of some of SAP's biggest customers. You enable others to do the same, also by contributing to the SAP Cloud SDK, a set of libraries for building cloud native applications.
The expected starting date is January 2021 or later.
Experience (Role Requirements):
Good knowledge of Java, JavaScript, TypeScript, Go, or other modern programming languages
Experience with object-oriented programming, common data structures, and algorithms
Good degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related field (Bachelor / Master)
You should be fluent in English and German (written and verbal), and eager to constantly learn about novel technologies in the context of cloud native engineering, distributed systems, and DevOps.
We are looking for candidates with 0-5 years of professional experience.
Graduates are welcome!
About the team / Brand / Line of Business:
As part of the Intelligent Enterprise and Cross Architecture unit within SAP Product Engineering, our Cloud Innovation & Enablement team defines central architectural patterns at SAP and helps others achieve those patterns.

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.

A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Additional Locations:

Amazon is looking for experienced Sr. Technical Program Manager for a technology team within Alexa Search. Alexa Search is part of our ongoing Alexa Information efforts focused on reinventing information extraction and retrieval for a voice-forward, multi-modal future. We are looking for creative Program Managers to help design, develop, and deploy systems that collect and process data at Web scale; create text and data derivatives; and develop novel algorithms that use these derivatives to improve access to and retrieval of these derivatives in the context of Alexa user experiences and other Amazon services.

You will own the design and delivery of software services that cost-efficiently scale to web-size and offer a great customer experience. These services will process Big Data repositories and will be involved in all stages of text processing and knowledge distillation, from collection, to processing and cleaning, to extraction and verification. In the process, you will collaborate closely with a team of Engineers and Applied Scientists with expertise in specialized areas such as Natural Language Processing, Text Mining, Search, and Machine Learning.

You will be expected to gather business and systems requirements from internal and external stakeholders, write specifications, drive project schedules from design to release, and manage the production launch. You will work with our talented dev team to remove roadblocks and sustain development velocity. You will leverage your team to provide solutions that are highly usable, scalable, extensible, and maintainable.



This role is inherently cross-functional you will work closely with engineers, scientists, managers, and key partner teams. You will be expected to regularly present to leadership on the overall status of key strategic initiatives, overall project risks and articulate recommended mitigation paths. We're looking for someone who possesses a solid TPM background, has lead medium/large projects in the past, and has technical background and experience (ideally within Amazon or other Big Data organizations). We're looking for someone who can keep their eye on the ball and not let anything fall off the radar. Being able to deal with ambiguity, anticipate bottlenecks and escalations, set realistic (yet aggressive) expectations, and clearly communicate to all levels of stakeholders are key requirements



Basic Qualifications

· 6+ years of technical program management experience
· Prior experience with agile methodologies
· Experience with project delivery for large, cross functional projects
· Bachelors Degree or 4+ years equivalent work experience
· Strong verbal/written communication skills
· Ability to deal with ambiguous/undefined problems
· Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions to all organizational levels

Preferred Qualifications

· Strong customer focus and pragmatic decision-making
· Superior project management and organizational skills
· Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
· Experience delivering innovative experiences
· Experience in non-technical aspects including idea generation, business analysis, and process optimization
· Creative critical thinker with experience in making trade-offs
· Prior experience with machine learning technologies

Your opportunity:

As a Devops Engineer at Authenteq, you will be responsible for the improvement and maintenance of the Authenteq infrastructure and servers. Your primary focus will be to ensure the stability of our internal infrastructure. You will be working alongside other engineers and will be focusing on different layers of our product. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, and teamwork is essential if you want to become a successful member of this team.

What youll be doing:
We have a living code and product infrastructure - This means writing scripts and playbooks that will help automate tasks in Terraform on AWS.
Operate efficiently in Linux and K8s cluster environments
Setup and usage of monitoring systems - we use Dynatrace, K8sPrometheus/Grafana, Zabbix and AWS CloudWatch.
Ensure the performance, security, and responsiveness of our servers.
Feel enthusiastic about writing and maintaining our documentation.
Identify potential bottlenecks and promote solution-based thinking.
Use proficiently different containerization, automation, continuous integration, and continuous delivery tools.
Collaborate with product managers, developers, engineering managers, and stakeholders to prioritize problem resolution and ensure release readiness.
What we're looking for:


A true team player - You are open, communicative, and capable of organizing and prioritizing your work.
Someone who is proficient with Terraform and K8s deployments as well as demonstrates an ability to use other relevant tools and technologies, such as Ansible and Helm.
An individual who is an experienced user of Jenkins to support our CI/CD pipeline.
A person who understands performance limits and characteristics.
Ideally you are familiar with RESTful APIs.
Someone with a knack for benchmarking and optimization.
You possess excellent English and communication skills and are willing to learn and teach new skills.
What youll get:
A chance to join at the ground floor of one of the most innovative and exciting new startups in Europe!
A young and dynamic start-up environment with a rapid development cycle.
Exciting technical challenges to work on and great opportunities to learn, grow, and contribute.
The opportunity to shape and develop a truly innovative product with the potential to revolutionize how transactions are conducted online.
A friendly and multicultural team, based in the heart of Berlin.
Competitive salary and benefits as well as equity in a growing company.
Who we are:

Three different locations, multiple nationalities, and a fusion of cultures. Born in the Icelandic startup scene, based in colorful Berlin, active in the booming Silicon Valley - we pride ourselves on having a diverse working environment and a Scandinavian work-life balance.

At Authenteq we stand for a cultural-add, rather than a cultural-fit. After all, diverse opinions help us grow, learn new perspectives, and push for further personal and professional development. Authenteqies never shy away from a technical challenge, always push for democratic decision-making, practice agile working frameworks, stand for honesty and transparency, always stay kind and respectful to each other, care for our customers, and have fun while working from one of the office locations or home-office.

Are you ready to join us? Apply for one of the positions, dazzle us with your thoughts on the future of ID verification, and KYC, and well make sure to give you an authentic interview experience.

About Us:

In today's software-centric economy, speed is everything. Before Sauce, testing took too long, it was tedious, expensive to maintain and placed focus only on monotonous infrastructure issues. With Sauce, developers are free to innovate and accelerate their software development cycles, improve quality, deploy with confidence and reduce costs. Our automated testing cloud gives our customers the ability to deliver a flawless digital experience to their customers by ensuring the web and mobile applications people use every day work on any browser or device. We call that automated testing, but you'll probably just call it awesome!

The Role:

You'll be an active collaborator on the Live Testing team which is directly responsible for providing a reliable and unified experience for running manual tests. The work includes a mix of feature development, security and reliability tasks. It will allow you to grow in your strengths and abilities. You will find an eager team who will support you and provide the opportunity for you to grow together. We are not looking for individuals that can do it all, collaboration is key. We want to be proud of what we build but also kind, flexible and calm. Especially in a crisis.

Below are a few real examples of the work we've done lately:
Unified the manual testing experience allowing users to quickly upload their own apps and test (more to come).
Added monitoring to our services to watch usage and catch any potential problems.
Worked with other teams to create a new storage solution for client applications.
Improved CI/CD for a better, more reliable and faster development cycle.
We are looking for an experienced candidate but we don't expect you to know it all in your first week. We are looking for someone with solid fundamentals, who can teach, learn and work together on a team.

Key Responsibilities:
Research and prototype new products and solutions using open source technologies.
Participate in the entire development life cycle, from planning through implementation, documentation, testing, and deployment, all the way to monitoring.

stenon offers the world’s first real-time soil analysis solution for agriculture.

FE frameworks like React or Angular, Python) that not only works but is maintainable. You always strive to pick the appropriate tools and technologies for the given problem.

ABOUT US

At Ada, we envision a world where everyone has access to the healthcare they need. In one of the biggest challenges facing the world, we pioneered a new form of artificial intelligence, combining medical knowledge with intelligent technology to empower millions of people to better understand their health. We're proud to support medical doctors and work with leading health systems and global non-profit organizations. We're a diversely skilled team representing 50 nationalities, and we're growing rapidly to achieve our global ambitions for the future of health. This is just the beginning.

ABOUT THE ROLE

Seize the opportunity to make the world a better place as a DevOps Engineer (f/m/x) in our Tech Services team, based in our Berlin HQ.

Our team is working on different topics to help people/teams across the org to proactively improve the ability to deliver, maintain and support products, such as: infrastructure (Kubernetes clusters, databases, cache stores, buckets, CDN), alerting and monitoring, CICD tools and improving SDLC processes for Delivery teams.

RESPONSIBILITIES
As a DevOps Engineer at Ada, you will be responsible for extending and improving our container-based AWS / GCP infrastructure, running in Kubernetes.
Continue to automate away human toil.
Partner with your colleagues from engineering across the company to embrace the idea of self-service tooling, making the best way the easiest way.
You will contribute to resilient CI/CD pipelines/processes to make sure that our engineering team is able to deploy features faster while being compliant to regulations.
You enable a high quality and fast IT environment for services and resources for engineering and/or data teams to run their Java, Kotlin, Python services backed by MongoDB, Redis and Postgres within Kubernetes clusters.
Extend and maintain our automated monitoring and alerting systems.
Work in highly regulated environments.
Train Developers on Infrastructure and Automation topics.
REQUIREMENTS
You have a strong background in automated provisioning of AWS/GCP environments.
You have proven experience in distributed systems debugging.
You can demonstrate a deep understanding of the intrinsic link between infrastructure and software delivery lifecycle while maining a system thinking view of the business.
You have experience with Kubernetes, Terraform, Docker, AWS/GCP, Jenkins
You understand the SDLC process.
Focus on Security Engineering and InfoSec
You understand the importance of distributed tracing and systems thinking expressed in metrics, visualized through graphics to make meaning intuitive.
Our tech stack: Java, Spring Boot, Kotlin, MongoDB, Redis, Docker, Kubernetes, Node.js, Python, AWS, Google Cloud Platform and Istio
You have expertise in agile environments (Scrum or Kanban) as well as in following principles in continuous delivery
You are good in communication and collaboration within your team
You are ready to coach other Engineers across the company
You bring creativity and the ambition to strive in a constructive and multicultural team
You are happy to share, learn, teach, communicate and document things every day
You are fluent in English
BENEFITS
Work with a high level of autonomy in global, cross-functional teams with smart, purpose-driven peers
Perks include complimentary onsite German language classes, discounted Urban Sports Club memberships, quarterly team bonding activities, regular social events, and healthy office refreshments

CONTACT

We are looking forward to receiving your application. For further information please contact our Senior Talent Acquisition Manager Ahmet Kivrak at any time at ahmet.kivrak@ada.com.

Please note that all applications need to be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail. All your information will be kept confidential according to GDPR guidelines.
Any commercial activities concerning this advertisement will not be appreciated.

Freelance Software Developer Testautomation (m/w/d)

Der Start ist auf mitte August 2020 angesetzt mit einer Laufzeit von ca. 6 Monaten. Die Auslastung ist mit Vollzeit geplant.

Entwicklung und Pflege von einer Softwarelösung zum Testen mehrerer Webanwendungen durch Ansprechen von REST Endpunkten und per Oberflächentests
Indentifizierung und Entwicklung geeigneter Tools und zusätzliche Funktionalität
Entwicklung von Lösungen, um Testdaten zu generieren und zu verwalten
Zusammenarbeit eng mit den Product Ownern und Testern zusammen, um neue Anforderungen zu erarbeiten und umzusetzen

Anforderungen an Sie:

Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder vergleichbarer Studienrichtung, alternativ mehrjährige einschlägige Berufserfahrung
Erfahrung im Bereich Softwaretest/Testmanagement
Kenntnisse unterschiedlicher Test-Tools
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Java und JavaScript oder anderen gängigen Programmiersprachen
Erfahrung mit HTTP, REST
Von Vorteil sind Erfahrungen in: Angular, Spring, Spring Boot, Jira, Confluence, Maven, Jenkins, NoSQL, Kryptografie/PKI
Teamfähigkeit, eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Lernbereitschaft
Deutsch als Arbeitssprache (ab B2)

Maximilian Müller

Business Associate

Kelly Services GmbH

independent.contractor(at)kellyservices.de

Kelly Services ist Ihr Spezialist für die Vermittlung von Fach- und Führungskräften. Wir bringen Sie mit genau dem Unternehmen zusammen, das zu Ihnen passt. Eine Vermittlung über uns ist persönlich, vertraulich und unkompliziert.

YOUR MISSION

As a Senior DevOps Engineer at Parloa you will continuously maintain and optimize our systems towards increasing reliability and scalability. You will have the chance to put your experience into practice and play an important role in the decision-making process.

Tasks
Be responsible for running machine learning pipelines within Kubernetes, including GPU support
Take over of scaling up our infrastructure to multiple machines as each our client runs a separate machine learning model
Run VoIP headless softphone behind a Session Border Controller
Take monitoring and recovery processes in your hands
Be responsible for deployment process for high availability system
Support the technical sales how Parloa can be integrated in the network architecture of a client
Analyze, propose and drive technology improvements
Requirements
Work experience of at least 5 years with DevOps technologies
In-depth practical knowledge of Kubernetes
Experience with long-lived connections within a Kubernetes cluster, like websocket, gRPC or other streams
Work experience with infrastructure provisioning and needed components
Experience connecting Kubernetes clusters with external services via VPNs
Nice to have:
Hands-on experience with Azure Cloud and scaling of Redis and MongoDB
Experience with Machine learning with GPU support
Experience with VoIP
Benefits
Be part of a dynamic, driven and international team with flat hierarchies and collaborative company culture
Training and development budgets which can be used for conferences, attending development courses to ensure continuous professional growth
Flexible working hours and possibility to take additional vacation days
A great company culture with regular team breakfasts, BBQs on the balcony, games night or other social activities
Voice meetup with over 1500 members in regular events
And last but not least: a beautiful office with flair in the heart of Berlin with all the conveniences, such as adjustable desks, social area, fresh fruits, cereals and drinks
Company Techstack: TypeScript, Kubernetes, Docker, MongoDB, React, Redux, Inversify, Lerna, Koa, Jest, Cypress

We at Parloa believe in the revolution of how businesses talk to their customers with the help of artificial intelligence. Ever since our company was founded in 2017 in the heart of Berlin, Parloa has become one of the leading SaaS platforms for Conversational AI. Our aim is to build the most comprehensive solution in this sector for enabling every company in the world to have better conversations with their customers. We pursue this vision with the highest standards of technical engineering and combine it with innovative leadership and a strong commitment of every team member to reimagine the future of customer communication.

position: Working Student (f/m/d): Software Development and Operations of the HPI's Future SOC Lab
description:
Requisition ID: 221268
Work Area: Software-Design und Entwicklung
Location: Potsdam
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Studenten
Employment Type: Teilzeit, befristet

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

ABOUT THE TEAM
The SAP Technology & Innovation (T&I) board area is responsible for SAP’s overall platform and technology development such as SAP Cloud Platform and SAP HANA. In addition, T&I drives the incubation and adoption of intelligent technologies like Analytics, SAP Leonardo Machine Learning and Internet of Things (IoT) across SAP’s product portfolio. The T&I board area is also in charge of SAP’s global innovation agenda and builds new business model- and market driven innovations to help customers realize the most business value. Within the T&I board area, the Central Engineering unit is the operational backbone of Juergen Mueller’s Chief Technology Officer (CTO) function. It comprises several teams addressing all architectural and conceptional questions to ensure engineering excellence throughout SAP.

As innovation-oriented company, SAP also works closely with academia and among others supports research projects as industry partner of the “Hasso Plattner Institute (HPI) Future SOC Lab”. The Lab provides a free of charge high-performance IT landscape for academic research and offers an experimental base for work on innovative concepts in highly complex real-world IT systems. The results of these research projects are presented at the biannual HPI Future SOC Lab Day.

THE ROLE

As a student (f/m/d) for Software Development and Operations of the HPI Future SOC Lab you will be part of the Strategic Backing team which is a technology-focused group that was built to help shaping the future generations of SAP software. You will be working closely with the team on dedicated software engineering challenges. This is a great opportunity to gain practical experience and increase your knowledge.

Tasks of the HPI Future SOC Lab include but are not limited to:
Further development of HPI Future SOC Lab’s user portal with Python and Django
Analyze the needs of users and shape the Lab’s strategy
Support project management including the organization of the one-day conference “HPI Future SOC Lab Day” twice a year
Other exciting projects are waiting for you. Examples:
Engineering at SAP – an interactive portal for SAP’s developers to learn about the company’s technology strategy with hands-on examples and tutorials
SAP Graph – a developer friendly interface to SAP systems making development with SAP APIs even easier
SAPPHIRE and TECHED preparations – creating demos of SAP’s largest and most important customer and developer events
ROLE REQUIREMENT
Student (f/m/d) - preferred field(s) of study: Computer Science or related fields
Computer skills:
Programming skills in frontend (e.g., JavaScript, Polymer, ReactJS) and/or backend (e.g., Java, SQL, Node.js) technologies as well as source code management (e.g., git)
Knowledge of database systems is a plus (e.g., SAP HANA, CouchDB)
Experience in DevOps is a plus (e.g., Continuous Integration using Jenkins or Travis)
Language skills: Fluent in German and English (written and spoken)
Soft skills:
Eager to learn and hands-on working
Reliable and open-minded
Strong team working skills
Determined to reach a goal in time
Ability to work independently and to prioritize tasks
WORK EXPERIENCE

This position is an entry level job and no further experience is required. We are looking forward to your application and getting to know you!

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.

A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

At the Innovation Center in Potsdam (ICP), some of the many perks include free shuttle rides from Berlin Westkreuz to the ICP and back, free lunch at the canteen with an astonishing view at lake Jungfernsee as well as about 250 colleagues from all over the world. We are looking forward to your application!
Please add to your application a resumé, cover letter and if available, references from other employers.
